review: I built this amazing mansion in the mountians on an empty server. 20 minutes into Rust and Chill I hear a knock on the door. I'm alon. Who the hell is that. I look outside. Noones there. I hear the knock again on the same door. Noones there. I load up my armor and shotgun. I talk on voice in English German and Russian. The same phrase "Who's there."No answer. A third knock. I get naked. Run to the top of my building and hop down managing not to kill myself. I look around. Noones there. Is it a bug?I here a Hello that echos from muliple people. All the same voice. thirty naked players with spears come out of hiding. All linked to the same microphone like a reverb of death. "One of us" They all start chanting. The sound echoing over and over. They give me a spear. I start chanting "One of us."The server count went from 2/250 to 75/250 Then 200/250. The naked Ninja wars had begun my base in the middle. Armed with rocks spears and bows. We defend my fortress our fortress. Naked bodies hit the ground in droves. All my spare rooms full of as many sleeping bags as we can muster. The intruders starting to loose the war bring out assault weapons. We stick with bows. Darkness comes we aim for the flashes of gun fire. The army of naked ninja are victorious. It's been 45 minutes. The machine gun ninja are gone. As fast as the naked ninja showed they were gone. Singing "One of us" from the voice of one man accross multiple mics. The server count is now 1/250. I am alone. Naked in the middle of winters and slowly freezing to death. I get killed from a bear.

review: &lt &lt &lt ABSOLUTE BRUTALITY&gt &gt &gt 7.5/10The best way to describe rust is Adult Minecraft. There's nudity brutal intense combat and long term resource gathering. You can build almost anything from a &amp quot shack" to holytits off fortresses. So the core of the game is difficult sure but learn some preservation skills and even the bears wont with you too hard.What does you HARD is the community of cod bros reliant on "jackal tactics" similar to cod bros found in the pubg playerbase. If they don't dome you from across the map they'll get lucky and walk into your blindspots right AFTER you check them if you do spot them they'll isntantly headshot you with the basic pistol if they miss by statistical miracle they'll hatchet you to death even if they're as naked as you they'll try sneak up and rock your skull from behind (usually and instant kill). In any event social isolation is a tactic much like real life.Even if you manage to get a base up ANYWHERE other players regularly patrol roads and mountains (where the most important resources spawn) armed to the teeth so one has to take care to set up out of anyone's way which is nearly impossible because everyone has shacks ready to go EVERYWHERE.It's sad cause at its core I ing love this game and tried more than most games to GIT GUD at it but simply put if time spent gathering resources &amp guns your at a starting disadvantage from everyone else each new server. This can be said for everything sure but if you're not having fun along the way why even ing bother?

review: This game is not what it used to be. First of all out of all the unoptimized games out there this one takes the cake. Update after update this game is getting more and more unstable and the devs don't seem to realise that they're pushing the Unity Engine (an engine that isn't made for open world games in the first place) to the limits.Second this game is just simply unfinished. The netcode is laughable the devs are adding unnecesarry stuff to the game instead of refining what's already there and it seems that Facepunch rushed this game out of Early Access just to raise the price tag. Unless Facepunch gets their stuff together and actually fixes this game and its declining player base I'd say to not bother buying this game.

review: Instead of messing with facial hair the following should be done immediately to improve my rating Force client server compatibility. Srsly each server on the server list should be queried by facepunch for the server version. Too old? Don't list it! Allow IP based connections. Hundreds of times I connect and it's failing for some reason. Decrease load time. Srsly I use highly optimised Linux system I have 8 core i7 CPU i have GTX 1080 and still it takes tens of seconds to connect. Sometimes I just want to know if my house is still there why can't it be available in preview or stats? If the whole world is generated on the client and server doesn't need to transmit all terrain data why does it take so long? There is a speed limit in the game why load the WHOLE world in the beginning? Remove regular wipes. They already have a plan to do this only no smart enough developers to do it. Progression is already there but too small there should be a penalty for killing much weaker players e.g. karma penalty. Lots of karma needed for higher tech or maintaining larger number of blueprints whatever. And the incentive for resetting one's life? Higher karma cap. Karma could also improve aim resource finding luck HP or whatever. Just like cash in GTA XP in RPG games skill in CS GO. Solo play. This is a must. I won't be playing with some if I don't want to that's it. If this has to be a multiplayer game provide a trustless multiplayer system. E.g. when I choose my teammates create a bond between us result in karma penalty for team kill or team steal. Add the obvious bonuses of partying like more loot or less hunger. Otherwise I won't play solo and whole game at all. Full technology tree stats etc. This is crazy that I have to open Rust wiki to read item description Rust labs to see how much axe hits the door will take and all that stuff. Making me count manually how much sulfur ore will be converted with 1000 wood idiotic. If it's a minigame make it beneficial for winners. If this is just a mechanism then let me insert wood here ore there and make the burning result orthogonal from the layout of pieces inside. And fix the burned food already. I can pay 1 wood more for cooking if only the whole meat will cook without burning. Make it easier for solo players in the very first phase! It's okay to have wooden doors destroyable by satchel charges available for second day players. But it's ridiculous to have door locks forcing me to stay in house as long as a strong enemy wanders inside because losing a key means losing every item ultimately. When everyone has code locks raiding is gradual if you want more loot you need more C4 but door lock key grants you whole access. This should downscale to 0 day gameplay too! Farming is useless. Killing a bear (if you can find any why? there should be some no build zones with lots of animals hunting grounds) gives me this much meat that I won't care about farming ever. Nobody does. It's still silly that just after the wipe someone can find AK and kill others very easily. Look at the previous points or introduce technology limitation for item usage AK is too complicated to use for a 0 day player. I hate leaving my palace too often. There should be more crafting scrap prices should be 10x less or I should be able to produce it myself. A very low profile highly secure slow way to survive in highly endangered environments. A reactor or whatever. Like in starcraft if your vespene gas resource runs dry it still yields a little amount until you find a better place. Scavenged tools suck. It should either yield 100 with a hit or give 2x sulfur than metal one or more high quality ore. It's totally unworth it's price. It's nice that I can have a quarry but it's so difficult to find the resource I need. And to have a wood plant. I think 15x15 with 2 3 floors should be enough to have a large patio inside with large furnace small forest a few quarries and everything else required to be self sustainable and allow slow progression. It should be extra difficult to raid and could be used to start wars with other lords. Today usually you die once you lose and wait for another wipe. Teleports should be added. Or okay I can have multiple bags so just add the courier service. E.g. a black box I lock it and select who can unlock it courier can't do it. The game estimates the box value (in sulfur?) and the distance based price for shipment. And either the NPC or other player moves it. Being a courier should be profitable enough to encourage players to do it. Losing a box other courier gets the prize. The game should split the island into separate lots. A building right would affect a single lot. Occupying more lots requires more karma etc. When you open a map it should be visible which lots are occupied. Lot sizes should prevent people from building their houses to close to each other. A team could occupy two neighbor lots and merge them into a 2 lot etc. Conquering a lot far away from your base costs you a lot of resources.

review: Haven't realize how Rust has change me as a person. Ever since the very first day of playing I was hooked like a crack baby. Then like an adult who just blew all his money on crack you hit rock bottom. Thats what I hit after playing Rust for months. Then once you stop something comes back to you. Might be withdrawls or maybe its because its fully immersed video game that makes feel like you are actually there. Having to spend hours on end to get anything done its just something that makes you feel achomlish so much. Even though its just a virtual world. The developers update so much ever since they made the game which makes it like no other. Overall Its a great game and it is unforgivining from the survival to the other players but by playing you will learn alot and most of the time the hard way. Thats okay though because playing Rust gives you an experience like no other. I could write more but I would rather have you play it to get the full affect. Hope you enjoyed Rust as much as I did.

review: I've played Rust now for approximately 100 hours in which most of it has been spent complaining to my friends on Discord saying "I'm sick of doing virtual chores if you need 10k wood go out and get it yourself. I want a gun and a flame thrower".Finally after several hours my wish was granted. I then proceeded to watch another player from afar create a modest but nice looking solo player base with wooden walls and metal doors. After waiting about an hour for him to do as many virtual chores as possibly I moved in towards his base. I started burning his base down while one of my chore nagging teammates door camped him to protect me. He was ferociously trying to build stone walls inside of his base to protect his tool chest but to no avail. I broke through the wall stole all of his stuff and then burned his TC to the ground.He re spawned and called me about every name in the book and ended it with "I hope your whole family dies tonight".Since that encounter I've played almost every night until 2 3AM and I have no problem doing virtual chores with the potential of knowing that I could case so much havoc in a single game that it could make a player want to kill me IRL. I haven't felt this kind of rush since I played Halo 2.10/10 would reccomend.

review: Have you ever wanted to hate a game enough that you originally buy it to experience the tumor of a community and end up with over 1500 hours and a severe addiction to it? Welcome to Rust an unforgiving toxic enraging survival game that will take you on one hell of an emotional rollercoaster every time you pull up the launcher. Unless you are very knowledgeable on the game don't enter a high pop server and expect to get anywhere especially official servers. This game is fairly straightforward to learn if someone is teaching you yet terrifying to learn on your own. The more hours you have in Rust the more apparent it becomes that there is never a time where you don't have anything to do in a server. Once you learn how the game works you'll end up spending 6 hours on a server and think you were only there for 30 mins. Coming back to the emotional rollercoaster portion of the game you can literally get everything you've ever wanted and more in game just for some naked guy with a waterpipe shotgun to ruin the rest of your day with one buckshot round to the chest. Is Rust Fun? Yes but it can also you off really easily. Should you buy Rust? Only if your friends play it it's on sale or you REALLY want it. Is it addicting? VERY. Unless you have the willpower of Hercules to just drop Rust at any time you'll find it difficult to just put this game down. Overall Game Rating 8/10Community Rating 10/10 or 26/10 depending on your sense of humor.Developer Rating 7/10 Facepunch is very good at patching game breaking bugs quickly (as of recent) but struggle at creating and implementing new content smoothly. This can sometimes make for a negative experience until the problem is patched or adjusted to. SIDE NOTE** If there is one tip I can give to anyone beginning their Rust experience this would be it Never ever trust a soul. Anything that breathes or moves in Rust (and even the stuff that doesn't) has the potential and capability of killing you and most likely won't hesitate to do so.

review: The game is out of Early Access and from now on there will be a monthly update and blog post on the first thursday of every month. The first thursday of a month is also the day the servers get restarted and everyone starts fresh on a new procedural generated island. The craftable things you learned stay except there is big changes to the component /blueprintsystem then the blueprints will be reseted aswell.Being out of early access doesn't mean the game is finished check out the roadmap and more at https //rust.facepunch.comThe game is still pretty hard and unforgiving. Expect to get destroyed alot. Playing as a lone wolf is hardcore but I am still loving it. If you are playing solo you gotta play smart and sneaky. The easiest way to survive is to team up with other players but be aware that they can backstab you any time so better bring some friends that are trustworthy.

review: You know before all of this "New" rust crap came out this game was amazing. It took no skill whatsoever so you really had lots of competition who can build the tallest structure. I would see some structures that would tear through the sky... higher than the planes would fly. I would see hilarious road blocks and the only way around it was a 20 minute hike. I would see towns. Lots of people would come together to build a large town with hundereds of houses and many trusty people. The modders where actually a lot of fun except the ones that shot you through the walls of your own home they all can burn in hell. I remember at one time this amazing thing happened it made me think that this was the best game ever. At around 3 AM in the morning (Real time) and it was night in the game. Many people were still on the server (Keep in mind it was an official server so there were hundereds of people). I was minding my own business trying to make my house the biggest one on the block. I heard many loud gun shots and they were very very close. I saw the little profile picture icon of the enemy on the bottom left of my screen. His voice would get louder and louder he was right outside my door. I was so scared because I could see how he looked through the little holes of my house and he was wearing green kevlar and I could see an AK in his hand. He would keep knocking on my door so I can open it. I built a little scout room at the top of my house so I can view what was going on. (My house was on the side a very buisy road many people would cross). 5 Minutes later I could hear a very faint noise. I would try to guess what it was and as the other person would come closer I could finally wrap my mind to what the noise was. He was about 10 meters away from my house and he was playing an Ice cream truck song. As he would get closer it would get much louder making me laugh way harder. He played the song for about 2 minutes until the guy in the Kevlar spotted him and shot him. He was just trying to sell ice cream... what a poor man. I couldn't stop laughing to the point I woke my parents up. This doesn't happen anymore. It's so hard to find creative people to do stuff like this anymore. Now peoples' main objective is to raid your house to steal your items. Thanks for the wounderful time you guys gave me. Rust is dead.
title: Rust

review: The game is hair pulling levels of difficult but can manage to be fun or maybe I'm just bad I dont know. The thrill of fighting over an airdrop or finding people with better loot and completely blasting them with crossbows. The joy of raiding someones base with satchel charges and explosive bullets this game is great for getting thrills over being a little s h it. Even though I said good things about the game it still feels unfinished. I really would love to see the radiation animals come back and maybe make the cargoship event more common and items such as the bleach duct tape paper maps sticks wind turbines etc have a use in game. I have a feeling it would greatly improve the game in a crafting and building sense. If you have 39 dollars and you dont know where to spend it and you own this game buy it for a friend! DOverall I think this game needs work but still is great this game is super enjoyable by anyone that purchases it and begins to PVP. Only thing thats a downside is offical servers getting door camped and getting shot with AK's when you have nothing really isnt that fun.

review: I bought this game back in June 28th of 2014 and wow I will say it again in all caps WOW. Now don't let the small amount of hours fool you but I play solo usually and whenever I can which is quite recently been more often as I shifted from being done or stopped playing other games.Never would I have thought a simple game could have been evolved into what it is today. I remember when the game was on its old engine and when they upgraded it. Not to mention the continued support cooperation of both Developers and players in this game has made it a tightly knit community that has its many pros and less cons even as far as changing the entire system of the game's mechanics in order to try and make it more balanced. The game has never been so much more fun and I am officially happy to have given the makers of this game my $20. If there were any other additional things I could add to my game (aside from skins and the sorts) I would buy that up like it's the end of the world.

review: RUST is an unforgiving experience designed to punish those who are unwilling to learn it's mechanics to the fullest. I made the jump several months ago after loving every playlist from VERTIGO a very popular Twitch and YouTube gaming celebrity. Knowing full well that the journey ahead would be frustrating I took the chance anyways. It didn't take long for me to realize that this game is certainly not for everyone.Your LOVE or HATE for this game solely depends on how much you enjoy hardcore PvP. There is no break from this. Every minute of this game is stressful online or off. The community is saturated with toxic players who thrive on slaughtering new spawns (NAKEDS). Unless you have a group or are some kind of immediate solo play master then you will never witness what the "BEST OF RUST" videos has to offer. This is not to say that RUST isn't enjoyable and those who have lovingly devoted hundreds (or thousands) of hours into it have done so for a reason. In the right hands RUST is a dream come true. It's pure chaos and a constant survival of the fittest battle royale of yelling screaming and betrayal. It caters to those who hate catching their breath and embrace death as another opportunity to start fresh and seek revenge. I DON'T RECOMMEND this game if you are like me A devoted but casual gamer that enjoys the idea of foundation. If there was some kind of PvE servers where bases didn't degrade without loot grinds players bonded more for a social experience and teamwork was valued over new player domination I might jump back in. Until then I will not be touching this game for a long time to come.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a great game if you like survival games and are looking for a game to put all of you time and effort into. I spent about 2 days straight on a server trying to get enough materials to raid a big clan in which we did. I would say this game is best played as a group because of all the other groups but solo can still be fun. Be sure to have someone teach you how to play the game or look up tutorials because its hard at first but trust me you will be a god in no time. If i had to rate rust i would give it a 10/10 because of all the great times ive had and all of the memories i will have with this game. One thing i dont really like about rust is the tc and bp system i mean there great and all but i thought the point of this was to make zergs less powerfull but they can send out 4 people to get 100k stone easly. Now the BP system idk its great its just i see clans getting lvl 3 on first day and getting aks and Other than that rust is a great game and will always be because facepuch is a ing machine when it comes to developing rust. &lt 3 16/10
title: Rust

review: I would love to give this game a 9 or 10 because in so many ways it is such an incredible game which can immerse you for weeks and steal your whole life but there are a few small things that absolutely ruin the entire experience as a solo player or even in a team which i hate so much and i personally feel are game breaking/ genuinely ruin the game and make me rage delete it. One of the first things is that you die in about 1 2 seconds 90% of the time. Even when you have gear and good weapons to fight back there is no mercy and most people have aim assist cheats to headshot you and even if they don't it's LITERALLY (no exageration) as easy as 2 quick pistol shots (pew pew) to the body and you are dead and all your stuff gets robbed. This means most of the time you don't have any time to react or fight back you just see somebody one second and are dead the next. Which is absolutely ridiculous IMO. You can sneak around all you want but if someone sees you and wants you dead you are dead instantly. The second thing which they need to fix is Scrap or lack of it. It's probably the most essential farmed resource in the game and most sought after because of what you can do with it like research amazing weapons and stuff for your house in order to survive a map wipe. However you get barely any scrap when farming like none at all and if you recycle loads of metal like items then you get a fair amount of scrap but the recyclers are sought after in busy servers so it's not even worth trying IMO and the places you get pathetic amounts of scrap from are filled with people who (you guessed it) kill you in 1 second and then take all your scrap and all your gear which took you ages to farm. The most recent server i played on (before i deleted the game) i had a success rate of 1 out of 7 scrap runs in which i managed to make it back to my base with scrap and you need like 3 or 4 trips to even build something basic like a workbench level 3. So forget about ALLLLL the other hundreds of things you want to research as well. and remember that you need to replace all your stolen gear and guns every time you die as well so basically you run out fast. The thing that upsets me is you can be really successful with every other type of farming and resource in the game... but farming scrap (the thing you need the most to progress and become epic) is just brutal time consuming detrimental to progress and dangerous. I don't enjoy it AT ALL and genuinely can never progress or research anything or even build anything. I hate it. I hoard loads of amazing items but can never research them to use them. They just sit in my boxes. Yet i can have 60K of pretty much anything else EASY. They need to start giving way more scrap and making it easier to collect in random or quieter places for the players like me who don't want to set up camp in between 3 clan bases or hundreds of salty aggressive nocturnal players. The third thing is for those looking to buy the game is that if you don't have a super good spec computer or laptop then good luck playing any kind of PVP. Even on 'potato' setting I've had my game skip 2 frames and remember what i said earlier about how you die in 1 second??? Yeah well imagine you are turning around and your game lags for like 1 second and pewpew you are dead and theres nothing you can do about it. I even bought a top spec gaming pc and it ran on the highest graphics. The game was amazing and beautiful and never lagged or skipped..... YET I WAS STILL DYING IN 1 SECOND TO 2 PISTOL SHOTS W/O LAG SO THEORETICALLY THERES NO DIFFERENCE BETWEEN A POTATO PC AND ULTRA GAMING PC BECAUSE YOU F******** DIE INSTANTLY. It's just beyond stupid and unnecessarily brutal/punishing. Alllll that hard work and skill and stealth.... gone in 1 second because the developers "want to make a real brutal experience" THAT. If dark souls made you die in 1 second every time you saw a monster NOBODY would play it and it wouldnt be famous. They atleast give you like 2 or 3 hits you get me? Even lasting 5 seconds in this game would be nice. The reason i don't recommend this game is because these things really break the game for me and just don't make me feel rewarded for my hard work. It does the opposite it like laughs at you for spending 8 10 hours a day almost even when you play at night when less people are on so you can get rarer stuff only to not let you progress and research anything youve collected and also to just kill you in a second and have all your stuff stolen no matter what gear weapons gaming specs you have. It punishes you for loving the game and wanting to do better in such a stupid way. If they fixed these issues theres no doubt Rust would be one of the greatest games ever made seriously but I can't recommend such a peice of unfair garbage like this which doesnt reward my hard efforts and playing every single day during a 1 month wipe. The only people who don't want these kinds of rules enforced would be lame salty toxic players who love feeling like big boys because they can aim 2 little shots correctly and kill anyone in a second and take their stuff. It's not cool or impressive. It's super lame. I'm not mad at the individual players. I never shout at them. I'm mad at Rust the game and the developers it's their fault this game can be trash at the best of times and worse of times. Ive listened to hours of podcasts and interviews on youtube from famous rust players and they all agree these things are a joke and thats why they are leaving the game. FIX IT DEVELOPERS. Make the game more enjoyable.
title: Rust

review: I've payed EVE Online for a long time and I thought LowSec was shoot on sight until I played RUST. In RUST as a new player you have two choices 1 install your own server and play alone on it and enjoy the minecraft experience of it or 2 play on a public server and pray all the gods you don't cross another player in the first couple of hours otherwise you'll be shot dead. No hello no warning. Just ... shot for no reason. You only have your starting rock and you'll be shot not for loot.I come in a public server once in a while to check if the community changed and it haven't yet. Fortunatly I got the game while it was inexpensive but never was able to enjoy it fully because of the players on the servers.TO THE DEVS you could learn of EVE on two aspect here. security rating you shoot with no reason you'll loose point. and High security sectors NPC police patrol and they are invincible so if player attack a player with no reason he's killed by the police if you're too low security and you enter you're killed too. People think twice for shooting in HS and people that want PVP and the rush of adrenaline of it ( when ready !!!!! ) go low sec. Allow everyone to play the game thought !

review: This game is by far my favorite game ever. Also the game I hate the most.Ill tell you the story of my greatest rust adventure. this was on a vanilla server. My friends and i happened to be hella rich at the time. When the 2 biggest clans on the server decided to raid our 5 man base. so it was around 30 v 5. The base raid lasted for just over 3 hours. There were enough explosions and shots to attract almost all the players on the server. Enough in fact to attract the AI helicopter which roams around the game following shots and shooting and killing geared players. Well the Heli is what ended up saving our asses in the end. It flew in just long enough to distract the raiders for me to repair our base. sadly after they took down the heli one of them (Who happened to be cheating) flew into one of our tool cupboards and got building privledge to blow our base from the top down. Yeah Dont Read All Of That The Game is ing bonkers Ive put 43 days in it i should knowThis game might be one of the most frustrating but its also the most rewarding.Id rebuy this game 10 times over.

review: When I got this game in early 2014 I thought it would be a great survival. Rust claimed to inherit the best from such giants like DayZ and Minecraft. And it was so until Garry decided to remake the game for Unity.Let me describe the gameplay of an average daily dose. First you discover a fine PvP server (PvE is boring huh?). 40/50 players online. You think it's great more people more fun. WRONG. Even if the map is big enough time to time you naked with a rock wielded will meet people willing to kill you and get that precious rock.Speaking about rocks. Even this starter item has durability and you don't have a chance to say find it anywhere. Also it's the only way for interacting with the surroundings in earlygame. So you have an only one chance to get at least a stone hatchet. balance go for the nearest tree count hits run like about a mile smash stones and pray you'll not get wrecked by some of 24/7 playing people.Fine you managed to get a hatchet. Now you have to build your base. Stop how do you suppose to lock it? Sure you have to craft a lock (codelock preferred). But you'll need a blueprint for it. Fine. For a lock you have to get some metal fragments. How will you get them? From the furnace! How will you get a furnace? You will need to get some rocks and a LOW GRADE FUEL. It is made from animal fat so you'll have to hunt for it. Animals are bugged in Rust so forget about melee weapons. Get a bow and some arrows. Where? Again you'll need recipes for them. But bow is crafted from cloth which is also got from animals. Devil's circle huh? No. At this point you start to hunt for ing BARRELS. Starter recipes and loot are there. In earlygame you're not supposed to get them from Radtown so you have to run like a retard all over the map hunting for barrels. If you're lucky enough you'll get everything needed for a simple twig house in 2 5 hours.Spent a whole day gathering stuff built a fine stone house on a top of a rock not killed by a miracle. You lay down sleeping in your house and thinking of newly obtained safety log out. YOU'RE WRONG. 99% probability next day you'll find yourself laying naked on a shore with a rock in your right hand. Your house is looted and smashed into pieces.Why? F*ck balance that's why. 24/7 players are f*cking killing machines. You'll never get into Radtown they constantly secure it. You'll never get airdrops they're for ones who play in stacks of 5 people all the time. So you'll never get decent recipes clothing and weapons. "F*ck you customer" says Garry and adds ROCKET LAUNCHERS in the game. "F*ck you Garry" I say and uninstall this handful of cr*p from my PC.3/10 3 is for people who don't have a life or like constant butthurt. They might like Rust.

review: Rust really takes the cake for the open world survival genre! Regardless of the map sizes having their limits they are massive and filled with amazing terrain and resources. Not to mention the diverse terrain still allows for you to build the coolest of bases on them!The game is extremely polished for only being in alpha and shows amazing potential up to this point with very concurrent updates and community featured items in game. For right now the amount of character customization is not available as it randomly generates your appearance but you can just as easily wear some neat gear that makes you stand out apart from other players.The combat in this game is very fun although it might need a little work. It feels extremely rewarding when you successfully take down and enemy or player with nearly any weapon. Whether its a rock bow and arrow rifle or otherwise you can guarantee it will feel awesome when you kick some with it. Another thing to add is that the weapons feel fairly balanced and while gun play is very powerful and dangerous it makes it all that much more rewarding when you have worked hard to earn your gear and weapons.In summery if you are into survival games and don't know where to start by all means pick this game up. You will be sucked into it for days and have quite an adventure.

review: Rust is Love Rust is Life.What used to be a buggy rendition of a wasteland crafting game has now become an amazing group (or solo) base building loot gathering gun shooting arrow sniping bear mauling base raiding masterpiece. The content upgrades are great because the Dev's really care about their game and do weekly content progress news and with the garbage xp system gone now there is a lot more progression it feels like without the time grind. This is starting to feel a lot like the golden legacy days where I spent most of my time. Now you just have fun in the game in a casual way while you build your base through killing animals people and resource gathering (amongst other things). I love this game and after 500 hours in Legacy and now 800 in what it is now I can still recommend this game extremely highly for those looking to have a great time. 11/10 would buy again. Best $20 I ever spent period. Most fun I've had with friends long term since WoW and that's saying a lot. All you need is a group of friends and a good server that you enjoy and you're set. Definitely a game to put on your wishlist if you don't have it already.

review: Here are my initial impressions of the game. Its in alpha but seems to be relatively bugfree just content light at the moment.My first hour in the game went like this Spawn get some wood run around looking for stone find one node get killed by player spawn again find one node of stone get killed by player spawn get killed by wolf. I jumped around to a couple other servers having similar results. But finally on the fourth attempt and server I manage to finally find 2 nodes of stone without dying make a stone hatchet but then realize I'm going to die of starvation. I run around looking for wildlife til I'm at zero food and I start losing health. Finally in desperation I run toward a big player built house. 2 people in armor come up to me point guns at me. I use built in voice chat to ask them if I could trade all my metal and sulfur for some food. They give me 10 food which is enough to last for several hours. I thank them and run off. That same player runs into me two more times checking me out to see if I'm trouble and ends up helping me two more times finally giving me a pistol and 9 bullets.By the end of my first 3 hours I finally have a little wood shack a campfire crafting bench a sleeping bag for a respawn point and a storage crate with a decent amount of supplies. So do I recommend this game? I think it highly depends on who you run into in the game whether you enjoy the initial hours or not. Or you could bring a RL friend in with you and then once you finally find each other in the wilderness you'll have a blast assuming you like tense challenging survival games. Either way once you get over that initial painful beginning process (and definitely check out a guide to help with your first hours) you just might have a blast with it.TL DR Extremely hard game that needs more content and some difficulty balancing for the first hours. Bring a friend. And remember that its in alpha right now but has lots of potential IMO

review: This game has a great deal of promise. Dayz and Infestion Stories exist to cater to the "murder and hunt people" crowd and I'm hoping Rust develops into something more complicated then a murder simulator. The base game is already there allowing people to play and survive the environment which is a significant challenge. But unfortunatly the Dayz a holes are infiltrating the game so time will tell if this game will evolve into what it can become rather than devolve into another Dayz clone..etc.With emphasis and incentives toward cooperation against the environment the game will become what it needs to become. For those that disagree and wish to grief people all day there are already several games made for you.

review: EARLY ACCESS title (dam gud 1 doe) devs update the game every Thursday while a community update lands on Tuesdays. I don't know that I've played another EA title that was this reliable and promising insofar as whether or not it'll be complete one day. However I'm guessing that this game might be one of those types that update every so often even after release simply to add new features and balance existing systems.I haven't ever played a game quite like this. You're thrown into an extremely large map with only a rock and a torch with which you're to survive. If you're playing on a popular server there are many dozens of other live players crawling the world around you. This game revolves around PVP that's a big portion of the game though that isn't to say there isn't a heap of content to be discovered in other areas of the game. The social aspect of the game is pretty fantastic... I met my first real friend after he bested me in a bow fight. We continue to add cool dudes to our pool of players and the group dynamics are unreal. The ritual for the past week or so has been to hop into Discord after work and browse the server list with them.Everyone has their own roles and specialties despite everyone being plain human beings in game. There are those who aim like robots and shine in firefights (which further branches into shotgunners snipers assault riflemen et.) those who run around a fight healing others/dropping strategic structures and supporting the group as a combat medic/engineer of sorts and then there are those amazing architects who prefer building massively convoluted compounds rife with traps and a variety of turrets.I don't write reviews well but I hope this gives you at least a teeny bit of insight into Facepunch Studios' crown jewel a thoroughly entertaining experience with near unlimited replayability RUST.EDIT The magic of this game disappeared a few updates back. No one I used to play with regularly plays anymore. The game has no direction and this unfortunately leads to questionable updates. Personal opinion.

review: Is this still in beta? Whaaaat not?First of all you cant demolish what you have built. If you made a mistake you will strike the wall etc for a very long time to demolish it. Once you are further into the game you can make C4 to just blow it to pieces. I cant because I'm still in the beginning and I'm sure I'm done with this game. How hard can it be to add a demolish function? The random generated maps looks bad and there is no nice scenery to it. You start off almost starving and have to run around trying to find apples or granola bars somewhere. This is located at fixed points but if you move away you need to hunt. Well try to hunt something. This is the hardest thing to do because there is almost nothing to hunt. No 3rd person? Come on this must be beta right? The only thing I like about Rust is the building system. Its really awesome and everything snaps into place without problems but demolishing is a problem. This is not recommended if you are used to better versatile games like ARK. Yes with all ARK's bugs its recommended above Rust.

review: I once played a game called Rust. In my game i built a nice little shack.On my shack i affixed a door. A snap of a twig!Outside called two voices one high one low.We wont hurt you! They called. I didnt open the door.Again they called.But i didnt open the door.Once more they called!And this time i opened the door.And behold! A naked man!A naked man who beat me to death with a ing rock and stole my shack. Welcome to rust noobs.

review: Currently more than 2 years after release date the game is still very buggy. When logging into a server even if a server wipe has occured just two or three days prior the maps are all very similar in scenary and also in that they are over run with maxed out players in fortresses and player killers.Don't get me wrong the game is fun to play but very buggy. This is a pure survival game and the worlds are very brutal. It is hard to trust anyone in this game as there are always Player Killers just over the hill from you and coming your way. I don't complain about this because I understand the game is meant to be a realistic survival game as possible so I dig that but trust me 95% of the people you come across will be trying to kill you. The scenary is something to appreciate as well.What I don't understand though and what leads me to believe this game is a scam is that it's been an 'Early Access' game for over 2 years now. When you read the latest and greatest patch notes there are many minute and minor changes where the developers claim to have 'arranged the UI ' or 'tweaked the look of water ' 'enhanced loading times in hills' etc etc.. This game is based upon a 'Downloadable Engine ' hence why there are so many of these games currently out at the moment. And it is up the the developers / programmers to be smart and crafty enough to make an actual game out of it. And sad to say after 2 years I'm not so sure the Rust Devs have it in them...AFTER 2 YEARS this leads me to believe that this game isn't really going anywhere and that the developers themselves are just soaking up what they can for as long as they can. I'm sure I'll be hated for this from the current community of Rust Lovers but I'm not giving this review for them I'm giving this review from my perspective for the people that have yet to buy this game. It can be fun for a couple of days but don't count on this game actually ever leaving it's Early Access stages and becoming a real quality game.

review: The original version was great fun however I feel like they got carried away when they remade it... I'm not a fan of the randomly generated map as it makes the game lose a lot of its character. They have added a hell of a lot of weapons and features but it feels spammed and they forgot about "quality over quantity" You also need an SSD to run the game which they should make obvious in the requirements. If you had a HDD drive you can expect to wait 30 40 minutes just to load into a server. This is due to the fact you have to load every single game asset before joining the server rather than the standard practise which is to load assets when the player is within a certain radius of them.I big part of the problem is also the fact that the devs do not know how to optimise the game so on a HDD you will experience a lot of glitching and FPS lag which is the worst in PVP survival games.

review: I absolutely hate to write this review but as of July 7 2017 this game is in a crappy place. The dev team is basically ran by one man who is making huge and hurtful decisions to the game. Things like gunplay have been changed and broken by this dev and he has ignored it for a month now. This game will always stay one of my all time favorites but as of now I cannot reccomend this game to you. I somewhat still enjoy playing it. review: As my hours would tell you this game has a lot of potential. The experience you have depends on the server. If you only play on a server with a player base all you have is that.Of course the community is mostly bad it's a survival game where you benefit from stealing players' Did you expect a post apocalyptic survival game to be all rainbows and kittens?People dont seem to understand that nakeds pose a threat to even geared players. "WAHH THIS GUY KILLED ME WHEN I SAID I HAVE NOTHING". You realize that on most servers there's no indication whether or not you have a gun? If someone is close enough to you you can get one shotted and ta da you lost everything."WAHHH THIS GAME IS SLOW". Play modded."WAHHH THERES TOO MANY PEOPLE". Play on a low pop server"WAAHH THERES SO MUCH GRINDING". Modded.The performance on this game is pretty though you need a decent rig to be able to get 60 fps. Base building is fun but it's quite complicated. It's all trial and error. Your first however many bases are gonna be complete You're gonna get raided. That's part of the game learn how to manage your losses. There's tons of videos online that can guide you on how to build.Clans. Oh lord. If you're on a big community server and aren't part of a big 20 man clan you're in for a rough time. But once again it heavily depends on the server if you want a more engaging experience play on a lower pop server.Not sure why some people have little hissy fits about skins. It's a microtransaction that in no way affects the core gameplay. You're not forced to buy it. Want to support the devs with a little cash and like what you see buy a skin. Although you can get a few of the cheaper skins for free by just playing.This game isn't for little whining babies hoping to rule the world and have it handed to them although there are servers that cater to that.Overall i love the game. I've had some great experiences with It has its rough edges but the devs seem to be doing a decent job at trying to appeal to every type of player. Of course they get wrong *cough* Components! *cough* but they always seem to be communicating with the community to try and fix it.

review: This game used to be fun you had the choice to do whatever you wanted you could choose to go look for blueprints in order to craft some cool items such as an AK or just farm resources to build a cool house.Now the devs have changed this game so it fits those new players liking in order to sell more games (it's completely okay) but they really don't pay attention to those people who helped building this game by playing it first.before weapons killed people now even a headshot with an AK 47 doesn't kill a ing naked. Basically if you are a skilled player with a good aim but find yourself in a 1vX situation chances are you'll die because you'll need at least 6/7 round to kill a geared player ...Before you could really "socialize" with other players even if they had weapons you could knock on someone's door and talk to them without fearing of being headshot by some roofcampers. Now you can spawn and get attacked by some fresh spawner for no reason just "because it's fun to hear that hitmarker sound". This is how the community has evolved. Devs have added a lot of PVP related content but nothing really concerning survival although it's a survival game. Animals are bugged they glitch a lot and that's really annoying on the 1st day of the wipe.In conclusion I think the devs focused their hardwork on things that didn't really need to be changed the Blueprint system. Now clans get whatever they want even more easily...I really feel like the game I used to play back in summer 2015 was 10 times better it was more fun more skill based now people just join clan and dominate servers because it's 20+ of them... it's all about run till you get something good enough to fight back aka the bow level 7. yay.Those clans usually starts as soon as the server is wiped and by the end of the first day of the wipe they already have SAR or Thompsons. I won't play this game until they start focusing their hardwork on stuff that matters.

review: First of all you have to understand that the playerbase is not "Toxic" as people say they are simply playing this game as brutally as they can. This game was designed for PVP. If you really want to learn how to play the game outside of that I suggest you play on PVE servers on your first go NOT ON THE PVP SERVERS. Otherwise you are going to be killed non stop because on PVP this world is all about ransacking and killing others for your own survival. I do own a server (Rusty Panda) that is PVE because I don't like to play just to kill other players for my own survival. Honestly however? This game is beautifully built for HARSH PVP so don't be shocked if you get killed over and over again. If you don't like that it is pretty easy to find a PVE server instead. Go PVE to learn the game then to PVP to test yourself against others. This is a great game although they developers need to do more with optimizing it's graphics so you can play it smoothly with a good middle ground video card. It is designed with NVIDIA cards in mind so it can be pretty hard on any other type of video card.

review: Let me just start off by saying that I used to play tons of Rust and have 256 hours on record. I just came back and installed it again today because I haven't played the game in a while and wanted to see what they've done with it thus far. I enter a server and the first thing I notice is that my character is a female. I quit and uninstall the game because I can't change this. I'm honestly tired of this t agenda that the devs are trying to push about political correctness and "acceptance". It's a ing video game nobody on planet earth gives a about your ing stupid social justice warrior crusade. Is it really that hard for you to let me pick what I want my character to look like in the game that I paid for so that I can enjoy it? I'm a guy in real life and I want to be a guy in game. Seriously this garbage game is never going to get anywhere if that is their biggest concern. This game has been around for what like 3 years and has been built again from the ground up and this is the kind of that they are focusing on putting in the game? No wonder it's dying so quick. I am officially done with rust for the time being and the only time I would ever consider coming back is if they actually start fixing this steaming puddle of dog that they call a game instead of focusing on gender equality. Yet people question why in the recent years video games have declined so terribly. Overall I would say that if you are looking to buy this game. don't. save your money and put it towards something better the community sucks anyways. It's only been getting worse since they stopped developing legacy.

review: I actually like this game. No love it. It's the first time I've played a survival type of game like this and I'm hooked. It's addicting as hell. There are negatives to this game in my eyes but first let's start with the positives.PositivesThe game has this original survival build your way up to glory aspect that has finally been done with humans and realistic graphics. It's Minecraft done differently in my opinion. Whether that's better to you is based on what you think. Me? I love it. It's Minecraft done way better. It also has this great atmosphere. You start out hopeless hitting a tree with a rock while butt naked. But once you learn the game and learn how to craft spears tools and clothes you start to like it a lot more. Then you hunt for animals to throw spears at to get food and leather then you gather lots of wood to start building your own home. At first it feels tedious and boring but then it gets a lot better and you get hooked. Soon you'll be living in a stone house with guns and armor. It takes time to build up to this kind of setup and it feels satisfying once you do. It's also way more fun if you bring some friends along with you to survive. The graphics are good aside from the ugly tree leaves and a bit of super muddy textures on some stuff like dumpsters which I assume is because the game is still in development. I've seen stuff about a future graphical overhaul which will be pretty sweet. The audio is also well done especially the death screams. Whew the chills.NegativesNow are there negatives? Of course. No game is perfect. The game is a bit unoptimized. Luckily my EVGA 960 with 4GB VRAM can run this game without sacrificing a lot of visual sexiness. The game still looks pretty good with the settings I have which is great. The animals also have the ability to walk up boulders and mountains and walk through walls which is distracting and frustrating especially when you're chasing an animal with a wooden bow and he gets away by running through a wall that you can't run through. You also can't choose your gender or race. It feels kinda PC but I think it's always been that way. Well times have to change because I hate it. I'm forced to be a black woman. I want to be able to be a hispanic colored man in a game if I want to and I'll proudly say that to a feminist's face.There's also the toxic community I hear about on official servers. They always KOS (kill on sight) with no mercy and stomp on the little guys that are trying to enjoy the game. Clans raid and slaughter everyone. To their credit it is how the game is meant to be played but it's no fun to any newcomers. The best way to avoid these Hitlers is to join empty servers. I always play on modded servers with little to no people on them and I've actually made a few friends on said servers. Now the XP system. My opinion on it is it can work but it's not good right now. On vanilla servers XP takes way too long to get. It's annoying and grindy. I always make sure the modded server has at least 3x or more XP gain to get rid of the grinding. The best way to fix this is to take off new items costing XP to unlock and at least double the XP gain to make it not such a nuisence. There's also the blueprint system I hear people talk about all the time but it honestly doesn't sound good to me.SummaryThis game is great. It's fun and is unique to what I usually play. I got this game in a Humble Bundle for $4.96 and it was 100% worth it. Should you buy? If you're a fan of survival games or even Minecraft YES!TipsHere's some tips I have put together to get the most out of your Rust experience Empty the Parallax Mapping Anisotropic Filtering and the water option bars. I gained 30+ FPS by doing so. Of course if you have a beast PC don't worry about this. Join empty modded servers to get a singleplayer kind of feel. It's dumb the devs haven't added a singleplayer option like Ark and Minecraft have. Look for servers that have a XP multiplier plugin to get rid of the grinding. Servers with a map plugin are also nice although this isn't often. Modded servers with a small playerbase are usually nice and don't KOS immediately. If you want a friendly server those are the best ones to look out for. Don't launch the game in DX12 mode. It's laggy and the water was a solid lime color.

review: I have over 1200 hours and don't recommend this game to anyone. Reasons 1) The original Rust used to be a blast (name was changed to Rust Legacy when they stupidly decided to rebuild the game from scratch). The new version of Rust was no where near as fun and has had so many redesigns that you can never quite get used to the game mechanics before they change them again. 2) The community is the very incarnation of toxic behavior in the gaming community.3) The game has been "early access" for 3 years. Since they decided to remake the game the progress has been incredibly slow. I can only conclude this is because Garry is either lazy incompetent or just simply doesn't give a about his game after he becoming a multi millionare.4) No Direction / Endgame. Let's face it rust has always been a "loose" concept. The idea is to survive and eventualy grow more powerful after you have grinded (gathered) a bunch of and then fight other players but after you have done that then what? Originaly the game had zombies which actualy made the game midely interesting but then in all garrys infinite wisdom he felt that concept was not good enough for his game. But the fact is A concept is better than NO concept! And what happened to the radiation AI animals they replaced zombies??? The new rust doesn't even have them... At least they posed a threat and would chase you in a pack.5) Garry Newman recently made statement asking bored players to "just stop playing" which is an insult to early backers of the game like myself and others who have 1k+ hours in the game.6. Lack of general gameplay mechanics that you come to expect in modern survival games. Rust may have been one of the catalyst's for the survival game genre but it has sure fallen behind the curb in recent times. The game still has ZERO vehicles. A legitmate AI threat. Just to mention a few things.7. Broken promises from devs. An example of this is Rideable horses which was promises/hinted at over a year ago but like with many things in rust which the devs "tease" in their dev blog it never comes to fruition!8. Unfair focus towards large groups aka "clans" and a huge disadvantige against solo players. This never used to be the case in the original Rust aka Legacy. At least in the old rust you would actualy stand a chance to survive on your own but not so anymore...

review: I really want to enjoy this game more. It has good graphics and great gameplay. I have two reasons for rating the game down however. Poor censoring system. Even with the censoring systems models are fairly revealing. Censoring as of now only puts small pixelated boxes around what needs to be censored. I do not see why this is the current censoring system as opposed to clothing on the default model. I feel as if the lack of censoring the player model is more of a publicity or sales stunt as (in my opinion) this takes away from the game's survival aspect. Even if they just left the lack of censoring as it is then they should at the very least fix the censor setting from turning off seemingly randomly. The developer's have refused to allow customizable characters. The game forces players to be a certain race and gender. I don't see why even a simple customization option could not be implemented. The xp system is sad. You must level up and then spend experience points on recipes. In a survival game you should have all the recipes unlocked in the first place. In my opinion the success and capability of a player in a survival game should not be dependent on how many hours they have grinded experience for.In the end if you can get past these issues that I have then you will enjoy a nice survival experience. For me however these issues take away from the gameplay and so leave me with no desire to play the game as of now.Here are some sites for reference if you want to read more about the second issue. http //steamed.kotaku.com/rust chooses players race for them things get messy 1693426299 http //www.gamespot.com/articles/your gender in rust is assigned to you and cant be/1100 6438731/

review: Pros Intense Gunplay and Combat. (Although a lot of balancing needs to be done) Long Progression for a multiplayer games. Games can last up to a month. Fun with friends. Absolutetly HUGE potential this game COULD be an absolute mastepiece. Good UI and Good Audio Video Gameplay and Control options.Cons Does not feel like a survival game. The damage model is too low. (Most weapons especially fire arms do too little damage) Bullet Velocity is too low combined with the games movement speeds which allow for bullet dodging. (Not as bad as it was in Rust legacy but its still pretty bad) Progression is too fast. Guns are way too asscessible for large groups of players. I feel it would be more apt that guns be much more rare and muskets should be the main firearms clans uses to fight each other. The Developers delibertly making items useless in the game by either 1) Nerfing them to the Ground.(Heavy Sheet Metal armour is one example) 2) Increasing the crafting cost of that item to a point where that Item is not worth crafting (Wooden Barricade Barbed Barricade are 2 examples) New updates are lack luster and dont fix of any of the games many imbalances or add in substaincial way to the enjoyment of the game. Many Items are near useless and a pain in the to craft. (Wooden floor spikes for example can be destroyed in 5 hits with a metal hatchet they decay and cost 300 wood and take 1 minute to craft.)

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place. (Review at the end)Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.I actually really like this game and it is my most played game ever. I started playing 6/12/15 or Developer Blog 69.1 (A Minor Update) and I was absolutely clueless on what to do. If you are new I REALLY recommend from staying away from Official or High pop servers until you learn the ropes. You can play solo or with friends each brings a different experience to the game. The community is always fun to deal with It just really depends on the server and area that you are at. They can either be complete savages or some of the nicest people you will come by. Anyway all of this is just my opinion and review now it is time for you to write yours.

review: I was so excited for Rust. It has so much potential and is a great idea but it is not even close to being there yet.First off the serves wipe every update (which is monthly as ive noticed). It is horrible to log on and have everything you own gone and have to start over.Gathering resources can be a grind but that is to be expeted with this style game however you can never truly build up supplies because you are killed or the server wipes.My biggest issue with the game is that you can not play in a private world with friends. I think this would be the perfect game for a group of friends to create there own little world and work for total domination. All servers have to be public which means you can never have a game to yourself and there is ALWAYS some who just goes around a destroys everything you work for.This game will break your heart leave you off and pretty much hating life.

review: Plays like a poor performing DayZ. Servers are overpopulated with 8 12 year olds constantly yelling at everyone and having tantrums. The maps are boring and sparsely vegetated but PACKED with players so it feels like an MMORPG starter area and everyone is waiting for wood respawns. The mechanics for logging in/out of servers are absolute garbage. When you log out you're permanently sitting there so beaches are littered with dozens of "sleeping" players who have logged out. Because the maps are so densely packed with players you're pretty much guaranteed to be killed when you come back and have to start over again. The crafting system is terrible. If you get a lucky drop you can bang some sticks and animal parts together and make an AK 47 sounds about right.

review: Negative points Takes FOREVER to load when you log in to a server never took less than 30 min and up to 1h. YUP. 1H. Not to mention that it does it EVERY TIME YOU LOG even if you already played on the server recently. Game often crashes. And then you have to log in again with the same waiting time. People will kill you on sight. Even if you just spawned. It's disapointing to die every 5 min before you could build anything. And even if you manage to build something out of solid rock some guy will come and wreck it in no time just to steal your 3 lame items. Players are trash talking all the time. Racist homophobic and sexual comments non stop. Building system is bugy and quite bad. Positive points + graphics are decent even good if your computer is a beast.+ research system is interresting.Overall i had an unpleasant experience playing this game.If you like survival with a reasonable amount of PVP i strongly recomend to play 7 days to die instead. It's way better in every way except maybe graphics. (faster to load building system is cool you can play offline etc.)

review: After my 700 long hours of playing this game by my self and with my team. Here's a review for all you that keep messaging me on my friends list If it is a good game.Rust is one of my favorite survivalist game and it beats DayZ The Forest or any other game that you must survive i na big world.Legacy beats Experimental/New Rust by a million. It's the original rust and is always fun and can be really competitive with groups on a pvp server.Unfortenately Legacy is abandoned and the amount of hackers have increased rapidly but lucky there are most servers with great admins who ban hackers quick.(LEGACY) PVP If you have a team on Rust atleast you and someone or you and 2 5 others. And you get stacked and powerful fast you become demolishers. That's if you know how to aim a gun. If your unfortenately by yourself then i wish you good luck if a team sees you in your house and decides to attack you and raid you.(LEGACY) PVE PVP is disabled your all good from going out there and looting and then shot in the back you do not have to worry about that with PvE. The only thing you gotta worry about is getting raided but you do not have to worry about getting killed. I suggest newblies to start out on this type of game mode to get the bases of a protected good house before going to PVP and building some big house with the walls of your house only protecting you. Also good gamemode to learn the world of Rust to know were every road will lead you to and were you are if you spawn in a field.This is a perfect game all about team work and killing as a team. Also having fun solo and surviving.

review: Rust? What is Rust?First I need to highlight the fact that this can be an extremely intense game. If you looking to run in the fields with your friends pick flowers chase butterflies and have a good time... your in for one rude awakening and this is certainly not the game for you. Plus you are looking at starting over a few times due to being raided and possibly betrayed.I grow tired of individuals giving a bad review due to the community being nothing but toxic. Unfortunately they fail to grasp the concept and the nature of this game. Every player on the server (Unless you started off with a large group) have to aggressively gather resources and build themselves up as well as their bases. So do not be suprised when you meet another player and say "Hi I'm friendly" and they respond with a bullet to your head. That particular individual has no idea of your intentions thus he will kill you first before you do to protect his items. Do not trust anyone as betrayal is a devastating possibility in the world of Rust and may leave you naked and with a rock once again.Every encounter you face is adrenaline fuelled where you are left shaking after victory and as in pain from clenching so hard. Regardless if you are the attacker or the victim it is experience I have never experienced in any other game before i.e Once I was mining got a pretty decent amount of resources whilst on my journey I discovered a AK 47 with a decent amount of ammo. I did not have the recipe and was really excited to learn it as I needed it badly. Not long after I was discovered by a group of enemies and they chased me throughout the forest. I hid in a bush and about 6 enemies ran past me and I could hear questioning where I went. That was the longest 10min of my life... I was sweating shaking and frozen in fear that I would be discovered and killed thus losing my AK 47 and the chance of learning the recipe. Eventually they left and made it home safely... thats when I realized that I love this game as I have never been so drawn in. Even to this day you feel the adrenaline pump when attacking a player or chasing down a air drop.You start off with nothing other than a rock you soft innocent skin and a torch. Now its up to you to fight for your survival or be utterly decimated on the journey. Be prepared to lose everything you worked so hard for be prepared to be shot at on site as this is a surival of the fittest and once you accept that your gonna have a freakin' blast.I have always enjoyed this game and the best couple of buck I have ever spent.
title: Rust

review: Rust is one of the worst games to buy. I have 8K hours of play time i would know how bad the game is. the PvP in rust has no skill gap at all anyone can just get on the game and spray ak easy. you also have to spend hours farming for bp's and you cant even get good bp's out the barrels like you could in the old BP System like you get no reward now. solo player would never have a lvl 3 work bench because it takes way to long to farm it and the raiding is aids to before if you were a high hour player could get a base if they knew how the building worked but guess what all the low hour people were saying it is unfair that they could do that. so they took it out the game. now to raid a base you need to farm for like 24 rockets becaues sheet metal now takes 8 rockets to blow. Getting scrap is very hard and not for people in small group's or solo. the game is only for the fat zerg's now. Let's get more on how the PvP is bad though. First the ak before in the old Bp day's the ak took alot of skill to use becaues you just couldnt spray from 100 meter's away you had to tap which means you had to have some what of good aim. Even when you sprayed the old ak it was hard so you had to get good with it but guess what player's in rust didnt want to spend time in a game to get good with it yep you guessed it all the low hour noobs. Now the new ak anyone can spray it and yes that does mean your 80 year old grandma she can hop on this game and kill someone with hours. And the Dev's still dont think that is a problem becaues they havent changed it. To be fair i dont even think the DEV'S even play there own game to see the problems in there game. i dont think not once they have played a wipe and gone through what me and you go through they only care for the roleplay things now. They would rather add a chair in the game then to actually fix the BIG BUGS in there game. One more thing to this game will never be optimized they say they work on it but every week i get the same FPS sometimes even lower so if you dont have a good pc then dont even spend your money on this game it runs like i think thats all i have to say about this game. IF THE DEV'S READ THIS PLZ JUST FIX THE PVP AND MAKE IT TAKE SKILL AGAIN.

review: For the chocolate cake you will need 3 large eggs175g (6 oz) self raising flour175g (6 oz)caster sugar175g (6 oz) softened butter1½ level tsp baking powder40g (1½ oz) cocoa powder4 tbsp boiling waterA little icing sugar to serveFor the chocolate spreading/ganache icing 150ml (5fl oz) double cream150g (5oz) plain chocolate broken into pieces4 tbsp apricot jamTo make Mary Berry's chocolate cake recipe you will also need 2 x 17cm (7 in) deep sandwich tins greased and lined with non stick baking paperMethodPreheat the oven to 180C gas 4.Beat together the eggs flour caster sugar butter and baking powder until smooth in a large mixing bowl.Put the cocoa in separate mixing bowl and add the water a little at a time to make a stiff paste. Add to the cake mixture.Turn into the prepared tins level the top and bake in the preheated oven for about 20 25 mins or until shrinking away from the sides of the tin and springy to the touch.Leave to cool in the tin then turn on to a wire rack to become completely cold before icing.To make the icing measure the cream and chocolate into a bowl and carefully melt over a pan of hot water over a low heat or gently in the microwave for 1 min (600w microwave). Stir until melted then set aside to cool a little and to thicken up.To ice the cake spread the apricot jam on the top of each cake. Spread half of the ganache icing on the top of the jam on one of the cakes then lay the other cake on top sandwiching them together. Use the remaining ganache icing to ice the top of the cake in a swirl pattern. Dust with icing sugar to serve.

review: This game is for you if you like racial slurs. This game is for you if you like to play with little kids. The object of this game is basically kill as many naked people running around on a beach with a rock as you can. That's it. So if you like this kind of game then jump right in. I'm currently playing Miscreated and I've ran across a couple of pretty cool guys. We decided to play around a bit. You know. Watching each other's back and stuff. Running around and looting and taking on other survivors as we see fit. You know tactuflly. You have to be smart in that game. And it's actually fun. But in this game as soon as you jump in this game people start saying "i'm going to you up" (with a rock) because that's all they have. And then if they decide to be nice and pick you back up they'll take your rock so then you have no means to gather anything. But really the only purpose in gathering anything is to basically just hand it over to someone that decides he wants to kill a naked black guy running along a beach. All this wouldn't be so bad if the maps were larger but it seemed like no matter where the game decided to spawn me was around a bunch of other naked people or even people with guns. I have no idea why people that are well fortified in their base with guns and stuff would want to kill a fresh naked black guy running on the beach. I guess their attention deficite disorder got the best of them in school and they had to find a game like rust to occupy their mind while they grow up. They'll probably be doing the same thing when they grow up to be about 40 because they have no attention span to do anything else but kill fresh spawns in this game.And to top it all off one of the rules on the server I was playing was... get this... No griefing. HAHAHI'll get my refund. And I'll go back to playing games for adults.

review: Best game ever made. Hands down.In my own words Rust is a brutal survival simulation with a caveman like feel. In the beginning you start off on an "island" naked and equipped with a few items and a rock. Players are to gather and collect resources with this rock. As of right now there is a pretty extensive inventory/crafting system Large servers to small servers weapon crafting and modification such as sights lasers and surpressors. You gather wood and rock to craft items for your survival needs such as shelter fire sleeping bags and also the abillity to cook food.The day night cycle in this game is beautiful. What really tops it off are the fires that people make. You can be standing on a cliff and look down and see five or so fires and run and take everybodies stuff! or if you are like most players in this game you will help them out or team up with them.That brings me to my next topic PvP. It really isnt bad in this game. If you run into someone they usually dont kill you unless you bother them or dont respond. There are so many friendly and helpful players out there in the Rust world to guide you along the way. If you want you dont even have to play on a PvP server Servers with no PvP!Teaming up is great and highly recommended in this game because you and your friends can go your seperate ways gather resources and then trade or put them in the storage chests!BUY THIS WHILE ITS STILL CHEAP AND IN ALPHA!!!!
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: Rust is a brutal game. There are a lot of negative reviews here but honestly if that person has anything less than 200 hrs play id ignore it. Youll notice its usually a person who has just been raided and lost everything and out of spite or rage has submitted a negative review. Rust simulates a post apocalyptic sandbox world and it is brutal just the like a post apoc world would be. Yes it has powerful roving clans of murderous bandits just like a post apoc world would have. Yes there are lots of brutal young men and teenagers running rampant and murdering and robbing just like youd see in a post apoc world. Yes you have to work hard to survive and it could be taken away from you in an instant guess what just like a post apoc world. People who are moaning about the community being toxic often contradict themselves. They complain that nobody is friendly and they get killed by large organized groups. Groups who are made up of people who are friendly with each other and are working together as a strong community. Clearly if you join a clan or group you will be more likely to prosper just like in real life. Life is a lot harder for a solo player but its not impossible trust me. You just have to play smart and in a different style. You wont even start to understand Rust until youve put around 200 hrs into it. Its tough dog eat dog and friendly people are rare but they are there like glimmering lights of hope in the desolate murderous world that is Rust. Its not about building a big base. Its about first of all surviving through cunning remaining hidden and slowly building your resources. Making the transition from prey to predator and when you die and lose it all take it like a man. As in life your death is coming sooner or later meet it with a smile. The pleasure in this game comes from the journey and the story of your personal fight with an unforgiving world. You will lose it all in the end so thats the first thing you need to accept. If you just want to build something play Space engineers. Very few games have given me a genuine adrenaline rush and got the heart pounding. Rust does that in bucket loads. Its not for the faint hearted.
