review: I really want to give this game a positive review but i cant.I had this game since it first came to Steam since then the devs invested huge sums oftime and money into this game which is good. At first the game used a basic 3D engine now the devs upgraded it to an advanced really high quality 3D engine but they did so before finishing many of the things that game have to offer... with time they added changed many things in the game and now it sure looks good BUT!1. if you dont have any friends to play this game with dont bother you wont enjoy it as you will encounter teams of players that are using TS and just hunt you down and take everything from you which leads me to 2. in this game you have to rush and build a safe house it takes about 3 hours to do so and even then its far from beeing a true safe house but if you are a student or working full time you will have to sucrefice some sleep in order to get this safe house you wont be able to achive anything in 1 or 2 hours and 3 is if you are lucky and play on servers with low population.3. after 3 hours if you are lucky you will have a small stone shack stone is ok to defend against thives but it wont help you against true raiders and there are planty of them... so you spend time and sweat and build your safe house you then go to sleep just so that in the morning you will find your safehouse raided and you are dead 3 hours went to thin air well done now start over from scratch!This game is designed to be played by teenagers that finish school at 2 and spend the rest of the day and far into the night playing Rust (you will also notice it by the chat flooded by all those pizzaface spammers that just swear and abuse) so unless you have the patience for teenagers and their spam about virginity and sex with your mother and if you have the time buy it. in any other case AVOID IT!
title: Rust

review: This game is one of my favorite survival games of all time would give it a 11/10 even thoe the Rust Experimental is a disaster to me... enjoyed the Legacy a lotThis is how the story of the NAKED MAN beggins P.S dont judge me cuz of my bad gramar../. You are a naked guy who has no clue how he got in the place he will be and start bashing people for about 4 hours dying a couple of 50 times till you bash someones head and get a gun. You will get wood buyld a house and be proud of your acomplishments. You will leave the game. The next time you open it you find your house raided and you rage quit. But you will play again with hope that you will become something. You find a couple of newbies and team up with tham. Thay turn out to be good friends you play about 10 days building and strugling for a goal to be the best. After 10 days thay all quit rust and you are left alone again. You get raided you rage quit. You deside to go on another server...You are a naked guy who has no clue how he got in the place.....

review: Whatever videos show you is a lie.This game is full of people who will kill you for no reason right after you spawn in while they scream autisticly. You'll exit a server after building a base and the next day you'll be welcomed to a screen saying "You were killed by *whatever" and be forced to start all over again. The only way to progress is if you're in a group of three or more and even then you'll still get raided and killed. This game is full of people who screen racial sexual and overall obscene insults and writing them on in game signs and chats. Regardless of the game's "not for the sensitive" reputation the overwhelming ammount of people who depict the worst of the online world is sickening and evident that this game is what preteens turn to after Minecraft becomes boring they just want Minecraft with murder.As for gameplay I'm not as versed in describing. You hit trees with rocks to get wood boulders to get stone and animals (3 out of 4 of which will kill you) for fat and meat. Building is overly simple while being fusrating seeing as it will sometimes let you build things into walls and other times not. And combat is almost entirely luck based you won't know if an arrow or bullet hits until it plays a small sound and melee fighting is atrocius seeing as you never know how much health the other person has. Armor is only effective if you wear a helmet. Resources are random and scarce so you're lucky to find something as basic as stone. The blueprint system seems pointless. Air drops are nine times out of ten gotten by people who are already fully geared. Aformentioned geared guys will also travel the entire map killing naked people who only have the starting tools.I despise this game though far be it from me to discourage you from this breeding ground of toxicity and hatred if you enjoy it then so be it.

review: This is a game of unbelievable potential. My first experience was playing with friends in a small collection of shacks once that got raided we decided to build a solid base far from the towns and learn how to play. At the moment the endgame (which is in my opinion making explosives and raiding bases) is the most enjoyable and rewarding part of this game. However the UI is clunky there are countless glitches such as flying animals and walking through walls but in the case of a game with this much promise it's a privilege to be a part of the development process. I like many other people have high hopes for this little gem.

review: Rust is a great game. However it has its cons too. Its hard for new players to adapt to the game because the game has a very violent community. There is no Roleplay servers or "no kos" Rust is very violent and as a new player you should expect nothing but the worse possible treatment from other players. I would highly suggest watching a few videos on how to play before joing a server or you will most likley quit after 10 minutes. That being said rust is still a very fun game that combines pvp with survival. The base building is the best ive seen in any early access survival game and has a lot of room for creativity and fun. The permadeath system is great so that if you kill another player you get EVERYTHING they have on them. The game is very polished and is soon coming out of early access. I would highly recomend this game to anybody who wants to play a fun survival game with their friends.

review: When Rust was first released I had many fun adventures with a group we called the Bay. The Bay was located near the hangar and it consisted of about a dozen houses for about 19 people. I was one of them. Had a blast battling a group known as the Radtown Flats led by a man named Simison. Our leader Wolf declared war after a sniper attack by the Radtown Flats resulted in 3 of us dead. So we set up an ambush. Me and my partner waited in the rocks with submachine guns waiting for Simison and his cronies to attack the Bay. When Wolf announced that the Bay was being fired upon Alice and I leaped over the rock lined up our sights on Simison's back and pulled the trigger. Killing the bandit lord was my all time favorite Rust moment. Sadly those stories have all but died off. The "new" Rust is just crap. Hackers lazy devs low resourses a bad crafting system...it's just a waste of time now. Don't buy it. You're better of with DayZ Standalone. At least those devs add stuff and fix it even if it takes a while.2/10

No 5 just 4.I'm just tried and I'll not write all bad unfinished or unbalanced things. Wrote only few of them.This game is already closer to the trash then to perfect game. Since 0/10 would be a trash. Logic dear patological hater fashioners. Everything needs to be rebalanced food straving farming building shoting fighting damage fall damage equips clothes freezing... Game on high settings doesn't looks like top10 and it requires ALOT of resources. But launched at potoato (lowest) settings make the game looks like a 1990 game but it still requires ALOT of resources. So graphics compared to the requiments are low to very low. Character creation only with tweaks like launch commands (changing sex skin color etc). Lots of nudity everywhere. Naked character is naked. No underwear. This game have medium movement system. Shift to run should be repaced with shift to walk. 3 sec shift button hold is still a poor idea. No options to toggle it out or reconfigure. Your little finger gonna hurt until you get ultra muscles on it. It's so archaic like in crappy 1990 2000 FPS games. Practicly you cannot rebuild your house game isn't for players who are love building. Unless you find a mods what allows to easly destroy own walls. Shoting system reminds me games from before 2000 year. Noone plays them nowaday or maybe few players 100+ becouse they were just bad. Rust is using the same or very similar shoting system. Shoting with some guns without moving mouse will cause your character to look at the sky in few seconds. Forcing you to move your mouse to the top/bottom of your mousepad and then your hand to the center of mousepad every time you want to do a longer spray. Shoting system from crappy FPS games of 90s. Only slide to change sensitivity. No way to precisly set your sensitivity. Maybe possible with tweaks or console commands. Slides are archaic so again return to 1990 2000 And becouse game can load extremally slow even on low med and high end PCs so 2 hours for a steam refund is a joke. There should be atleast 10. Sometimes UI isn't responsible maybe issue is on server side (lag). But this have to be recoded. Clicking an item to craft should take required resources from client and add item right after lag is off. With actual coding players are sometimes spam clicking and this causes them to build more then they wanted. Happened to me few times and this can be fixed with logical coding.My compare This game for me is much worse then MinecraftThis game for me is much worse then CS any versionThis game for me is much worse then BattlefieldThis game for me is much worse then Call of DutyFair 4/10Bought it with 50% and I think this game isn't worth the full price maybe even not worth 50% of it. review: I do recommend this game. I find it's the only game I can play for lengths on end. I do find is difficult at times to really make progress without having 24/7 to play it. However I've been playing on Community servers where there isn't decay and they're low population so it makes it better. If you have a full time job with a significant other you'll struggle to play the game to its full potential. Pros The game is beautiful. Sunsets and sunrises often make you reach for F12 and take a screenshot. Sound design is phenomenal. The developers are incredibly active and listen to the community on a lot of issues. With the addition of the "component" system solo players can hold their own much better against clans. The survival elements are balanced fairly well. (Heat cold hunger dehydration) It's incredibly fun to raid someone's base and reap the progress. The servers reset progress once a month to keep the playing field even from large clans. Cons Animal AI. It's being worked on but as of right now they can walk through rocks boulders and external walls so it's a pain. The community IS very toxic. I find the best solution for this is to play on smaller community servers. I can't play on Official servers because it's awful. As of right now there is no weather system besides the fog. It was removed some time ago to be fixed so it should be back eventually. The servers reset once a month wiping all of your progress.
title: Rust

review: This game is described by the developers as a survival/crafting game and the graphics are absolutely gorgeous but it is so heavily biased towards murdering psychopaths I doubt it will ever be anything but a mass murder simulator. Largely because after two years in Early Access the developers have shown absolutely no interest in fixing the horribly broken gameplay which goes like this Every few weeks the entire map is reset because the servers can't cope with all the buildings and items hoarded by the first few players who joined. These very first few players who had the time to play non stop for 20 hours after the last wipe got to hoard some automatic weapons and build inpenetrable fortresses of steel and stone. After this they spend the next few weeks sniping naked would be players who try to join the game. See the established players spawn inside their fortress next to their chest full of armor weapons and medkits while everyone else spawn naked on a beach holding a rock which will fall apart if you try to hit a tree more than a few dozen times. Collecting wood will ofcourse get you nowhere because you need cloth (which is pretty rare) stone (which is nearly impossible to come by) and animal fat (easiest to obtain by killing yourself) to craft a simple furnace smelt 100 units of metal which can then be used to craft a combination lock which can be used to lock... well whatever you would have had to lock if you hadn't been killed a LONG time ago at this point. Because of this the game quickly devolves into a bunch of desperate frustrated naked guys pummeling eachother with rocks instead of "surviving" and "crafting". All of this is accompanied by the inspiring sound of microphone toting teenage misfits telling you to f**k yourself in poor english while dismembering your corpse with a rock. If you can play this game for a week without completely losing faith in humanity you simply haven't been paying attention.

review: Rust is developed by the same company that made Garry's Mod which is what caught my attention when I was looking at this game the first time. I played this game using Steam Family Sharing &amp bought it after a few hours of playing.The game is build on the Unity Engine and looks great. The core gameplay and shooting mechanincs are fantastic and really surprised me. I had to get used to a few things but once you know the basics the game really grows on you. I logged 40 hours in a few days playing this to the point where I was having weird dreams about the game. That's usually when I know I have a winner.I stopped playing for a month and came back to tons of updates. The game is actively updated on a weekly basis with significant game improvements. They have an active dev log on their website and on the game so you know what's up. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this game.Update 11/22/2017 Still going strong. It's worth popping in every few months to see the progress. You get essentially a new game a few times a year.

review: Rust is a game with great potential. From the first time you play it you know this is a unique survival experience. Interestingly the developers stopped Rust "1.0" development 9 months ago. This legacy version of the game is fun but it hasn't evolved much since 2013. The developers instead are focused on Rust "2.0". The naysayers which included me complained that the developers were simply stalling and had not intention to improve the game. However over the last month Rust 2.0 has started to evolve to become a real (albeit buggy) game. The graphics in 2.0 are outstanding and it brings a look/feel that 1.0 can't touch. If the developers continue this path then Rust 2.0 will essentially be next gen and gamers get two games for the price of one. Well done!

review: I'm going to have to go against the tide here and say that Rust was something of a disappointment for me. Although there are some verifiably comical moments to be had (such as being stoned to death by someone in the buff upon attempting to purloin their torch as they sleep) there unfortunately isn't a lot of substance beyond that.First is the incessant crashing to desktop. Okay okay I know it's an alpha and such things are to be expected but Rust is probably the first game I've played that does it literally every twenty minutes. I've been playing for less than an hour and the game crashed three times in that short period. And just to rub salt in my eyes I'll find that once I've returned to the server to start playing again everything I've spent the past half hour gathering has been robbed by a passer by putting me straight back to square one.Speaking of "gathering" survival is extremely difficult even for a walking simulator (not least because of the looming threat of crashing to desktop and having everything you own burgled). Getting off of the beach where you first spawn is easy enough but after that it just becomes a pain usually the biggest threat in a walking sim is having your food stolen by a pack of bandits but in Rust the issue lies in getting food in the first instance. My first thought was to harvest fruits and the like of which there are precisely none in the starting area. Hunting is also frustrating especially given that the first proper weapon you get in the game will barely tickle the creature being hunted which is also faster than you. Fishing is also a non thing so literally the only way for a newbag to procure food and drink (here I should think I could drink from the river but apparently not...) is to overpower some unsuspecting adventurer and rob his stuff. Or if he has no food eat him instead (cannibalism is a thing in Rust).So we move on to what I found to be the only good thing about Rust (and let's face it the overwhelming majority of positive reviews here are about this) that being the fact that one can strut around in one's birthday suit and beat one another to death with rocks. However other than this bit of humour the game has little else to offer in the field of actual gameplay. Like I said I've only played for an hour or so and I'll probably play it a little more to see if it gets any better (in which circumstance I'll write a considerably less damning review). But frankly I don't have a very good first impression of Rust.
title: Rust

review: UPDATE!With a new component system my opinion has changed.Game finally got back the miracle of randomness in what you may find and got rid of XP progression.Progression that has put everyone s learning and progress into same order which in my opinion does not really suit survival based game.Component system ensures that each time you join new server you have a balanced field to catch up with people who may have played there longer than you did.All items can be found anywhere in the map so the old trend of large groups camping certain areas and preventing solos to get useful things is no longer a problem.In the same time your progress transfer between servers is not an issue anymore there is simply no progress in the game at this point.Its all about farming.Component encourages more PVP as everyone is forced to go outside and look for certain components required to craft certain high end items.So you will no longer see people camping inside their bases solely using quarries to pump out resources of turrets to kill an animal that clipped through their wall and farm its food.

review: Just to mention I ve been playing this game for a while now and it has been one of if not my favorite game. However it has gone through some changes which have affected the game negatively. Please read through my guide as it will dramatically improve your choice of buying this game.Positives of rust after the October 6th update One of the best features of rust is that the Developers are active and frequently update the game making the strain less on low end computers and laptops. (This could vary for people depending on who you are). The game is now significantly more difficult. Basically if you are looking to play on official server solo and want to get to the top. Good luck. They have made the game so difficult that you need to invest at least half your day each day to be able to raid and succeed in official servers. Farming endlessly for hours and that s if a giant zerg or clan with 10 20 people don t come along and camp the rad towns. This could be a goal for some people which is why I put it in the positive and negative section. Amazing community servers which are honestly from my experience 1000x better than the official servers (Go to the end to see what server I play in which is actually good).Negatives of rust after the October 6th update To begin the community is cancerous. 99% of the time when playing solo you ll come across an annoying 8 year old kid screaming into his/her mic making you deaf. Helk who is the new game developer has redefined the definition of fun in the game. Fun is now running around in a clan of 15 members farming the rad towns. Before the update solo players duos and small clans could easily get the equipment s that giant clans had but in a lesser amount. Still giving them a chance to raid and take on even the mightiest of clans. It was the best feeling to get some of the loot from a clan with 10 people with your friend. Now we get to the main point of why I don t recommend this game to anyone. The game currently is getting worse and worst each month. The developers make one good update and then ruin it with a terrible update such as the upkeep box which forces people to get on everyday for 1 hour farming to feed your base so that it doesn t cripple and expose your loot. Also gone are the days where you could make a 20 story bases with your friends and enjoy shooting down on people. Now to make bases like that force you to get on for at least 2 3 hours farming wood stone and high quality metal. The first time I started playing the game I had no friends to help me out and I was completely on my own. However the concept of the game was simple back then. Farm build raid enjoy. This however has been significantly extended after Oct 6th. Now it s farm for wood farm stone farm metal farm scrap (which takes days to do) farm even more scraps to get a workbench make a base get resources to feed the upkeep box to stop the base from crippling get scraps to research the gunpowder BP Get more scraps to research either satchels c4s or rocket launcher raid get raided by a try hard drug addicted no life clan with 20 people in it. Repeat. Also have fun getting scraps as you need to forget about your real life. You need to spend days if not weeks getting scraps. So leave your job leave your family leave your kids and eat instant noodles.So after making your base you think you can relax and maybe get a girlfriend or go out with your friends or visit your family right? No problem however make sure to log on 4 hours a day to feed your base so it doesn t decay and fall apart.And if you think these are all the problems you re wrong. If I where to list the problems of this game the list would be endless. If you are thinking about buying this game then please do. But don t play official servers because it will only cause you anger and hate. But every cloud has a silver lining and in this case It is the community servers. Community servers bring back all the good times of rust when it didn t go all to If you re interested in playing with me enjoying and experiencing the golden age of rust then join the server given below. It brings back the full experience of before October 6th + way more. No need to grind all day. Hacking detection is near perfect and the community is friendly. Keep in mind the server is new and we need new players to populate the server. Don t forget the tell the owner who invited you.Server RustAddiction AU/NZ 5X TP Just copy and paste this server into the community section in the servers list and you re set for endless fun.So again the question come back. Should you buy this game?I ll be straight forward with you and won t waste your time.Play community servers such as RustAddiction AU/NZ 5X TP .But if you want to waste your life and you aren t interested in ANY social activities then play official servers.

review: Welp I was hoping that I wouldn't write a review for this game but I gotta do this for those of you wanting to supplement for Fallout 76 until it comes out. This is my first ever review and I wanted to get my thoughts out on Rust since I put in 22 hours into it. I was interested in the way it takes the survival mechanics of ARK and mixes in a little bit of STALKER. However I was met with dissapointment because of the way the game implements its survival mechanics and PvP. Let me start off by saying that the main component of Rust is boring as all hell. You go grind for wood stone and other craftables to fortify your base and beef up your items and weapons. There are optional places to go if you want extra blueprints and/or weapons. These areas offer more reward than just your regular forest areas and do provide worthwhile loot given where you go. However the default game takes way too long to get to a point where you feel comfortable with your base and items. The base game only provides a small amount of stuff whenever you grind and it gets boring real fast. You feel the hours ticking as you grind for stuff. There are animals and npcs that you can kill for either food or other valuables but their AI is so braindead that it hardley feels rewarding to kill let alone loot. I had to play modded servers that provided 50x loot in order to actually play the game given I have to work 25+ hours a week. There is also a game mechanic where given how much you build for your base it requires an x amount of crafting materials in order for your base to not deteriorate. So not only do you have to grind to make your base as fortified as possible but you need about half the amount you made for your base to keep it from falling apart. So coupled with how much you have to grind to build a base it takes longer to keep it from deteriorating. That is if you can actually build a base worth a damn because the main mechanic of the game is being an absolute and ing up.The default game mode is literally griefing other players and trolling them. In order to progress per say you need to kill other players and grab their stuff. This provides access for better weapons and other valuables that may come in handy if you decide to kill someone and/or raid a base. This would be fine if there were dedicated PvP areas in the game and if there was a faction system and a war mode implemented. However as the game stands no rules apply to how PvP works in the normal game mode. You could literally "Spawn and Die" to someone if they have played the game 100 1000+ hours on a certain server or the game in general. You could even spawn into your base and be absolutely screwed. For the server that I was playing on I had an excellent system for my base. It was close to a mountain side with no outpust/monumets around. The only way to enter it is to platform on the side of the mountain and to dodge the traps I laid along the foundation of the base. However I was met with shock when I come back to my game my character was walled off. Everything that I had saved up for 20+ hours was gone in an instant with no way to recover. To make matters worse the player was mocking me and calling me " face" while wasting away all my ammo and loot.Do not I repeat do not buy the game at full price. The game is barely worth the $8 I spent because of how ridiculously tedious it is and how God Awful the playerbase is. If you can stick to the modded servers. I recommend either the "Battle Royale" servers or "Battlefield" servers to actually enjoy the game. As it stands it is not worth your time or patience to play the game normally. Rating 5/10

review: Rust is a Realistic Survival MMO.Gameplay In Rust you start out with a rock and a torch from there the first things to do is collect some wood using your rock. Throughout the game you will get killed many times if you are playing on a popular server. After putting in some time you will have collect enough wood and stone to start creating tools to speed up how long it takes to gather resources. Overall it will be challenging to get started but after a while you will learn more of what to do and how to craft items in Rust.Graphics/ Sound Rust has some really nice graphics if you have some of the setting turned up. Rust also has some music during the loading screen and throughout the gameMultiplayer Rust has a very active community on a range of different servers. Some servers are just plain vanilla and have no mods at all. Other servers may have things like 3X XP or other perks to help speed up the process of creating tools and a base. Cost Rust is priced at $20 at the time of this review and I think that Rust is priced well for what it offers right now. But i would suggest picking Rust up when its on sale for $10. Some sites like Humble Bundle you can even pick up Rust cheaper through their bundles while also supporting charity.Time Rust takes a good 5 10 hours to be at a point where you can go offline without dying. Pros Realistic Active Multiplayer community Only $20 Great Team gameCons Can be hard to run on lower hardware Server wipes Time consumingI would give Rust a 9/10 Total Rating
title: Rust

review: Do NOT buy this game until it is out of "Early Access" or whatever BS label they are giving it. They totally scrapped the semi functional alpha version of this game to toss 100% of their support into an experimental branch that has virtually none of the features of the aplha which they chose to scrap. We now have a game which was semi playable being scrapped for a game that is entirely unplayable. To add insult to injury they don't even support the official servers anymore. The "East Coast Server 1" that I play on has been down all day without any maintenance or anything.There is growing concern among the player base that this game will never even reach alpha state again much less ever be released. Garry is a terrible developer when it comes to actually releasing games and making tangible progress. He started Garry's Mod over more than half a dozen times. Why would a developer take millions of dollars from players with a game that was so terrible they now have to start from scratch? That's just outright fraud to sell a game as in an alpha stage when it is so bad it is scrapped altogether. Garry basically charged us all $20 for a game he hasn't even started on yet.Avoid this game at all costs until the 5 7 years it takes Garry to make any real progress on it. Perhaps wait for them to support the servers and community in some fashion too? It's worth noting this game was released in December 2013 and it is currently being started from scratch. Does anyone else find a release date for a game that hasn't even begun development yet dishonest?

review: The game used to be pretty fun but now it's just grind grind and more grind. Long story short every update seems to make the game worse and less enjoyable. Save your money and go buy something else that is actually backed by reputable developers and financial support. Investing in Facepunch is nothing more than a facepalm of disappointment.UPDATE Not a lot has changed from the above since the game left Early Access. Some things got fixed that took about three years to get fixed but that's about it. A whole slew of things were never fixed before the game left Early Access still aren't fixed it's still not optimized and the game post Early Access is still just as much of a mess as it was when it was in the program. Grind is even worse now as the game remains so imbalanced.The new Blueprint System and other ideas the developers chose have literally ruined the game for many thousands of players prior and post Early Access. The community is worse content creators are giving up on the game toxicity is out of control and the game has become so infested with children that it's just not a fun game for a lot of adults to hang out and game anymore.Sure Rust has seen some new map content but it's more or less the same kind of content Rust has seen over the years only now the company is trying to give the game some kind of lore in an environment of mismatched theme and language. Rust is pretty much a rinse and repeat of other (I won't name titles) certain FPS survival games mashed into one with a lot of things that have pretty much been ripped concepts from other games with only a reskin and a sound change. That's not very thoughtful or creative.Post Early Access the company changes core mechanics of the game such as gun play and other various things. These are features that should have been completed and refined during the Early Access phase of the game but they were not and for some reason keep changing time and again.Cheating is also another issue that's plagued Rust for years and in spite all the developers saying they are finally addressing issues as of this month but it's honestly a bit late for that. The cheaters have already left a sour taste in peoples' mouths and a lot of people will not return to Rust because this comapny took way too long to address those issues.All in all Rust has been four and a half year's time not well spent. The game is still largely broken incomplete is considered an alpha still by the developers and best of all they are charging full retail price for a game that was never completed before exit from Early Access and it will not be completed by the end of 2018 post exit Early Access. The developers have been too careless during Rust's development. Rust holds very limited quality of sustainability when it comes to game play that's if you can get the game to work. Many people still can't get Rust to work even months after the game left Early Access because something the developers changed screwed the game up. Worse is the developers are charging full retail price for this broken and incomplete buggy mess of an unoptimized game.Conclusion Hands down there are many many other better and completed games out there to buy from reputeable companies that do not have a terrible history such as Facepunch Studios.A company that can only produce one game in the company's launch year and only another incomplete and broken game fourteen and a half years later is not a sign of a good developer. This company left Chunks (another game they're apparently making) in Early Access for literally almost two entire years before giving it a minor patch last November 2017 so it didn't appear abandoned. They also lied in the developer description saying the game would be done in about two to four months. Well we're past two years now and it's not done.A developer that cancels and abandons more than half a dozen projects in under a year and leaves games hang stale in Early Access for so long without an update is a definite sign of a company that does not properly finish what it starts very often. Rust falls into that category. Rust is in year five of alpha development outside of Early Access.

review: Since buying this game on release day and playing through to the current patch I can 100% say this game is a must have. The dev team behind this game is amazing they are constantly chekcing out user created content and taking suggestions from reddit and the community page. Over the years this game has seen some major changes with a complete graphics overhaul huge changes in the core mechanics. Looking at this game from day 1 to now its like 2 completely diferrent games. There is new content almost every week and development is showing no signs of slowing down. The game is still in Alpha after almost 3 years because they keep adding more and more to the game. Just today they added flamethrowers in. The community is a lot of fun and the game mostly rewards group play and being an alpha there is plenty of fun to be had with various glitches and bugs. Plenty of love has gone into this game and the devs just aren't ready to quit. This game is definitely one to check out.

review: Play a game that decides on what gender and race you get to be for the entire game. I can see how this can promote roleplay but that only added to the confusion to a 12 22 majority age group that just play shooting games all day. The gameplay is simple to understand. It is streamlined for the things that you can accomplish by how much manpower you got. Savaging harvesting building the joy of doing all of those things just by meetings of chance. Now to the main points to why you should not support design choices of this game. Every Update is a server wipe of about a week. Now many new beginnings and ending can be made in this case but whatever happens in the game is purely effected by the Upbringing of the individual with their Real life opinions. Now some background.Item skins are gifted and not founded in the Steam inventory. A neat feature that is a community cash grab of chance. Character Model is randomly generated. Demographic of Race and Gender is randomly selected. However there is a problem the hate problem. People Will kill other people for no reason based on Skin Color a strange dilemma that sets society back in the game world back 200 years when computers should never exist. To whoever few that are "gifted" with this dilemma will have it harder for themselves to befriend certain likewise white skinned player models with ironic shaved heads everyone has.Personal experience aside I got lynched in a regional dedicated server. This is what makes Rust not playable no open and not where the joy is found for the future expectations of the players. To conclude I will get my purchase potentially refunded and removed after I post my only screenshot of the game.

review: I recently picked up Rust included with the recent Humble Bundle. In Rust I ended up just running randomly around an island full of little bases with security doors looking for naked guys to bludgeon until I starved to death. There was nothing to pick up and nothing to do except wander past all these base like buildings entering the ones I could and destroying a few random objects. The fact that Rust is a multi player game is the biggest drawback. It's hard to get immersed in a survival game where you start out with a rock and some of an island's population is mowing you down with flame throwers and automatic weapons. This is not a survival game. It is a small world persistent deathmatch that shoehorns all of its players into a small area to build there little bases and go at it. The islands I spawned on looked less like isolated islands and more like little cities of player bases with naked guys wandering around smashing each other hoping not to run into someone with a gun. This game is like telling new Battlefield players they need to spawn in with a toothbrush. This is the game I bought the Humble Bundle to play and is ironically the only one I've uninstalled. k

review: Never in my life have I felt such utter disgust and contempt towards a game in my steam library. This is without a doubt the biggest waste of money on Steam. For starters it's an unoptimised mess with an art style that makes you want to vomit. When you load into a server be prepared to go and put the kettle on and prepare some scones as this will take an infuriatingly long time. 60 of my 76 hours on this game are from loading screens.Is it worth the long loading time? To put it bluntly no. After selecting a server from the server list made up of either cancerous custom ones ran by 10 year olds or the poorly maintained official ones be prepared for what will feel like virtual labour work. You start with a rock and simply have to hit things with the rock. Does that sound like a fun time to you? If you even manage to waste enough time to get weaponry on this game be prepared for some absolutely appaling combat. The guns are not satisfying to use and you can get a lag spike when firing the weapon due to the already mentioned apalling state of the game's engine.The objective of this so called 'game' is to make a base. That's it. There is no engaging story or any kind of ulterior motive. Simply just make a metal building on a map full of children. It's all well and dandy once you've established your base of operations but try taking a break from this game. You can't. You are simply punished for it. Priviliged children who spend all their lives on this sorry excuse for a game will destroy it whilst you are going about your day to day business. If by some miracle this doesn't happen it doesn't matter anyway because nearly all the servers get wiped on a weekly basis so you will lose all your hard work anyway. Enjoy.I strongly recommend you steer clear of this game and play a game for real men like Kingdom Hearts. Thank you for reading this.

review: Well the game itself is fantastic but it soon gets bored. Vanilla unmodded servers I'm not sure about stuff like remove I think should have been there as standard (I mean if you place something IRL you can move it right? It's only like placing a fence post?).That said the building possibilities are rather endless and it's a very fun Adult Version of minecraft.The sheer number of hackers and buggy combat however is what let's it down which is a shame because it's the most important part of the game.Durability doesn't happen on a Hunter Bow yet a metal gun's durability fails fast what's that all about?The new experimental stage of the game I've tried looks pretty but framerates are much lower than current and the new interface is going to annoy some of the 1k+ hour players (it looks nice but it's not rust if you get me).Being able to build on water and live in rocks etc can't belive that's still never been fixed. Duping is easy on laggy servers and players with a high ping generally have a decent advantage to a low ping player. Playing with 35ping makes it super hard to kill someone with 350ping in comparison to another 35 45ping player.Because of this servers should auto kick HPB's.

review: You start with a rock to collect rocks and sticks to put a rock on a stick to collect more rocks and sticks and at some point in this chain of events you're killed and your body is looted. Though after being robbed a few times you may just make friends with someone. That friend will rob you becuase they're a spy for a group of bandits. Eventually you make a new friend one that's not a bandit (if you're lucky). This friend will give you a gun maybe in my case they did. Now that you have a gun you can defend your self from other people with guns next time you hop on the server you're playing on because it's late and you have stuff to do in the morning.You awake to see a nice sunrise look around and realize you're standing in the middle of a field with no gear. Turns out you were killed in your sleep. You may be a bit bummed out. Maybe you can try to start a new life wherever you spawned? but first look out for that radioactive bear that's about to murder you.10/10 will be raided again. Good game so far just want some more stuff to maybe defend myself from raiders.

review: Rust is the defining survival/gatherer game and it has been under development for quite some time. I also receives very regular updates and from what I understand the developers communicate with the community a lot. However I cannot recommend this game in its current form.The game is predominently PvP and with that comes all the ugliness of an anonymous community. You will be shot stabbed and stomped on with no reason or provocation other than it's "fun" to do so. You will spend hours fortifying a base only to have someone C4 it to heck while you're offline.This game needs more coherent and meaningful PvE dangers. So far you have randomly placed wildlife only two of which will attack you. You also have a patrolling helicopter that may occasionally hunt you down. It's not enough and coupled with other environmental aspects are all easily mitigated or avoided.Originally the game had radiation as a theme with irradiated towns and wildlife. The game really needs to expand on that theme and introduce things such as herds of irradiated creatures that roam the world. Events such as spikes of radiation radioactive dust storms large irraditaed creatures attacking etc. I commented a while back that Rust would be awesome if it included the cannibals from The Forest. Rust needs something like that so it can have a PvP mode for people that like that kind of thing and a PvE mode for people like me who prefer cooperation against an ever increasingly hostile world.

review: Unless you already have hundreds of hours on the game and know exactly what to do to 110% optimize every movement and start playing with zero sleep on a server every waking minute the moment a server resets you will just get killed dozens of times by griefers until you give up. Welcome to the magical world of a 4 year early access game called Rust. Enemies make no sound when approaching. All weapons kill with 2 hits. When you die you lose everything because people will camp your home and kill you over and over until yet again you give up on trying to play this game.Possibly the worst survival game I've ever played. 4 hours and I've left with the worst taste in my mouth of any game since X Rebirth which was universally hated. This game completely and entirely tailors itself to trolls so that new players will find it impossible to do anything build anything or get anywhere. Literally less than a day into this game and these trolls had guns and fortresses built and just spent their time destroying everyone elses and forcing them to quit the server out of frustration.Seriously do not buy this game if you haven't already played it so much you're a master (a paradox I know with good reason). Legitimately the positive reviews will tell you it's fun and all but like pyramid schemes these reviews are simply there to encourage new players to buy the game get destroyed by the positive reviewers that enjoy tormenting people then have them quit. Congratulations devs you've succeeded in not only facilitating griefing and trolling but tailored the game to facilitate it.

review: Good game. extremely fun especially with friends!Still in alpha development released to us as an early access game. so expect bugs glitches and even times when the game wont work at all. Recent update has caused a small wave of butthurts to change their reviews from positive to negative. it's because Facepunch implemented an XP system. people are upset that they have to actually play the game to gear up... instead of relying on other people (Clans) to gear them up for them. this actually works out for the best. Less KOS Kiddies / Rad Town Campers / Lazies. it gives solo players like myself an actual chance of atleast setting down my foundation for my base without being raided. Facepunch did a Vote on their social media page a week or so ago asking people "Keep XP and Improve it" or "Back to Blueprints" the voted ended with over 10 000 registered votes. the XP system won by a landslide. so don't worry about the "Most helpful Reviews" being negative. its just the butthurts +1 upping eachother in some weird sort of circle jerk.8/10 Awesome Game and highly recommmend.PS i am sure a few butthurts will chime in below... telling me to kill myself or whatnot. these are the exact people this game DOESN'T need.

review: This game is pretty fun for what it is. It is basically just a harder and better looking version on Minecraft with PvP always on. Though you won't be crafting like you would in Minecraft but rather building a shelter as soon as you can to keep safe from not only the bears and other animals but the players themselves. You can go out at night but I would suggest you don't. It in Pitch Black unlike it is in minecraft so if you don't have a torch you can't see any of the animals but the players as well that will shoot to kill at least most of them will. You can get lucky and meet a friendly player but they could just be acting. So be wary of everything.Thumbs up.It's a decent game and if you like survival and crafting then you will find joy in this game.

review: Probably one of the best Survival games you will ever find. Even though it's been about two years since Rust was released and even if it's still in Alpha version this game rocks. Development never stops and the community grows and grows. Hell where else are you going to see naked sausage fest? Where else are you going to get killed by a naked man who will after teabag you? That's right nowhere. Rust is definitely one of the games you should try. It's definitely worth paying the money for what you get.I used to have a server last year with Rust Legacy and now I own the latest version of the Rust server and I would say it's awesome. Just know what you're looking for (serverwise). Stay safe and enjoy the gameplay!
title: Rust

review: Wow so what can I say about this game.First of all I was really excited about it and dove into it head first. After buying it I gifted it to 2 people and even rented my own server. I haven't played for about 3 weeks but as of then you could not play on any official server or a lot of community servers. Hackers and cheaters everywhere.So then I spent money to rent my own server because I think the game has great potential and looks very good for an alpha game.Then boredom. There is just not enough to do in the game and the development progress seems extremely slow. Also if anyone has told you that the RUST community is overall horrible. It's all true. I think the average player is 10 years old. Also the moderators running their official forum not even 10 years old maybe 5.I spent about $90 on an alpha game and that was a lesson learned the hard way.

review: As I died screaming between a wolf s jaws collapsing in the snow that dusts the top of the mountains while listening to it gnaw through virtual flesh I had a realization survival games are fun as long as they are about the threat of death.Death itself is underwhelming a gateway to an ever increasing set of chores and tasks that you must repeat in order to recover your lost progress. Inevitably the process eventually repeats and the to do list gets longer and less fulfilling which sounds a little bit like hell and a little bit like a parable about the human condition. Rust official site the multiplayer survival game from Facepunch Studios seems comfortable with both analogies.If you re not familiar with Rust or if you only know it as the Survival Game with Lots of it s actually a weirder and more interesting game than it first appears to be. You wake up in a strange landscape cold and naked with nothing but a torch and a rock to your name. Then after a few minutes of trial and error exploration of Rust s wilderness you can start building crude tools out of loose materials then using those tools to harvest more material to build better tools etc. The tech tree runs from Stone Age materials all the way to automatic weapons and heavy body armor. Survival in Rust can become a fairly comfortable survivalist s fantasy if you stay alive long enough but death comes swiftly and with little warning.Rust is the closest I ve ever come in a videogame to feeling like I was living in The Most Dangerous Game or The Ruum or any of those pursuit and survival classics that students read every year in middle school. Every player you meet is potentially a mortal threat or a potential ally which is common enough for a survival multiplayer game except that Rust also functions a bit like a social experiment. It s like someone gave Stanley Milgram a private island a private army and an endless supply of willing prisoners and said See what you can make happen here. Every few hours in game a cargo plane flies overhead and makes a supply drop that draws players from all around the map into a highly charged dangerous confrontation over the mere possibility of treasure. There might be nothing very special in those supply drops but there might be advanced gear that would be difficult or impossible to craft yourself.Alternately an attack helicopter sometimes appears to hunt down and kill any players that it manages to see and its appearance is as chilling as it is unexplained. It s existence is contrived like everything else in Rust s deserted semi industrial wilderness but still unsettling. It s something that forces me to consider what Rust looks like from above as a bunch of half naked violent and greedy people try and create peace and security for themselves in a setting of profound anarchy.But eventually you die. You didn t hide quickly enough and the helicopter mows you down in the open or you were too busy stalking a deer to notice someone has been stalking you for the past few minutes and literally all you hear is a shot before the world turns red and you drop to the ground. Or you die in the dumbest of ways taking a shortcut over a mountain and a wolf walks up a near vertical cliff face to surprise you at the exact moment that you don t have any of your good weapons equipped in the hotbar. A few impotent stabs with your spear later (a weapon with the worst hit detection in the game) and you re back to square one naked and alone.Well almost. Rust is also a game about securing property rights in an anarchic world a John Locke essay with a flintlock blunderbuss and magical crafting items. When you die you have the option to wake up again at a sleeping bag you ve left somewhere out in the world. Ideally inside a home you ve built next to a supply cache and behind a locked door. With a little foresight you can leave an inheritance for yourself of decent tools materials and weapons so that you can get right back to your survival saga of living by your wits and slowly becoming predator rather than prey in this hostile world. If you build a tool cabinet inside then nobody else can construct anything near your stuff letting you securely lay claim to territory. After a couple deaths I was building two of everything and jamming my hilltop fortress full of weapons and material.But some loss of progress is inevitable and if you get on a bad run that little rainy day fund will get depleted and eventually you re back to being alone with a rock and virtual genitalia (which will of course be the name of my forthcoming memoir). At that point Rust becomes a far less joyous and evocative experience and something a lot more like shift work. The first time you hunt a half dozen animals and smelt enough metal ore to create advanced weapons and armor you feel like Ash in Army of Darkness. The fourth time you do it and you re chopping down yet another tree with a stone hatchet or chasing a deer around some rocks? It starts to feel like survival might be a punishment rather than a goal.The weird thing is I think that s contributed to a strange sense of community on some servers. A year or so ago Rust sounded like a game full of half naked sociopaths killing each other in front of a pig s skull. Now while there s still a heavy air of distrust that hangs over the proceedings there s also more respect and cooperation. Neighbors ask to borrow tools to get back on their feet. Warnings go out regarding particularly violent players who are causing trouble. It s not that Rust is turning into some kind of utopian experiment but it s definitely less the anarchy that it was in the past. Live and let live seems to be the rule in Rust unless someone has REALLY nice stuff and you have a clear shot.There is an irony to success in Rust the better you are at surviving the less that will actually happen. Just before writing this I spent a couple hours upgrading my building building new weapons and ammunition and collecting extra supplies to keep behind a new electronic lock. I have windows that afford me a view in every direction and a kind of parapet on the third floor from which I can shoot down at anyone who starts trying to batter down my walls. I spend most of my time hiding from other players now or hiding from the helicopter or watching out for bears and wolves. When I think about a typical session of Rust it s a catalog of things that didn t happen of risks successfully avoided and bets wisely hedged. The brilliance of Rust is that it demands a lot of suspenseful work attention and planning to make sure that it remains uneventful.

review: After around an hour and a half of bad spawns scarce resources and short lived ventures into the more inhabited areas of the map I ran into the first friendly player I had met in Rust. I had initially spotted him pretty far away but I paid no real notice to him as he had a rock equipped. Eventually he got close enough for us to clearly see each other and upon the realization that neither of us were hostile we both pulled out torches as a mutual sign of peace (or the highest possible level of non aggression that can exist in Rust). I dropped my old hatchet for him as I had just finished crafting one with metal and he gave me some food as a sign of good faith. After nearly 30 minutes of searching and scavenging we had pooled enough resources to craft us each some minimally decent gear. We knew that if we wanted to progress any further we would need to mine boulders and a lot of them. I used what remaining materials we had to put together a 9mm handgun and several bullets though I reminded him it was only in case we really needed it. I had decided earlier during my many unwanted experiences with bullets to the face that I would try my hardest not to run around slaughtering every newly spawned player that I came across. A few minutes out from camp we had encountered a player with a hunting bow. I had been running with my hatchet out so I quickly took out the handgun in my inventory and pointed it in his direction attempting to scare him away. When the player was far enough away we continued up a road towards a few stones. The area was surrounded by trees so I opted to stand guard with the handgun while my friend mined. Just as we were moving on to the next boulder I heard the gunfire start. I turned around to see a player with an assault rifle gunning down my friend and before I could land any shots on him he had already begun shooting me. It was at that moment that I remembered I hadn't even crafted a sleeping bag for the camp as that was one of the objectives of the trip we were taking. I typed into the chat thanking the friend I had made for all of his help and asking the player who had killed us if we had been intruding in his area or something along those lines. He simply wrote "Sorry guys D" This is the single problem that I have with games like this. Why does it have to be "shoot on sight?" That player had obviously taken us by surprise and was better equipped than us. Even if he had a justifiable reason for approaching two very poorly equipped players (which he really didn't considering we were in the middle of the woods and he had pretty much all of the gear you could need in this game) he could have easily told us to cooperate by either putting away our weapons or just leaving the area. But of course he comes around sees some players trying to gather enough supplies to get to a stable point in the game and decides to go out of his way to approach us and use unecessary ammo for a hatchet and a handgun with four bullets. Then to add even more of an insult he adds an apology at the end as if he had no choice but to shoot two unexpecting half naked unprepared players. All in all though I do see a lot of potential in this game and the good in the community does shine through every once in a while. I just wish that people would realize that they don't need to go around killing players who haven't had the chance to experience the game. People like that are the single reason why so many players on steam feel that they wasted money on what would otherwise be a great experience.

review: Got back from not having touched this game in a long time and even then I played legacy 'cause god knows I don't want to touch the garbage fire that is the current game. I decided to install it and choose legacy just to notice that the legacy option is no longer there. (Legacy being the old and in my oppinion more enjoyable version of rust)I took a while to look at all the different versions to make sure that none of them are legacy and sure enough they weren't. I kept looking around in guides and the such for a while only to find out that they removed legacy. If you ask me that is the most stupid move this company could make seeing as from what I remember even legacy had a decent playerbase.I wish I could refund this just to get my money back but I can't so atleast I can feel like about 37 hours were well spent in legacy and that I'll never touch this game again unless they bring it back.I even played this game before it became the completely new game that it is now. Back when legacy wasn't called legacy. I miss those times but it seems like facepunch are happy to just give me a punch right in the face for thinking that. I am seriously dissapointed by this move and I in no way support it. Legacy was one of those very rare survival games that I could enjoy and actually do stuff in.I miss legacy already but I guess I'll just have to live with that. Thanks facepunch for being a great company once. Not gonna thank you for being a moronic company now.

review: The twig update was questionable at first but I was able to learn to adapt to it. This new node change is trash. Getting on to a new server all I see is metal ore and sulfur ore nodes and not a one stone node in sight. I guess players are expected to use their rock forever until they somehow get enough bones for a bone club come across the rare stone node or come across the rare crate that holds tools. They really need to remove this new node change because it has completely turnt me off the game. Other than the early game being completely ruined on a game that already has a very difficult early game the game in general can be quite fun. Base building pvping rare player interactions exploring rad towns raiding building a village/town/compound etc... can all be fun but some of these experiences can be rare. Pvp looks way easier than it actually is.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a awesome game and you should buy it if you like to have a high textured minecraft with elements of Day Z in the mix with extremely good lighting effects. Play it in 1 of 3 ways Lone wolf style this is where you play it solo and killing everything and everything in sight. Bandit Style Group with some people and raid peoples houses and take there loot and shoot and kill anything and everything that gets in your way. and finaly the friendly group In this style you play with a group and only shoot if they atack first and give the friendlys some unwanted gear and give them some of the basics Wood Rocks and a bow but no arrows so that concludes the styles of play. now the gear and weapons they still need some balancing and tweeking and theres only 3 types of ammo that is a bit odd but still kevlar is the best armor in the game and theres 3 other tears that works up to kevlar Cloth Teir 1 Leather Teir 2 Anti Rad suit Teir 3 and then kevlar i feel that there should be atleast 6 other teirs there 2 Pistols The M9 and the P250 is 1 assault rifle the M4 1 sniper The Bolt Action Rifle and 1 shotty NEEDS MUCH MORE WEAPONS. over all the game is still a alpha and most or all of this will change is the flowing updates and if you buy it now you will watch a masterpeice of survival and crafting come up from the ground. so yeah VERY GOOD GAME

review: Tried to make a headshot from over 500 meters didn't make it Tried again at 250 meters Didn't make it Tried once again at 100 meters Didn't work. I thought about it for the next couple of days. Went on a modded server with kits and killed a couple guys. Went back on that server and tried again Nothing. I thought is pvp off? So I asked my friend "May I hit you with my pickaxe?" and he said "Yes but not in the head" I don't know what he means because I don't think that the pickaxe does any more damage to the head so without realizing that it does I hit him straight in the head killing him. Pretty good experience to start the game.A week later I hopped on a Battlefield server made a couple friends and we took out over 100 guys. Not different guys some over and over again but I was so pumped about my skills I went on a community server. With all of my training gone to work I was so happy of this battle I was in.So heres the battle I was running threw hanger and I saw a guy in full Kevlar/M4 so I went up and said "Friendly" Like most friendly people do.But he starting shooting I went behind him with my stone hatchet and starting hacking. Eventually I slaughtered him took his gear and that was that. That's how I started into the game. Still with people helping me throughout the gameplay. I'm so thankful to the people who helped my start on my gameplay throughout the game. Its a very fun game and kind of realistic because the zombies were removed. So once I hopped back onto the Battlefield server I went over to my friends and they said "Congratulations!" and then we killed more people training me more. Until this moment was my first real rust fight.There was a admin being abusive and my friend said "We should go check it out" and my other friend said "Yeah and kill the admin teach him a lesson" I was so freaking nervous that I almost died during the fight. I killed him while 3 of the team was dead only me and my other friend alive I was hiding so there was no way they saw me so I sneaked up behind him killed him and took his admin armor. My friends said I deserve it and so did the owner of the server. The admin got banned from the server. So far I have around 150 hours on rust. Got it over a month ago. I love this game so much that... I just can't say its one of the best games I have ever played. Never got bored in it Because once I'm done with my daily work I go out raid some people and maybe even get into some trouble. I love this game and I highly recommend it for anyone that likes survival games.Thank you for taking you time into reading my story of gameplay of rust.

review: The concept is interesting while not outlandish the graphics are fairly impressive for that type of game and the crafting system is pretty good. The only thing I'd say is bad in the game itself apart from the lag which may be fixed later on is the emphasis on finding food. I think it is both unrealistic and rather difficult to die so quickly of hunger when you have just eaten a whole boar by yourself. What really made me drop a bad review is something that cannot be fixed the community. People will kill you for absolutly no reason. It is just KOS every where. You'd think maybe it's to get ressources or something but most of the time they just snipe you from afar while all you buttnacked are carrrying is a rock. I've tried talking to them i've tried going to low pop servers i tried running (very uneffective unsurprisingly considering they are aiming at you with a riffle). I know i dont have a lot of hours on this game. But in 7 hours i've only been able to build a house once (and by house i mean three walls and a roof. So to conclude the game is OK (nothing mindblowing) but the player base is so counterproductive that it will ruin the game for you.P.S. dont believe reviews that diminish that fact by saying stuff like "that's life" or "not everyone can be nice". this goes beyond nice or mean people will shoot you for just being there chopping down a tree.

review: Been watching the game from a distance for awhile not 100% interested in purchasing the game. Just recently saw it in a online package with other survival games so I pulled the trigger and got it. Installed the game and loaded into a low population server since I have no idea how to do anything and some of the videos I have seen was brutal. First impression...my god this game looks amazing. It runs smooth looks great and I was ready to get into it. Opened inventory saw I was a female so I look around to switch myself to a male character and found nothing. Do a quick google search and saw all the news about random race/gender locked to your SteamID. Uninstalled Rust.This is of course my own opinion on it and as stubborn or bullheaded as it may be...when I play a game such as Rust where it is open world and you put time into building a character in this world I myself just enjoy playing as a male character since I am male. I understand female have played the game for a long time with the only option of having to play as a male character. Well the game is still in development and of course adding a female is the correct choice to give that option I applaud that and same goes for race. But to completely remove the choice to just switch to the gender/race is stupid and basically did ruin it for me. Does wee little old me have any impact of uninstalling the game...nope. But it is my review and this very random development choice was enough for me to stay away.

review: This game sure is something and it that something isn't good. A community more toxic than League of Legends censoring that is 10x worse than Saints Row and the beginning feels like I'm playing a Minecraft clone that is somehow worse than Minecraft itself. My cycle Spawn hit tree with rock hit rock with rock build foundation then got shot by some guy with an auto and full metal armor or die to 3 asian guys with spears to last a lifetime. One time I was lucky enough to find a friendly guy and we took this decent base without walls from two sleeping guys. Claimed it and started feeding it resources so it wouldn't decay. We gave it sturdy walls built a lot of weapons and armor plus we were near a really good resource area. Log back on 15 hours later and I don't spawn in the house. I run back to the exact same location but there was absolutely nothing there except for the house that was outside our that was worse and two bonfires right next to our house that were there before hand. Everything was wiped even though it wasn't a server wipe day. Never found the friendly guy again.For a game that just left early access this feels like the 2 dollar trash that you find on the Xbox Live Marketplace for the Xbox 360. This is such an awful game. I do not recommend ANYONE to buy this disgrace of a survival game. Just buy ARK when it finally goes under $20 so it isn't as much of a scam.P.S. I find it fantastic how the dedicated server that I did this all on says you will be banned if you are being extremely toxic and/or racist but the chat was just filled to the brim with edgy racist remarks about asians and black people along with the few sexist remarks. Nice work admins on keeping peace in a game that is founded on two things killing people before they have a chance of getting anywhere and toxicity that rivals League of Legends.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. This game is garbage. Actual garbage. The community is insanely toxic constantly flooding the chat with insults to no end and people deliberately kill you as a naked (You spawn as a naked) even if they know you have NOTHING. You CANNOT defend yourself against anyone with a gun within the first 3 hours of playing. no server has less than 40 people and usually alot of them are people who join at the very beginning of a server reset which means they get all of the great like ak47's street sign armor hazmat suits armored bases and an incredibly high ego. I know im going to get A TON OF "its alphaaaaa akdnfng" so let me say this alpha requires good update choices to be made into a good game WITH OUT PERFORMANCE BUGS that is the main issue here jesus check some subreddits and other forums Facepunch LOOK AT WHAT WE ARE DEALING WITH. Frankly I'm sorry but no one gives a about your wires because we cant wire together when we are half way through the wall going from 80fps 13fps crashing the game in a span of 6 seconds! In conclusion great game get it now becuase its not that much and you never no it might "git gud" again. However beyond building your own huts and researching the small list of items available there isn't much content. In this case alpha really does mean alpha.

review: REVISED as of 5/31/2015 One wrong turn after another. Bought into this game a few years back Played a bit had some fun then everything went to crap. Hackers running wild (aimbots killbots ect.) constant kill on site BS spend hours farming and building just to log back in and find "EVERTHING" gone never mind the fact that even though you log out your body is still there to be looted and killed. Now you or the stuff you worked your but off to get is safe ever. I like this type of game but I can only start over so many time before it just gets stupid. Now coming back after 6+ months to see to new rust is broken beyond what legacy rust ever was.... I think the devs have taken 1 step forward and about 1000000 back. this is turning into nothing more then a permanent early access alpha than will run out of cash to back it before it is ever completed in any playable state never mind that most of the community has vanished. This is a joke of a game shame I can't get my cash back. Updated Ok so decided to give this another shot. Came back to see a rather long list of updates and pretty often too to my surprise knowing Gary's track record with broken half arsed games. Rust is shaping up to be a pretty good game. As long as the updates keep coming and bugs are4 getting fixed I'm gonna have to give this a thumbs up. There is a good variate of servers with decent populations official servers community servers and modded servers are available.

review: You're always learning with the ups downs slip and fall deaths feeding the bears and wolves... yeah it's enough to make you want to skin a pig! (You can do that to!) Sure you'll see a variety mix of players with different agenda. Some just want to cook your man flesh (or lady flesh) so be wary of spur of the moment cookout requests! As mostly a solo player it can have challenges that makes you re think if alone time is healthy for RUST! Find some cool players start up your own clan or join a an existing one and go to war with the neighbors or stalk your foes through the forests over very tall mountains and probably freeze to death in the process... haha! Where else can you hone your bullet deflecting skills with your trusty rock! (Yes it can be done) There are a ton of plans to learn from the blue print (BP) system which is pretty cool. I can only imagine what options may come available once the xp system is hashed out and released to the masses. While there are some quirks and ongoing fixes it looks feels and plays really well compared to some released products out there today! Give it a try try harder when you fail (and you will... many many times!) and try to keep a level mind that yes you will meet griefers bullies cry babies and the occassional racial slurs (which usually gets players banned from private servers) but the chaos and fun is well worth the head aches!
title: Rust

review: Though Rust is a game in early access it is a very good game amoung it's genre.If you've played ARK before then I can tell you that Rust has much better graphic optimization. (I've played ARK for over 800 hours so you don't need to ask me about how I made the comparison.)However before you buy this game keep this in mind Rust is an open world multiplayer game with servers hosted by both the official and players from the Rust community. Which means that there are griefers new player unfriendly as*holes scavengers raiders and PVP enthusiasts here in some servers. And these people are the main reason to define Rust as a survival game.So if you prefer soloing multiplayer games like ARK avoid Rust. That's because Rust is mainly a PVP game and a pvp game like this usually means that you have to group with others. Otherwise you may learn the definition of the word "heartbreaker". What may break your heart is not the game itself but people.However if you are going to group up with some friends and play together then the situation won't be too hash for you guys. Just build your stronghold (though I doubt that you can find somewhere large enough for a stronghold in a heavily populated server) and raid those poor solo players and enjoy the feeling of dominating. The building mechanics in this game is similar to ARK's (snapping of course) but more flexible and realistic than ARK. Though both Rust and ARK are flawed. Guess that's what a game in EA phase should be.

review: I have a feeling a lot of these positive reviews are paid or otherwise not honest... I've yet to actually meet anyone who has played Rust and really enjoyed it.Server 1 5 deaths (197/200 population) No rocks trees or food anywhere after multiple deaths/ganks. Literally couldn't do anything.Server 2 3 deaths (86/100 population) A few trees no rocks 2 mushrooms. Ended up starving twice cause no animals or food anywhere to be found. One death trying to kill the only animal we could find a Bear which 1 shots you when naked.Server 3 2 deaths (7/100 population) Plenty of trees rocks are still harder to find no rood or animals anywhere we could find. Died both times from starvation which takes a while but shows how long we ran around looking for stuff...Server 4 4 deaths Forget the poluation but this server you spawned with gear / weapons. The combat was horrible compared to real games like CS Overwatch TFC TF2 etc. As a pure combat game this is garbage.TL DR Game is crap. Graphics aren't great compared to other modern games. Resources are scarce or non existant on high population servers making it impossible to actually play. Because there isn't anything to do besides kill each other thats all players do... gank each other over and over.

You die when you see someone without being in an interaction with him/her? This will always be the lack of survival games any game out there. Because there are some ing 10 years old kids or teens adults who have 10 years old kid's brain think these games as a "Deathmatch" thing. Yes of course you will fight with people to live but killing people without even a reason is unacceptable. Then survival type of games are not your kind. Go ing play Deathmatch. People buy these kind of games with a great hope to live the survival experience but the moment he enters the game someone sticks a spear in his The old Rust was very awesome. When there were radiated animals(like the orange bear for example) or zombies people were more friendly. I met 2 guys who were really nice and we built some base from scratch without getting interrupted by other people and fought with other strong groups of people.I think this game's community becomes more savage everyday.... So my opinion is don't buy this game..Go play ARK if you want something more close to survival.. Because even you play it on PvE you have to survive against Dinosaurs. In today's Rust???
