review: This is literaly the worst game I have ever played.when you boot up the game it takes roughly 5 mins and joining a server is around 8. when you get in the game the lag is unreal. the graphics aren't bad on ultra but you need a beast of a pc to run the game like that with more than 10 fps. when you finally get in a server you are a) killed instantly by an overpowered player b) wondering through the woods for 5 hours looking for food until you starve to death or c) looking for your friend for 8 hours until you die via a spear to the face. if your friend spawns you at his base or you somehow manage to survive for more than 2 seconds you are stuck in a cave searching for food looking for wepons or being shot for the rest of your life. if you play for 2 million years you can build up a pretty nice base and watch it be destroyed by a clan of people with rocket launchers. Die. Repeat. that's the whole game. there is nothing else to do no where to go no objective in sight except not being instantly killed. If you somehow manage to join one of the massive clans then your life is raiding bases that are either empty already raided or armed to the teeth with defence systems. You cant spend 8 years building the best base ever either because the servers reset every couple weeks. everything you might have built in that time will be completly erased and there is no way to stop it. The crafting system is horrible too. you have to get literally thousands of resources press a button wait 5 minutres. and it'l poof into your inventory. I may not be the biggest survivle games fan but I can't see why anyone can enjoy this game.

review: I played this game for a few hours and if you say i should not make a review just now but i am This game is not hard to learn after a few hours of gameplay.When i first joined a server i randomly got killed by a bear when i spawned 11/10Got chased by a naked man 11/10Got chased by 2 bears 2 wolfs and they even chase you while you go into the water!! loolWhen your getting chased by loads of people your heart will race and you give everything to get away xDBest parts of the game on what i think.You can make friends and build a house and share your things with them Your like a little family 3You can get guns in the game when really trying for one.You can hunt bears/hogs and wolfs and yes dont fight them with your crap stone You will just get eatten by the bear xD Rob people houses is great fun You hit there walls for ages and the walls come open and you walk in and rob there stuff and they come and start flaming in the chat xDYou can stay underwater without dieing 12/10The cons of the game right now I know its not fully finished.When you die you loss everything you spent hours working for You name it Wood stone Guns Hammers arrows Your tools for building your house.The animals are glitched or bugged When you hit them it does not hurt them and they kill you and most of the time they stand there and let you kill it.The stone you get when you spawn is garbage useless and slow Takes you over 5 mins to take a tree down or a rock.Some of the trees are glitched or bugged When you hit them with something and it gets upto 1000 the tree disappears in thin air lol.Lack of animals Its very rare to find any animals in the wild to kill and lack of stones You have to go to parts of the map to get what your looking for like stone or animals.Bad FPS drops when walking in huge bits of the map I get jumps of lag there and then I should be able to play this game on high without lag.Lacks of stuff in the game like more tools and weapons You should be rewarded for staying alive and working hard for your stuff.I think the beanbags are bugged. I think its called that anyway xD.When you die or get killed you randomly get spawned in the middle of nowhere and when you was with a friend its impossiable to find them again Its all about luck if you walk into them again You should be able to spawn right next to them or by there house.Most important of the whole game NO MAP! I was really sad that there was no map You should be able to mark where you was and get to there I always get lost when i die and i cant find my friend again.You swin like a granny Really slow.We want more hunting gear!The jumping bug.... You can jump over people's walls and rob them and even kill them! xDWhen you kill someone you cant take there stuff I think this should happen!!!!No water in the game The food gives you water ... errr wtf.Got 2 crashes while i had my stuff i worked hard for and when i logged back in it said "Your dead" I was so mad i gave up for today lol.Im not having a go because its unfinished but there is no bloody map!I think this game will be a great game and wouldnt recommand right now I would wait untill its better with a map.but would recommand when finished It will be a great game.Why did i want a game like this? I really wanted to try a game like this and enjoyed it It was boring on your own but when you meet people who are not noobs its really fun and could play for days on end )Thanks for a great game 8/10

review: The loading times are insane constant connectivity issues ONLY with this game. Video lag even when set at level 2 graphic settings. The devs also made it so if your steam account sais your a male you can only play female vice versa.. they claim its not intentional but that is complete lol. Overall gameplay is pretty terrible compared to other games. Constantly buggy and is ridilled with hacks and exploits that the community loves to take advantage of. This game is 100% not a buy. I was very fair in my review of this game given I attempted to give it every benefit of the doubt and play it for a bit. I very much enjoyed the idea of forraging for materials and building a mega base in the middle of nowhere but beyond that this game has little to please its players.The constant updates are EXTREMELY dumb and pointless. They remove features every update rather than add features eg the ability to turn off grass mesh to reduce video lag. I feel like the idea of Rust as a game is a good one but the developement team surely has little to no experience and dont seem to care for their players opinions. If you want to play a game that forces its feminist agenda down your throat while constantly updating a game to remove basic features and ignores hackers who use things like God mode and infinit ammo then this is the game for you! Terrible Terrible Game.PS the ability to pick your gender was one of those features they removed.

review: I will never experience what I've experienced in Rust in ANY other game. This game is something else. It deserves respect. There will be update you disapprove of here and there but the developers actually care about the game. If something is wrong the developers will be there to fix it. I've had some of the most hilarious and intense experiences in this game e.g building a base and locking the door while getting shot at by 3 people that are actually inside the base... I still find this game satisfying to every extent. Shooting someone killing someone looting people raiding. This game is even MORE fun with friends. (dont go out there in 8 man squads tho pls) This game becomes double the fun when there's someone by your side you can experience it with.Buy Rust. It is well worth the money. I have bought this game a week after it was announced on Steam (which is nearly 3 years ago) and my GOD I don't think I could've made a better purchase with my money!

review: Steam gave us a gift. That gift is the ability to refund terrible games. Here is my story.You spawn in naked on a beach with a bunch of other naked guys. You get shot nearly instantly from one of the large bases near the beach. You respawn on a different beach and make it to the woods. You weren't killed this time! But someone elses spawns on that beach and beats you to death with a rock. After about 20 minutes of dieing constantly you finally get far enough from that damn beach to start doing stuff. You build a bow and some arrows. You find some food and hunt some game. Then out of ing no where comes a bear. You bows doesn't do crap against the bear. You get slaughtered by the bear. Then you respawn on that beach. You realize that you've only spent 1 hour and 59 minutes on the game. You quickly get off the game and go to steam support. You refund the game. You turn back your clock 2 hours and act like you never wasted you time playing Rust. Go play anything but Rust. You will die from everything. But when you think you've survived you'll die from a ninja bear attack or maybe cancer. Rust always has a way of making you die rage and refund.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!This game is one of the worst games I have ever played.Story There is none.Graphics You don't have any control over graphics. You get a quality slider resolution and that is it.The animations in this game are horrible even on the highest setting.Gameplay You start with absolutely nothing. Only a rock 2 bandages (which do nothing) and a torch.You use the rock on trees and boulders to get materials. You then can craft stuff.And then you get gang banged by 20 red wolves and red bears and eventually get shot by some setting you back all the way from the beginning. It's like purgatory. It never ends.Music Ha! You wish! All of it sounds like ambient and is barely worth listening to.Multiplayer Is all you got. No singleplayer. You have a choice of 3 kinds of servers Official modded and community. All ofwhich are probably going to have at least 3 4 hackers on. Oh and when the video says "Make friends!" You're notgoing to. And if you do its either your friends or a 10 year old pre pubescent boy who is tired of getting killed. LikeI am of this game. You're probably thinking "Oh its in alpha! They're making improvements and " Look at minecraft. In its alpha it had actualmusic fluent and balanced gameplay and singleplayer!Raiting 3/10. Do. Not. Buy. It.

review: Rust Is My Favourite GameSo when I originally bought this game I really didn't understand how to play it so it pretty much just sat in my library untouched. After about a year I decided to learn to play although with no help from the toxic community I learned from my friend who has a few hundred hours put in. It wasn't easy at first and learning to build a pretty well fortified base it took time. 3 weeks ago I had barely 20 mins played. To this day I have almost hit 100 hrs.Here are some things I've learned Base building takes time to perfect get on a server that does full wipes every few weeks and learn from your mistakes each wipe. People are s if they think you have useful gear they will kill you. Get thick skin! people will kill you take your stuff and then wait for you to come back to kill you again. Learn from people not everyone is an some are looking for people to join up with. Power is in numbers clans are big in Rust though they do have solo servers. Finally the game is in Alpha it's not perfect. If you're having trouble with FPS drops try lowering your settings quality its not your graphics card it's the game. (my looks like minecraft sometimes and I get 60+ frames.)I love this game cause Grapchics Fighting system Good CommunityI recommend everyone to play it it is the best game I ever played!

review: Closing in on 500 hours in this game I have to say that this is a definite "must buy". I've had a lot of fun with this online rock bashing gun blasting shack invading game. However it hasn't been without many of frustration and it hasn't been without it's rough patches.The bad moments in this game were most certainly caused by the hackers and cheaters who continue to run rampant and they have since this game went live on Steam back in December 2013. There is a lot of immaturity and griefing as well but I can handle the griefing as long as everything else is on a level playing field.I give Facepunch studios who made this game all the credit however as they are currently working on an entirely new build of rust to make it bigger better and hopefully able to stop hackers and cheaters much better as well. They said they never expected this game to grow to anywhere close to the popularity levels it quickly reached and now they are re building it better then ever to adjust. The good thing is that the $19.99 USD charge gets you both versions that will be kept online seperately. You're not going to have to fork out new money or any upgrade fee to get into Rust 2.0 when it officially launches very likely before the end of 2014.This game reveals the true nature of people trying to survive in a land without rules and law. It's a true survival of the fittest type of game and every man for himself.My best advice when playing... Fend for yourself. Don't be afriad to run and/or hide when you need to. And Trust Noone.This game is epic fun and the most fun I've had with a game in the past 10 years. It's truly a shame that some people have to go to all ends to buy or aquire illegal hacks and cheats to get an unfair advantage over other players and ruin the playing experience for so many others. We can all hope that Rust 2.0 can reduce these lame ducks in the game and make it an enjoyable rock war festival for all. )

review: Buy this game if you want to Experience the joy of wandering aimlessly for hours on end searching for useful loot and get killed by a random person with an AK47 or a person with a bow from a mile away and totally lose all of your stuff and start with nothing. Your time will be utterly wasted I promise you. Lose all of your stuff and then have to start over because your NPC 'sleeps' when you disconnect from a server. Some random player will kill you and take all of your belongings. Your time will be utterly wasted I promise you.Build a fort with painstaking effort and then have someone randomly launch rockets at you and blow it up open and steal all of your stuff and force you to spawn randomly somewhere in the map where you will get killed randomly again after painstaking effort of finding useful materials and then start with nothing again. Your time will be utterly wasted.Build a fort and then get killed because of someone with a wall/aimbot hack or someone glitching their way into your fort watch them loot all your stuff and force you to basically start over again. Your time will be utterly wasted.THAT'S BASICALLY THE WHOLE GAME LOL.oh and major bugs animals clipping through walls is my favorite bugI remember why I didn't play this game so much.

review: I hate games that force you to play a certain way. Like not allowing you to free roam cannot start a new game or character doesn't tell what what area is best for you or for this game you arent allowed to play singleplayer. I am alright with those MMO games where you can go off and do what you want on your own. I absolutely hate games that have "servers" like hello I like playing the way i want not the way you force. Like DayZ you need to be on a server these are both games i hate cause they force a certain way of playing on you without saying so when you buy it. When it says Multiplayer I'm thinking you log in and start playing with a bunch of people you may or may not know. But games like this say multiplayer when they actually mean "Pay us money now go find a server made by someone you may or may not know and play on it. Singleplayer that is funny. You expect us the game creators and company to make a different mode for this game so more people can have fun? Thats too much effort we force the players to make the servers themselves." this is what i think of this "multiplayer" t game and other games that enforce these personal servers. I am a person who dislikes most multiplayer games greatly and hate spending my money on t like this. Ok this might be considered venting but how much of this is true about the game itself all of it. If you hate what i say about the game look at a better review.

review: &gt Some guys build up a base on a rock. Forgot to place window bars We rob them.&gt Some guys were building secondary big base to move in it as a main base. We found place we could build up and rob them.&gt Some guys started to shoot our base with rockets. We had only pistols. Now we have rocket launcher some AK's and Bolts. &gt We forgot to destroy enemy outdoor tool cupboard near our base and they started to build up a raid house near us. We kill them took their weps and blew up wall to destroy tool cupboard. Near cupboard we found a chest. Now we have 3 rocket launchers and 40+ rockets taken from that chest.&gt Somebody was raiding a house nearby. I dress naked and ran to look what's up. Spot a guy far running and then just dropping down (exits a game). I ran to him and stole his whole gear and after succesfully returting to our base.&gt (Happened alot of times) Somebody is raiding nearby (or notso nearby). We gather as team and run onto somebody's house rescure. Now we have tons of Rockets C4s Chests for every single weapon fully filled with them 10+ chests of armor gear alot of resources. &gt Suddenly after 2 weeks from last wipe server online drops from 100+ to avg. 10 people online. &gt Giving our house door pass in public chat. Changing server The Mighty Loop continues.In the end i want to clearify. Was a Rust player before experimental became actual game and old Rust became Legacy. The game heavely changed since experimental was open alpha. And it's changing step by step every week. Game sadly is not so optimized for me yet I am able to see average of 45 fps on my old timer PC. Devs are trying go solve problems players encounter and also they add stuff. Alot was changed and personally I like fresh new experimental alot more than crappy old Legacy where every weapon looks like m16 without a clip and red zombie bears dropping food meds and c4 recipies.. The list can go on and on. Would i recommend? Only if you have friends to play it with. Else what it's a hardcore mode to survive solo.

review: Certainly the best overall open world kill everyone on sight game.Life is Feudal has superior melee and technical details but the game's boringly stiff. ARK has waaaaay more features but all clunkily implemented. Conan is years away from competing. H1Z1's been stillborn since launch (in survival not KOTH). These devs are experimenting with what's fun. If it aint fun they scrap it entirely they don't try to hack it in and make it fun and add onto the pile of crap. They care about keeping out the busywork that other survival games pride themselves in. They focus on all issues instead of freaking out and going all performance optimization this month and features next month and so on and so on. Take notes other devs.

review: DISCLAIMER This is a first impressions review and NOT a full review PLEASE NOTE This review is/was written when this game was in/is still in Early Access. Think twice before buying/playing this game Rust is a game developed and published by Facepunch Studios the same people behind the sandbox game GModRust can be a very fun survivial game especially with friends which I don't have. It can sometimes feel very slow pace on the official servers so If you want to quickly build and join in on the action I'd suggest a modded server with faster crafting and gatheringThe good things about Rust are that players can host their own servers off of their computers for free or pay to have it hosted on a local server. Rust offers an intricate and fun base building system. The hunting/gathering portion is fun and Rust offers a day/night cycle with an ever changing weather systemThe game is moddable with frequent updates and development blogs. The game offers a procedural generated world which gives you a sense of paranoia and generated biomes which include desert snow and grassHowever Rust has loads of issues in its current state. The game tends to lag if too many people are connected to the server and uses a lot of RAM with framerate and crashing issues. Rust surprisingly runs on the Unity engine making it not the best for optimization but the development team is managing to fix it and also animals don't follow rules of physics such us running up walls if they feel like itOne thing I absolutely hate in Rust is the sleeper servers. Even when you log off you are still in game and able to be killed. Pretty much forces you put in time to build a stable base before leaving the server or risk being killed which takes time and patienceOverall if you have the money I'd suggest looking into buying this game. It is currently in Alpha so really look into it before purchasing. However I wouldn't whole heartdly recommend it in its current state RECOMMENDED )
title: Rust

review: Game is no better than DayZ in fact it's basically Day Z without zombies and you don't get a can of beans to start with.The playerbase is made up entirely of griefers and folks kicked from dayz servers. As usual they have found all sorts of ways of ruining games for fun. Current favorite seems to be spamming servers with tool cabinets inside small fortified boxes that block any other players from building within a 50m radius making games effectively unplayable on official servers unless you're a pal of one of the griefers. Admins are non existant and nothing is done to deal with this issue.Community servers are even worse with little or no matterials available and entire areas walled off so only a select few can loot. Modded servers are right out.Definitely not worth the $20 for this "survival" knockoff.

EU RUST PRO Trader Zones Clan Markers X5 X10 Wiped 11/02Welcome all RUST PRO is a brand new server looking to deliver the best rust experiance out there in the modded community RUST PRO has been developed from the ground up and has been through vigorous testing and is now ready for launch. We have compiled a vast selection of mods and features on RUST PRO including trader zones Multiple Safe Zones are situated throughout the map allowing them to water up trade or even sleep over night for any weary travelers. The leveling system is also in place with a cap of 100 that when maxed out will grant you the X5 gather rate starting gather rate is X1. Airstrikes are available to buy when desired but this is nothing a fresh spawn can do you must work your way up to do such a thing! After each map wipe we offer to players the ability in which to copy their base to place on the next restart too this must be requested though of course. Bouties are in the server for those hated players within the server and there is also an official trade function for those who are respected in the server also its nice to have the trade function too as im sure the last thing you want is to be screwed over another advantage over the safe zones. Entering them will likely be a challenge though as tp's or even building in these areas will be prohibited. The cupboards also are not the vanilla ones they are in a sphere shape protecting you from all angles but of course no bases are unraidable!Backpacks will be available to players along with Sign artist instacraft quicksmelt Better Loot Clans Enhanced Hammer Fishing friendly Fire Private Message Events Active Admins and much much more!Our aim at RUST PRO is to give everyone a classic yet unique experiance and with an array of experianced admins to help anyone in need this server is brand new but has had great feedback from the start. We are also offering reward packages (for a limited time) if you are bringing on any new players in the server just message an admin in game and we will be more than happy to help.Server details I.P 144.76.87.228 28216TeamSpeak I.P 185.70.11.84 10017We hope to see you soon!Kindest Regards

review: This game is simply amazing. Although in alpha this game is remarkable the graphics are amazing and the way it runs is just brilliant. Rust is a survival game where you start with a 2 bandages a rock and a torch you then proceed to gather materials and make a house. As the game goes along it gets harder to make items which gives it a longer play time. The PvP aspect is amazing as a half naked man can run over a hill and demolish you which is pretty funny in my experience. I rate it 9/10 just as I feel the updates need to be a little faster.EDIT NEW RUSTThis game just gets better not only are the devs dedicated enough to rework the game completely they update it every week! The graphics are god like and the PvP is even better than before although a half naked man killing you usually involves a bow or a spear and you end up crying in a corner. I rate it 10/10 Game Of The Year Nice work Facepunch DEDIT NEW NEW RUST ing mate.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME YET. I say YET because it is literally FILLED with hackers. The game has great foundation. It's fun it's unique it's an engaging experience of survival in it's truest form. Forage or die. Gather food resources to build shelter tools weapons and armor. The game is crushed by hackers that force your character to suicide that noclip aimbot and even re configure your houses door lock. When you make a house and a door the door locks itself. Only you have the "key" to open said door. Hackers switch the owners on the doors to them and take everything you've worked for. This is every server. Even the official servers. Gary Newman and Steam are both working to get this issue resolved but it is not worth the hours of torment you'll endure trying to even get a foothold in this game. Even after that you get your things taken by both players and hackers. The community in this game treat it like a CoD crafting game. No matter what you have if you've even just started out people with great gear and equipment will gun you down with no second thought and taunt you about it non stop. There is no good I can say about the players in this game whatsoever. They are honestly the reason it's garbage. A great game completely foiled by the children and hackers that ooze from every pixel of this game.

You can be naked carrying a rock with no loot at all on you and someone with a gun will shoot you.If you enjoy playing the lone wolf or in small groups while interacting with human beings without necessarily having to kill everything that moves don't buy this game.This is a game for people who play in large groups that like to see what life would be like if we all devolved into animals. There is nothing social about the servers it is pure savagery. Ultimately this is a gauntlet run to get tech'd up to guns so that all the people killing newbies may actually pause and rethink as taking you on may be an even match up.A real shame the gameplay is awesome.

review: Boulder Rootkit Simulator KYS 2015. Rust wants to be the ARK Island map but can't... It's the Unity engine client server game where different maps fail at many attempts to mimic the Unreal engine and ARK survival ultra graphic settings... Screenshots may look nice but gameplay isn't and servers drown themselves in clutter objects... 70% of the map content is the same gigantic 10 000 verticy boulder shrunk and glued thousands of different places across the many islands... I found a server called BARREN where all clutter objects have been removed. The amount of actual game content that isn't clutter is hillarious near 10%. The devs should rethink Rust quality settings and rebuild from "potato" up. Potato being said one must realize that these are abusive developers... An integrated Workshop feature frequently updates item data while playing. This feature manifests as malicious graphic performance stuttering. It updates workshop item lists that cause fragmentation across the system and game drive then ultimately these fragmented workshop item data files do slow read and write speeds durring gameplay. Simply put Rust is a workshop rootkit that does attack hardware to cause poor gaming performance. I regret buying it on sale and do not recommend it to anyone. #uninstall

review: This game is absolute garbage. The graphics are so poor even at max settings its difficult to distinguish items and resource nodes and often bears attack out of nowhere. The game itself is very boring and revolves around collecting mats while managing hunger and thirst. Theres no point though. As soon as you get a weapon even a crappy bow a helicopter comes to kill you and you lose everything. The bugs make the game near unplayable such as animals walking through walls or floating on air dropped items disappearing or clipping through the ground bears spawning on top of you and no true multiplayer since theres no way to spawn on your friends add friends in game or even figure out where they are on the map.0/10 worst game Ive played in a long time

review: do i recommend this game? its alright.... 1.) developers are making enough money from sales and skin sales that they roll out with updates two to three times a month2.) the game has its own running servers even if the players have lost intrest in running their own3.) theres more than 500+ player servers to pick from in many play modes some are modded others are normal but run their own events in game4.) if you like building this is a game for you5.) now that i said that get ready to blow up in anger when you loose you're house to a bunch of idiots6.) at any given moment a player "or players" can come steal from you and take you're shoes7.) you can speak in the game voice chat and type chat. i had some strange visits at times8.) you can paint real life pictures in the game on many different picture frames9.) you can grow your own food and cloth asuming you have fuel to grow it indoors10.) theres a garenteed global wipe to all servers every first thursday of the new month11.) the garenteed global wipe means EVERONE on all servers starts new again12.) this is NOT a pay to win game. the only thing you can buy is skins13.) you can have your team mates craft you store bought skins to wear14.) they have boobys on the female charaters and pen*s on the males15.) you start out with nothing except a rock and a torch and grow from there16.) this game is about trust and survival most of the time your teamates will turn on you. so the game is never the same twice.17.) infinite gameplay 24/7. even the quickest servers last 1 week before they wipe. so thats 7 days of surviving. "trust me you probably wont survive long anyways" 18.) even if you die... you just re spawn and try again but most people rage quite and come back after the global wipe. the 1st thrsday of every new month19.) this game is better than ARK by population terms20.) go see for yourself at the community hub here on steam and see how many people are in game RIGHT NOW....if the game was bad... people wouldnt be playing it

review: Rust together with 7 Days to Die are at the moment the most unique games out there for the simple reason that you are getting minecraft in a real zombie apocalypse scenario and what I mean to say by that is that you can build virtually anything yes anything from a tower to a stadium of course you can also dig in 7 Days to Die but that's for another review. With an active and large community I can easily prefer this over DayZ any day there is a crafting system in the game storage/inventory one tho you gotta watch out for trust tho there are a lot of bandits in the game like in DayZ even whole raiding groups/parties and teams so I'd suggest you play the game with a friend on a low lag server with a friendly admin to kick or ban hackers/cheaters and use creative ways to defend your base and to make the the most raiding proof if not strongest one in the server because trust me it will come in handy even if you are not attacked on the 1st or 2nd day.

review: So I have over 700 hours on this game as a MAC user so I'm not some new person writting a review. Let me start off by saying this. GARRY IS A SCAMMER. Sorry people but it's the truth. If you have a MAC do NOT buy this game. He is constantly breaking this game and not fixing the things that he breaks instead he just continues to add more content while leaving the MAC client broken. Now a patch goes wrong on the PC client and it's maybe an hour later then it's fixed. A patch goes wrong for the MAC client and we're still at three days and waiting for a patch to fix it. Said patches are game breaking to where you can't even play for five minutes before the game crashes or the game crashes as you just get into it. If you cannot see how game breaking this is well I'm sorry. Next let's go onto the useless updates. Instead of fixing said connection issue with the MAC client we instead get a patch that breaks the game and gives us guitars. Wooooo. You know that's what MAC users need a guiatar that we cannot play due to not being able to get inside of the game. Perfect. Right? So what are we at so far? You spending 20.00 for a game where a part of the userbase (MAC users) are left out of the support. So really what you are buying if you are a MAC user is another "The Stomping Land." There is no support or DEV team there and there is no support or DEV team here for MAC users. Do not buy this game if you use MAC. I will change this review when the game is stable for our kind again. Then adding MAC into the system list is just a CASH GRAB if you play this your going to be playing legacy not the newer version.

review: Im starting to get super addicted to this game but its just way too premature to reccomend at the moment.ProsAddicting like you wouldn't believe.. Im not exactly sure what it is but once i get going i just can't stop. And building your own base/stashing your loot is a real rush as it gives you a sense of defending your livlihood. Awesome crafting system blueprints explosives bolt action rifles medkits bloodbags Voice chat global text chat nice sense of community and tons of the vegan hipster type of gamer Very simple and straightforward once you get down the basicsCons There is so little content that i can count all the in game items on one hand Its FAR too easy to obtain the best items in the game blueprints for the best weapons should be rare yet they drop from every other zombie (this worries me because i have all the end game content on my first day i sense i will grow bored fast) Way too easy to craft things building a house costs 50 wood which you can obtain in 5 hatchet hits of a wood pile Lag extremely poor optimization overheats my video card and only gets about 25 30fps on a radeon 7970. Wasnt expecting that from a game with maybe three textures total. Connection lag again unplayable players rubberband around the map. Poor hit registration if a player goes to hit you with a rock you can just run through his body to the other side.

review: Worst piece of trash wanna be a game out there. New players are forced to join what is essentially a PvP server and start out naked on the beach while everyone else has already crafted semi automatics and high powered ammo. You are supposed to find firewood and build a fire while everyone else gets to kill others and rob their camps. The onscreen cues can't seem to decide if they want a keyboard or gamepad. The keybind screen shows everything but how to Use something which is apparently the most important button you have. Then it gets dark and you can't even see where any wood is because you couldn't even find it in the daylight. It took 20 minutes to load for me to play 5 of the most miserable minutes I have ever endured. All the while reading the toxic hatred thrown back and forth between stoner tags like monkeys throwing feces at the zoo. I hope you didn't spend any money on this waste of time and digital space it's not even worth it to pirate.

review: So My last Review of RUST was very Negative. So I'm updating it so it's not written in a Fit of Rage.It's still not worth it in my opinion. I have tried countless times to Load in 20+ Minutes every time. Then I "Lag Out/Get Booted" From Servers after I Load in again. It's a Shame cause this was highly anticipated in my books. I'd love to play it and have fun. But the Server Connection is stopping me. I'm Declined a Refund from Steam every time I request it so I can't do anything there and I can't get into the game everytime the Servers Lag out. I'd love to describe the Game Play Graphics and overall Enjoyment of the Game but thanks to the Issues I have been having it's not happening.If you want to give the Game a try go ahead. I'm not here to tell you what Games to play and what not to play. So give RUST a try if you Like it keep it if Not? Then hope theRefund works.Best of Luyck out there and I hope my Review helped some of you.(EDITED On May 10 2018 at 11 10pm Pacific Time)

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Do you enjoy multiplayer only games? Where you can't even practice on your own experement or just build? Then this game is for you.I like to play around with the mechanics build large bases and explore. You can't do that in this with out dealing with many people shooting you in the back or camping spawn points and killing you just as you come into the game.Until there is an option to play single player in this game I can not recommned it.From what I have playes (when a friend was paying for a server) it was a nice game. I had fun building and finding/crafting items and just looking around/exploring.Graphics are nice and the game runs smoothly for me so no compaints there just the lack of a single player to go play around in when I don't want to deal with people.Update Seeing as how character look gender and race are now being decided for us I can not recommend this game at all. One of the aspects of these games is the ability to make a character your own the way you want it. This has been taken from user and replace with an algorithm leaving people with what they may not enjoy playing.If I could get a refund for this game I would. I have finaly regretted an Early Access Purchase. Updated for release Game on full release now and still no single player set up. Instead you need to have a dedicated server running on your system and then run the RUST game and connect.ARK seems a bit more thought out and user friendly to me in reguards to this aspect. At least there I can easily create a local game to play around and build things.

review: Got this game yesterday played it for 4 hours in total. I have to this this game is amazing the gameplay is so smooth especially for a game in alpha stages. What's best about this game is being with your friends. Six of us all roaming the beautiful landscape of Rust raising bases killing other gangs of savages. Developing our skills in combat and gaining the best gear. Base building we chose a builder for our crew and in no time we had a fully functional base which gave us somewhere to aboard an room to store our valuable gear. I strongly recommend this game especially if you an your friends are going to play it as well. It offers hours of fun. This game is in alpha so some things like some textures of some buildings haven't been done yet. However I'm expecting good things in the future. Buy this game now!

Good luck getting started without being killed over and over. More PvP (player vs player) then anything.Good Easy to pick up and build/create areas if not bothered. Graphics are not top notch but they're not bad either. My i7 3.4ghz and amd 6770 hd can play without lag. Future looks "good" Hard to think of the good sometimes. I'd say wait for more releases before buying but still keep an eye (wishlist) on this game.

review: This game while it is very fun and addictive has severe problems for a survival game. Most games your gear will be saved when you get off in this game when you disconnect from a server your body is left sleeping on the ground which if you have a house would not be a problem. Unfortunately all it takes is for one person to run along break down your door and steal everything you have worked several hours for. Fun but not worth the hassle.Also the game is terribly optimized I get 60 fps on every other game but on this game there are frequent graphics errors and frame rate problems. This is the only negative review I have ever bothered placing because this game is almost a waste of time to play.

review: Well after playing Rust the Game I was very impressed with the idea as well as the graphics. As an old fan of Lego world of Minecraft this game places among the top with its ability to keep you entertained as well as struggling with environmental challenges. You must find/create clothing shelter and feed yourself. One if not all sometimes seems demanding. As you fight a bear with a rock no clothing and night fall is approaching!! Yet you still haven't acquired enough wood to begin a shelter. This game fantastic!I've also noticed like all games you tend to have some less than desirable players. But this comes as part of the world you are trying to build in. You are naked with a Rock and trying to survive. It IS survival of the fittest as well as the most equipped.The new Experimental version is even better with its graphics sound and immersive landscapes.I have just began both Rust and Steam and I can say now that I have High Hopes for the game of Rust although muddling through Steam's less than desirable layout is not fun but worth the pain. Good luck Rust This Rock is for you.Caleb CintaryDj of Pro Star Radiohttp //www.ProStarRadio.comTWITTER http //www.twitter.com/prostarradio

So before you buy u may have to alot of sitting infront of the computer looking at installation screens. research before you buy. p.s. FIX IT!!!!!!!!!!!!! Once the problem is fixed it seems very fun.
title: Rust

review: I actually got lost in the wilderness and the skills I learned in Shack Simulator 2014 helped me survive. First I grabbed a medium sized rock and killed a wild boar then repeatedly beat the carcass with the rock until chicken breasts and cloth came out. I moved on to a tree and started slamming it with my rock. It didn't actually fall down but I gathered plenty of wood logs so I used them to make several shacks. I didn't actually use them for shelter or sleep though they were just for show.I came across a boulder and started slamming it with my rock which got me a bunch of metal. I used that metal to craft a door and built myself a house to call my own in the middle of my shack city. I cooked and ate my pig breasts so I wouldn't go hungry and crafted a complete sleeping bag including with zippers and a pillow from the cloth I got pulled off of the pig.As I was settling down for the night a bald Korean man materialized through my house's wall and shot me in the head instantly. He looted all of my things and destroyed my sleeping bag. Thankfully the bullet only grazed my skull and I lived to tell about it.I can tell you that if it wasn't for the survival skills I learned in this game I wouldn't be here today. 10/10.

review: On the plus side The crafting side of the game is awesome. The blueprint system is good. I like the fact that you don't forget the blueprints you've learned between server resets. However before you buy the game like other players have said The game is BRUTAL. Don't expect to survive long. Even as a naked man with nothing more than a rock and a torch you will be killed. The environment is dangerous though I've never been killed by anything in it. (Bears and wolves as well as the cold and starvation can kill you. I've just never lasted long enough for them to be trouble for me.)The PVP aspect is high. If you enjoy hardcore kill or be killed action then this game has it. If you do not enjoy that type of game don't put down the money. That is all this game is about.

review: Rust is a good game with lots to do for everyone. I have seen people successfully play and ENJOY the game as many roles from carpenter farmer hunter/gatherer trader all the way to the extreme opposite as a Raider/PVPer. And don't listen to those who are giving negative reviews because of the community As with any game that has multiplayer where you deal with other "real" people there will be those who have issues playing nice (Thats just how people are if you havn't figured that out yet) and there are entire servers full of people who will do anything to make themselves feel empowered by killing anyone they see regardless of being able to defend themselves or just wanting to be left alone... Easily solution to this problem if its not your thing Move to a NEW SERVER! There are lots of decent servers out there as well with friendly communities who just want to be your friend and together build a brothel where you and everyone you just befriended can go do non violent things with each other and not worry about being hunted by another player. Like I said Rust has stuff for everyone sometimes you just have to find it. Overall good game that is regularly being updated and deffinantly worth picking up.

review: I picked up this game right around when it came out and I would say it was very good for an early release game. There was not too many bugs to speak of and overall very playable. I just came back to it now after this whole new experimental sandbox hype and I got to say this game turned to a piece of I know that this aspect of the game is very new but the amount of bugs is just stupid. I joined an empty server with a friend to mess around and have a bit of fun. After we spent a good hour trying to find each other we got right off to smacking some trees with our big rock. After we got some resources we discovered that we need to kill animals to get cloth because that makes sense. Well Chasing a boar with a hatchet is fun if you want to run for a mile only having a chance of being able to hit it. My friend basically said F #$ this and we went after a bear. Well he died. I gathered up all his stuff and then after an hour he found me again. Great. Here is where the BS starts. When he gets back to where I am he asks for his hatchet back. I say fine let me go into my inventory... oh where did it go? I know I picked it up. Oh well here are the resources to make it. I drop them on the ground and he picks them up. He then proceeds to say where are they? Apparently you can't drop stuff and have others pick it up. Not sure if it is a server setting but this needs to not happen. Found that the only work around was to put items in a chest so that he could take them out. I finally get enough resources after multiple deaths to make this piece of crap pistol that basically doesn't work unless you are 3ft away from something. I get it and understand that the accuracy isn't great but at least give me some sort of hit indication on something. I gained a bit of confidence and went after a bear. I shot at him at first and was about 30ft away. I started to kite him and thought that this was easy. The bear then proceeded to do some form of a swipe with his claw from 40 feet away and I died. Left game....This game started well but this new experimental thing is such a piece of crap. I don't know how you can release something with this amount of bugs.

Overall this game gets an A+ rating for its nice map and infinete amount of things to do.

review: Ah... This game benn hesitating to write a true review for Rust because of how unstable the community can be compared to how fluent and amazing the gameplay can be... So here it is. Rust where the description of the game that the devs wrote up only explains what the game could be and what it severely lacks of. Rust has always been the go to game for stable PvP fights because DayZ has that "I hope I don't lag out while shooting this guy from 400 meters away" feel many people left the game to transfer to Rust but since the game developers have been reiterating the gathering and crafting system into a blueprint system then a component system it makes it difficult for a solo player which yes I get that numbers make the experience easier therefore better but nothing can stop offline raids which is the nail in the coffin whenever my friends and I play rust in the big servers no clans want to raid you when you have defenses which really hits us all hard unfortunately with the way the community's mentality formed around "kill or be killed" and "scumbag mentality wins over playing the game the way it is intended to be played" no one will ever think to raid you online our clan is of 5 people all who get on relatively same time so we can enjoy roaming meeting people and shooting those guys who shoot at us. But we never get farther than the first three days before we get offlined. Now this is not to bash on the devs. They are great at updating this game and their future plans for Rust makes it such a promising game more so than any other game I can think of. But it's where the community forms from its public mentality that makes this game unplayable. If people like cruel and punishing gameplay then yes I strongly recommend this game to anyone to me however I like having a defense against offline raids tameable creatures or more ai controlled defenses like electric fences or robotic mechanisms! This is where I would like to see this game at until then I will stick to a server where the community would rather be that bit more friendlier and not shoot that guy who only has a Tshirt on or would og as far as to greeting you without guns to your face or at least not offline raid me the moment I go to bed. D

review: hour 1 your on an island with a rock and a tourch....hour 100 your raiding bases and killen noobs with rocket launchers and AK's...Start on a low population server and figure out the mechanics then move to Rustopia or Rustrilasia and never look backI have played since the old game engine (legacy)The game in the new engine has now surpassed the old and continues to update and move forward on a weekly bases.Check out Vertiigo Gaming on youtube and you will see what this game is all about..I promise you will not sleep eat or work without rust on your mind once you get hooked. With the persistant world that you sleep in when you log off. The ability to loot your foes (or them loot your corpse). The building and crafting that gets better and better with every update.. this is the Core of HardCore gaming... Check out the DevBlogs... there is NO game you will purchase for $20 that will hold a candle to the immense stress and anxioty that this game will thrust upon you. Just buy it you cheap bastard its only $20

review: I can safely say after 160+ hours of gameplay that this game is the definitive survival style game to play. Even now with a majority of the crowd playing ARK It is easy to just jump in about anywhere and make yourself a gameplay that you want to follow.Pros Weekly updatesEarly access that is constantly being updated and interacted withPlayer builds as well as server generated structuresServer wipes to keep maps refreshed and not so cluttered with ruinsA good weapon base for melee and ranged alikeAlready a wide variety of armor with more to comeGood range of servers mods and players to mix up the experienceCons Can be a bit performance intense but they address some of these issues frequently during updatesCurrently (Since the addition of ladders) there is all but a requirement to add overhangs to at least one floor if not every floor which can look really terrible after seeing it enough timesThe stability system for building can be very annoying to deal with but there are mods for it if you choose to play that way.

review: It's a great survival game that I would play over DayZ any day. This game is actually being continuously updated every week and it's getting better and better.When they say "things will change" they mean it. The game faced a massive overhaul in one of this year's update with the "Experimental" game becoming the default selection when you launch the game. In the new Rust textures user interface building mechanics and so on are changed for the better.I would recommend this to anyone who's thinking about buying DayZ or even if you currently own it and are looking at Rust. Buy it. It is a different game but it's a better game.

review: This is a survival game with dynamics of farming/looting building crafting and shooting. You only need to do the first three to survive (farm build and craft). I first played this game when it was legacy and it was so much fun. It was a game where you can meet with people. There were bandits that everyone hated. And it was just so much fun. Now everybody is just killing each other. There is no farming no building creative bases but just killing. There is no sense of community unless you're playing with friends. Going han solo is a waste of time you're not going to survive. Geared guys killing nakeds. Nakeds killing nakeds too for some reason. It is no longer a playable game. That's why the player base has declined over the years. There has to be a change. And I'm not talking about those weekly updates. Something big. Something that would bring people together because survival games are about community. Don't get me wrong I love shooting and raiding etc. It's just the game is more than that. And people are ruining it. If you're playing alone By the second or third day every rad town and air drop will be dominated by clans. You have to farm hard. Looting is very difficult playing solo so do it at nights! Build your base somewhere close to recyclers. Lighthouse is a good spot because you can hear them when they swim to it. If you see a group of two or more run like hell!

review: Lazy developpers taking the easy way out with everything.Progress is too easy ? Make the system the grindiest out there only possiblity to hit high tier for people who don't play the game 24/7 or solo players is to get lucky and kill a high gear and even then is wiped the next week.People are complaining about the recoil of the weapon being badly designed ? Whine like a 12 year old and say "people are ing so we're changing everything now the recoil is a set pattern that everyone can learn in 30 minutes" Leading to hilariously terrible gunplay+5 Player clans are the only ones who can consistently enjoy the game at a high level of play ? Meh doesn't matter. Let's add brainless puzzles that require you to waste 3 inventory slots that way solo players will be even less able to get loot.And then there's the overused forced craft system upon you again which pushes solo players out of the equation because everything takes an insane amount of time to craft so you'll either Wait for the night that lasts 15 minute to craft everything you need or waste your time crafting during the day then get cockblocked by 15 minute PITCH DARK night open the steam overlay ( Because you cannot alt tab when you're using the true fullscreen launch option ) and waste your time on the internet instead of actually playing the game.Oh yeah about the alt tab that's another great feature of the game Unity the engine every moron repeats "It's only bad because bad games are made with it" but even with big titles as Rust and Escape from Tarkov it shows that huge projects are slowed and players harassed with issues caused by this terrible engine.And of course they chose an obsolete network because it was free and they weren't confident enough in their project to choose something pristine from the get go.All of their bad choices led to an entire game restart ( Legacy to experimental ) and even then issues that occured in the legacy game still occur to this goddamn day.If it was still in early access i'd be hesitant to post this but they had the audacity to think "The game's good enough" to get it out of the early access hole but for what ? The game's far from complete and they're 6 9 months late on everything they wanted to add into the game ( https //rust.facepunch.com/roadmap/ )The game is not all bad but it's definitly mostly bad every enjoyable thing gets absolutely hammered into the ground by the dreadful boring and lifeless time base inventory and ressource management you have to consistently be atop of.Another game filled with potential slaughtered by a lack of passion.

review: Let's talk about the side of rust that none of the negative reviews mention. That is of course the hardware requirements. When I started playing this it ran just fine locked my 60 fps and all that then some patches later it came as a surprise that whatever I did it could not get to 60 anymore. I said fine I can make it look uglier so I turned friquin potato mode one scaled down resolution and I could scrape a stable 30 fps after several patches.Now that I would want to continue playing this game it came as a very big surprise that they updated the specs of the game. I tought it would not have been such a dramatical change.But it was! Sadly my rust experience went from stable 60fps down to 10fps (at best times) within a year please note that!What is the moral of this story you ask? Well first of all don't buy early access games (like ever) and second league of legends ing sucks please STOP GIVING ME ADVERTISEMENTS YOUTUBE I DONT LIKE YOU.Thank you rust that I could play a 100 hours of your game then you made it impossible.BTW. I don't blame the developers and the legal side of this stuff I know very much how shady early access terms are so it was worth a try but thank you never again.BYE SORRY FOR MAKING THIS LONG

review: Used to be a good game. Now it's purely clan wars. If you plan on playing this solo good luck the grind is worse than most mobile games ever since they combined the blueprint and component system. If you have a group of buddies you're still going to have trouble because they don't wipe bps every month so people will have much quicker access to crafting higher tier weapons where they can easily camp and raid your base. I want to put a huge emphasis on the grind. All progress is locked to one server and you earn extremely minimal scrap from barrels (2 scrap per barrel and ONE level 3 bp costs 1000 scrap to research it let alone build it). The whole system is just completely in favor of groups. Not to mention while you are grinding the playerbase is extremely toxic and will shoot you on sight regardless of how geared you are. So there you go an endless cycle of farming to gain any relevant weapons in fights only to be killed on your farming trips constantly in what seems like an already endless grind as the costs for everything as so ridiculously high. RIP rust.

review: I've had doubts about this game before I actually clicked on add to cart and eventually bought it. I've had doubts that I wouldn't have that much fun in this game considering how this game is built upon the idea of player interaction and less in the progression of your virtual character. I've had doubts that I would immediately get thrown into the chaos and beaten left and right.I'm so glad that I got past all those clouds upon learning that you can actually pick any server that you want to play in. I've had so much fun exploring the world without anyone's disturbance. If you're having doubts like I was you ARE in control of this game in the sense that you can always pick the loneliest server that pops up if you want to just chill and explore the world by yourself or the populated server whenever you feel like you're up for a challenge.The crafting system is not at all complicated. It is actually addictive despite its simplicity since the journey to obtain the materials is what makes the crafting system so satisfying. I love the fact that you actually have to actively take care of your base. It makes you feel like your adventure never ends up being a waste of time.I get it that you might feel intimidated by this game's possibility of being very toxic but remember you are in control of this and with that in mind you will not regret.

title: Rust

review: Okay so I have put about 200 hours into Rust and I'm going to write another review once I get more hours. So I'm going to tell you my experinces in Rust and if its worth your hard earned 20 bucks. So my friend had gotten Rust because he was tired of all the games he had and after a couple of days he recommded it to me. And I was like sure why the hell not. And boom! One of my current favorite games was born. Rust can get be frustrating most of the time. You WILL spend hard work and effort to make your little shack and it WILL be wiped by a 8 man clan. Things like that will happen even more now that the "Twig Foundation" update is out. But Rust can be very satisfying as well. For example on one server this group of 3 raided my base and killed me. So in return I got allied with a group of well armed people and raided and took over their base in return. Getting revenge is in my opinion the best part of this game. The game in general needs a bit of time to get used too. Controling the spray of your gun can get hard sometimes. But keep in mind the goal of this game is too survive and become the most powerful player on the server (Well thats my goal atleast) and people will betray you. Trusting someone is always a risk (unless you know them irl) but trusting people might be better than just killing the right off the bat. Okay this review has gotten a bit too long so imma wrap things up. If your into games like ARK then this game will suit your needs. Playing alone is fun enough but with friends is even more fun. Couple words of advice don't trust strangers until you have formed some sort of a bond nighttime is aids stray clear of bears and wolves and eoka pistol is god tier.Part 2 So I've put in 100 more hours into rust. Not that much but enough has changed and I've experienced enough to come back to add to this review. As of this day Rust has lost its charm for me. Don't get me wrong I loved this game to death and I still reccomend it to a new player but fo me personally its lost its charm. Rust used to be burtal and unforgiving and still is to a extent but there are things they have done to make it less brutal. For example key locks. They used to be the bane of rust players on wipe day your scrambling around trying to find enough metal to make that code lock and GET RID OF THAT KEY LOCK. But not the key lock is basically a code lock for solo players. Boom. Instantly that whole aspect of fear and thrill is gone. Furthermore they have made rust into a grind. Now don't get me wrong I have nothing wrong with games that have grind (I love Warframe) but Rust is unessciarly grindy. The whole workbench/scrap thing while cool is uneccsary to me and I think that the component system was fine. I get that they made it like this to give a bit of an edge for solo and duo players against clans (I think) but its pointless dumb and puts to much weight on rng. For me these things along with others have not broke rust or made it bad but simply made it lose its charm. Do I still reccomend this game? Hell Yes. Although the price change was kinda wack I still think this game is worth it. Just have atleast one friend to play with. But for me rust has become something new and I'm not sure if I like it.(P.S) NIGHTIME IS A BIT BETTER YET STILL AIDSOkay Part 3 Recently they added in a new system into the game that I despiese. The "Team System". There is so much wrong with that I don't know where to start. Firstly this gets rid of you being able to pull off sneaky stuff. For example a common way people ask each other on discord or skype if thats their friend or not they say "Jump Check" then their friend starts to jump identyfing themselves. What some people did was whenever they saw someone they would jump JUST IN CASE they were saying "Jump Check" to a friend of them on a 3rd party voice chat system and then they would be pulled into a state of false calmness in which the person who isn't their friend would kill them to the person utter confusion. This can no longer happen. You know what else can't happen that well? Hiding in bushed for an ambush. And the biggest blow is now you can tell who is friend or foe in a big fight. Now some people probably like this but personally I think its stupid. Accidently killing your friend in a fire fight is quite funny at times and it gives you a funny story to tell to your friends later on. And thats one big thing I love about Rust PvP. It's so chaotic and random. I hate giving this game a negative review but with the KeyLock Update and now this? I have to change my review from good to bad and it really hurts me to do so. I feel as if Facepunch is making Rust less and less brutal and that makes me sad. If they get rid of this team system I will be thrilled and change my review back to postive again but currently.. They are destroying what is so special about this incredible game.

review: This is a fantastic concept Minecraft + Scarcity everyone is terrible. It's still in alpha but definitely a more interesting experience than the DayZ standalone currently is. Developers seem to be moving pretty slow with new content and hacking is a serious problem especially when it can take hours of work to build up your home and character and then have them wiped out by cheaters in seconds. Also I tend to mainline games for days or weeks at a time but if you tend not to put too much time into any one game there's no way to make a lot of progress with this one. The sleeper system (where your character never leaves the gameworld and can be looted at any time) doesn't really work yet since there's no static defenses worth anything in place to protect your stuff.tl dr It takes quite a bit of patience and it's an alpha build but if you feel like falling down the rabbit hole this game is already worth days of playtime and it's not even complete yet.

review: There's a lot of naked guys in this game. Not that there's anything wrong with that if that's your thing. But most of these guys are trying bash your head in with a rock.The first days are the hardest. And even after you've survived the animals and made a little makeshift shelter some guy will come along with an assault weapon and murder you for your small stash of rocks and twigs. It's pretty brutal. If you've got friends on the server it makes things much easier but if not you'll most likely just be noob fodder for the hardcore players forever.Not there's anything wrong with that either. But your dreams of glory of taking out that assault gunner with your large rock charging him in the buff... well it's probably never going to happen. So get used to your role... unless you just play forever and never get burnt out.... then maybe you can build a decent sized shelter that can survive an amatuer attempt to break into it.Regardless all the deaths are in great fun. Lot's to explore... although I've never actually talked to anyone in the game. If you're within range of a bullet you probably won't live too long in my experience. Regardless it's still fun. Sort of... if you're into this sort of thing. Just don't take it personally if someone comes along and kills you and loots all the stuff you've spend the last four hours collecting. That's just part of the fun. &lt grin&gt Now let me get back to Distant Worlds and crush a stupid AI guy so I can feel good about myself.

It's absurdely fun very rewarding and very very intense.Why I dont recommend this game though is simple Me and my friend stopped playing this game 3 months ago because you have no oppurtinity of saving your stuff in your base. Anytime you go to sleep it was most likely to get raided and start over with nothing again. 80% of your lategame time you spend shivering because everything you collect has to be put into a base which is not even close to safe. And now after 3 months there was not a single change to the whole game espacially not to this huge problem which already many players mentioned.I know this game is Alpha but compared with other alpha games this development is very very very slow. It's exactly 0. Buy this game when its finished but not one day before.I realy enjoyed this game and am looking forward to a version where I'm actually allowed to go to sleep without starting all over again.
title: Rust

review: I was just looking through the reviews I've written for various games and was suprised to find out that Rust wasn't among them. I've played both Rust Legacy and the new Rust this review will obviously be about the new Rust.Rust is a survival game with a lot of strategic thinking involved when it comes to PvP survival this game is definely the best out there but when it comes to PvE this game is seriously lacking. The monthly wipes are extremely demotivating you from playing the game. Once you've figured out to set up a strong defensive base you manage to defend from raids the game simply decides to wipe everything and lets you start all over. Some people may dislike the fact there aren't any vehicles or that Rust may be missing some other features they would like to see in survival games but there's a lot of things they are still planning to add so keep that in mind.Only recommended if you are into PvP survival. If you are looking for a PvE survival game I would recommend you to play 7 Days To Die.
title: Rust

review: Rust is a very addictive game it is somewhat of a mix between day z and minecraft to an extent. the beginning content its flawless great gameplay asides from the fps point of it which could use alot of fine tuning very primative gunplay however that alone doesn't justify a bad game by yourself or with a team you guarnteed a good bit of time on each server before it gets stale. That being the one gripe once you make your base and have your blueprints unlocked there is pretty much nothing else to do besides raid other peoples bases and take things that you already have thousands of. so the end game aspect gets 5/10 for those of you who like raiding get those 5 pts. Overall a solid 7/10 hopefully in the comiong days alot more updates release for it and we can see a great game in the making and give your input.

review: I bought this game while it was still in Alpha state. I bought it quickly on sale because my friends have it and did not check the system requirements before i bought it.Well the 8GB ram requirement was correct. I have 4GB of Ram as a result the game took about 10 minutes to load and start playing on an empty server with low ping. In fact it took more than 2 attempts to even join the server without crashing the game entirely. When i got on line I found a chicken. I stabbed that chicken with a rock repeatedly. He did not die He ran away like a chicken but not before i threw my rock at him in frustration and the rock de spawned. I then found a bear. I remembered my friend telling me "when you lose you rock you can't do anything. You initially need the rock to harvest materials and you can't even pick up another rock so the only thing you can really do is get killed and when you re spawn you get another rock" so i was like "Yay a bear!". well i would have been like Yay a bear! if i hadn't realized i was naked in the woods (yes naked) without his multi purpose rock with a bear was running right towards me. So i ran like a chicken. The bear chased after me for about 5 seconds before he thought what i can only imagine was "OOH LOOK A KITTY!" and went off in another direction. I found materials scattered on the ground (My friend's advice must have applied to before the update that scattered materials on the ground). I crafted a campfire I ate some mushrooms I swam naked through a river and almost froze to death. All in all i spent about 45 minutes "Playing" Rust and i feel it could be a lot of fun when it's finished. For now I don't recommend it especially if you have less than the required amount of Ram (8GB).

review: I'm going to start this review by stating that this game has two versions Legacy which is the original version and Release which is the new and still updating version. I will be giving pros and cons to each of them.There will be a TL DR at the bottom.This game is only multiplayer you can have your own server by renting one or by setting up a free one but it takes some time.This game is still early access (for those who don't know that means it is still being devloped).Legacy The Legacy version is the original version that is no longer being updated but is still played by many because some people feel it is more finished or they like it better. Pros 1. Smooth gameplay. It has smooth gameplay and is pretty easy to get the hang of. 10/102. Graphics. The graphics are pretty good but could be better in my opinion. 9/103. Combat. The combat is pretty good. Some guns feel over powered but are very hard to aquire so it can balance out. However this all depends on the server you play on. 8.5/104. Enemy AI. The enemies are quite unique. The enemies are red mutant animals that will attack you on sight. There are also wolves and bears that will attack you mutant or not. 9.5/105. Servers. There is a very wide variety of servers to choose from and I find that to be succesful you need to find the server that fits you. 9.5/106. Building. The building is fun and smooth. 10/10Cons1. Difficulty. This game can be very hard depending on the server you play on but it is almost always hard to get a good start because of players. A large amount of players will kill on sight. 3/102. Enemy players. The enemy players can be very tough to fight and you may need more than a bow and arrow to kill them however some can become your friend. 3/10Now for Release Release is the latest version and is still being updated. I think it has much better graphics. The gameplay is smooth so far There are little bugs and it is doing pretty well.Here are some pros and cons.Pros 1. Gameplay. The gameplay is smooth and fun to play. 10/102. Graphics. I think the graphics are much prettier than Legacy and are quite impressive. 10/103. Combat. The combat has been improved since Legacy in my opinion. It is solid and easy to get the hang of. 9.5/104. Enemy AI. There are no mutant enemies as of right now but there are still wolves and bears that will attack you. 9/105. Servers. There are still many different servers to choose from. 10/106. The building is smooth and fun. There is a larger variety of building options as well.Cons 1. The difficulty is easier overall than Legacy but the players are still a problem. However this still depends on what server you choose. 4/102. Enemy players. The enemy players are still tough and a lot of them will kill you on sight unfortunatley. 3/10TL DRSo overall this game is pretty good and is getting better. I think the graphics in Release are better than Legacy. The gameplay for both is smooth fun and easy to get the hang of. Release has more building options and is still being updated. So I hope I helped your decision. Thanks for reading.

review: Not a game you can play alone. You need to gather a lot of materials to get any sort of base to even hope to advance and most materails are rare and not anywhere close to other materials. You can spend an hour running around to get just enough to establish a basic non secure base only to get shot once and lose everything having never seen the other guy or had a chance. Animals and rocks are far too rare without ranged weapons the deer run much faster than you and are impossible to catch however you can't build a bow without cloth from animals.It's fun to play if you have a friend to guard while you gather materails or help kill the people trying to kill you but impossible and aggrivating to play alone. If there were more animals in the game it would be far better for single players.

review: I really want to recommend this game and write a good review because i rarely find any survival game as fun as rust.In fact everything about this game is goodI spent countless of hours gathering resources making friends and building massive bases.I had so much fun playing this wonderfull game whitch is in my opinion the best survival multiplayer game out there.At one point after spending countless hours on a server we were pretty much dominating the whole server with my friends.We had literally everything there is to have and we deserved it because we were devoted players.One day I connected to the server just to find someone raiding my base.At first I did not worry to much since all I have to do it to kill him and having played many FPS at competitive level I am pretty confident when it came to facing other players or I could simply Skype call one of my friend to get a hand.Exept that day it was different. It did not matter how long I had spent on that game or the gear I had to defend myself.It did not matter how many people we had to defend our base that we all spent an incredible amount of time to craft.Because all our intruder had to do is press a button and fly across our walls and shoot us trough them.And this is how someone destroyed all our progression that took over months to do in about 30 min and there was nothing we could have done to prevent it.This is just a long story to make you understand how it is literally a waste of time to spend any time progressing on that game because the amount of hacker is unbearable and I have not seen anything get better. I don't think it can be possible for me to write down every encounter I had with hackers in a day.I still have this game installed and every so often I am very tempted to launch it again and find the enjoyment I once had with this wonderful game but sadly the amount of hackers really makes me want to never play it ever again.TL DR The amount of hackers is unbearable and makes this game unplayable.

Other than playing 1 month servers (Offical servers) Rust is a great experience the animal glitching seems to be an inside joke on Rust players because it's been around for a while. But that sudden rush when you get after killing off someone inside a trap base or fighting off a zerg is great. And in rust you truly have to carefully pick who you decide to pick.
