title: Rust

review: Rust is one of the most engaging and original survival games I have ever played. I've had it for a while and as both a player and a former server owner it's been a privilege to watch it evolve from its early states to its current build. If you're willing to dedicate certain windows of time to each playthrough I strongly recommend it.First of all don't be deterred by the "Early Access Survival" stereotype. Rust has VERY active developers and in all my time playing it I've come across few if any serious bugs all of which are usually patched within a month. Its only real issue is the optimization which can be a problem sometimes but is a fair trade for the gorgeous graphics.Rust also has a very peculiar community something it's been known for from the start. People can be the best and worst part of the game. Depending on the server you're playing on there can be lots of KOSers and trolls and raiders but there can also be some of the funniest most involved players you'll find in any game. Some of the encounters you'll have in this game are... hard to describe (but good).The gameplay itself is very engaging and rewarding. Although there's some grinding in early game the progression in crafting and learning will entice you to keep playing especially since there are often new items and parts added by the devs that will shake things up and revive any dwindling interest you may have. In addition there is a strong element of exploration where you'll begin to memorize the locations of loot spots and the layout of the different monuments on whatever randomly generated map you're playing on at the time. There's also a great base building system that although initially a little confusing is easy to pick up on and very rewarding. There are also lots of little tricks you'll probably learn along the way that make it that much more interesting.In regards to the PVP raids are often brief but brutal and intense. Both sides have a lot to lose and preparing for a raid can be a big deal early game. In addition there's a definite social aspect to many raids so if you consider yourself a good manipulator it's always possible you might be able to con your way to somebody's loot. That said raiding is not the only way to progress in game so if you're not a fan of fighting you can always avoid it.Rust's "story" is mostly implied (or nonexistent) but the unique elements that make up its world and aesthetic are more than enough to fuel the imagination of anybody looking for a narrative. Basic elements such as the unmarked helicopter that patrols the island periodically and the mysterious abandoned monuments that dot every map raise questions and make for an interesting setting for any interactions you may have but their presence is unintrusive enough to avoid interfering with players' individual interpretations. This is especially good for people who like to assume characters in multiplayer. I haven't exactly tried that myself but you'll run into it occasionally and it definitely makes for some interesting interactions (often involving cults).As mentioned in the beginning Rust will unfortunately eat up a good amount of time. Since you leave behind sleepers and buildings have a "decay" mechanic on some servers it's best you either come into the game with friends or find some friends in game before starting any super serious playthroughs just to make sure somebody's watching the house. Last I checked though the devs have been adding some mechanics to take the edge off of this downside so that people can play it without dedicating too much time. That said you can always play casually just expect to get raided a little more often.So in conclusion Rust is a great survival experience regardless of the stigma surrounding early access survival games. As long as you can clear up some time once in a while to really get into it and/or have or find some friends to play it with Rust is probably one of the best multiplayer survival experiences on Steam and its active involvement with the community and constantly evolving nature serves to keep that even more interesting.

review: What did I experience playing Rust so far? I got paranoid while playing I saw a lot of nudity I got killed by Rocks I got raided a lot I got a personal enemy in the game Funny glitches Lots of fun with friendsBut now to the actual review Rust is a PVP heavy survival game with no real rules to the game. You can build a massive base a tiny shack raid other people kill them or just live a peaceful hermit life. (actualy you can't do the last unless you are playing on an empty server which would not be the point of the game anyways). At the moment there are monthly map wipes forced by the developer every so often also blueprint wipes which can be depressing at some points but at the same time also quite challenging.From the performance I think the game is well enough optimised to play it without bigger issues of course there can be bugs and performance dips because of its Early Access stage.I'd say overall Rust is a pretty good game to play together with some friends. If you're thinking about playing it alone forget that idea an search for some mates to play with. If you can pick it up for a good price I say do it. I had a great time playing it so far but keep in mind that Rust is a pretty time consuming game.

review: "I loved this game and had hundreds of hours playing before they got rid of the zombies that seemed to be the beginning of a downward spiral. Legacy had its issues but it had a following and people loved it if the game had stayed in legacy and got proper updates it would have been out by now and kept its following. The new version of the game has some merit but it changed enough that it is no longer a game I can say I enjoy. I can say I got my moneys worth of the game already in legacy during the prime of the game... so there is that.. but those days are long over. At this rate the game will be unpopular and feel quite old by the time it is released and I still have considerable doubts that the game will ever release. This is going to be yet another EA game which slaps a 1.0 on a broken game and calls it complete. "The above section in quotations is my review for Rust when legacy had just changed. I'm happy to report that I can change this review now and probably should have. As I've put probably 200 more hours into the game since and revisit it every few months. I no longer believe that this will remain an unfinished game and the constant flow of content coming is very encouraging. The new rust had a poor start but the devs have more than made up for it. I keep coming back for more and the game has become one of my favorites. I was very skeptical at first but I have been happily proven wrong. I look forward to what the future has to offer.

review: They got some Minecraft in my DayZ.That was my knee jerk reaction when I first started playing and after 40 hours on the game I maintain a similar stance. I know it isn't a terribly insightful observation but that is what the game feels like. Rust has some qualities of both games and while they aren't necessarily intricate at the moment ("it's an alpha") they do function well. Home building is simple and fairly well executed and it feels like a great baseline for it going forward and there are some details to it currently that show what it could ultimately become. For example if you insist on making windows make sure to put some bars on them less someone uses them as an access point with a conveniently placed staircase outside your abode (a lesson learned from experience). Crafting is straight forward and the system by which you unlock new builds definitely ratchets up the drive for either raiding "rad" towns and the chests/zombies therein or raiding your fellow players as either finding blueprints or researching an already constructed item is the only way to learn some things. And just finding the blueprint isn't always the answer. Finding the blueprint for explosive charges is great but if you or your buddy can't make explosives it's ultimately useless until you can. This system has potential to create a player trading market but "trade" is a word that rarely seems to come up among players.Of course the biggest aspect of the game is really PVP/PVE as you need to engage in one (or both) of these to really get anywhere. Unfortunately the PVE isn't really there. Period. Yeah there are zombies and aggro animals but they aren't really that difficult to defeat (most require 1 or 2 arrows) and most of the time fairly easy to avoid. There are some resource fields and lootable chests that are virtually devoid of PVE threats and unless you're a very poor judge of where to place your house you'll never need it for defense from the environment. I think the best step for the game would be to figure out what direction they want to take the environmental threats and go with it. Get that system up and running and give the game some extra tension and raise the threat level not only for those who prefer PVE but also for those engaging in PVP. It's one thing to make sure your house is secure from a roving pack of zombies it's an entirely different thing to have your raiding party be ambushed while you pillage some saps house.Which of course brings me to PVP. Honestly it can be really fun when you get 2 or 3 groups all running for an air drop and an epic firefight breaks out but the KOS mentality really can ruin the experience. There is nothing more frustrating than being popped in the head twice after calling for "friendly" and putting your hatchet away (yep melee against a gun I'm outmatched dude). You want my stuff? Fine demand it I'm not going to resist at 2 v 1 with no weapon. Other reviewers have brought this up and I just want to reiterate how bloody stupid and frustrating it is. And in reality it breeds that same mentality in other people. After being KOS while posing no threat so many times eventually people will adopt or quit playing. In either case or a multitude of others it's just not cool. People play games for fun or to relax whats the point in ruining it? Edit One more note on KOS and PVP. Some people are completely lacking in class. Laying ambushes after asking for help to get somewhere (fought my way out of that one) then later coming back with your group to raid said friendly players after which you gloat about your raid. Yeah tactics like that are valid but man do they speak volumes. _ Overall I have enjoyed a lot about the game though I've only mentioned some of the things that worked really well for me. I think there is a lot of potential in Rust and if you're on the fence about it I urge you to at least hang around and see what changes are made. I think with current systems fleshed out and a stronger PVE plus some attitude improvement on the part of the community (but every game has its jerks) this will be a lot of fun for big groups small parties and lone wolfs.

The graphics of the game are great from 1 10 I'd give it an 8 even though it doesn't have a single set map every server has It's own generated map. The main flaw of Rust is that it is very bad optimized it doesn't run on any computer for example I use a GTX 980 and it doesn't run smoothly at all and I can barely keep it on 60 FPS. FPS drops drastically in shootous for example and sometimes it runs at 1 5 FPS for several seconds for no reason.

review: RustYou start on with the game naked. No objectives no directions. Completely unknown about the surroundings. The first thing you spawn with is a rock. A rock that'll help in your quest to grind items later in the game you would need to use the rock to collect resources making different items and collectibles to level up your game. You can hit rocks and trees to collect materials like wood and stone used to make weapons storage and variety of other stuff.I don't know what it is with this game. Maybe it's the fact that you spawn unclothed and uncensored maybe it's the brutal vastness of the design or maybe it's the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings but Rust has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat of this particular game is very engaging whenever you're near someone you'd start hearing them. The physics of this game too is surreal you'd imerse into the beautiful graphics of this game.Ratings.Graphics 9/10 on highest settingsGameplay 9.5/10Difficulty Moderate would need time to get good with the game.Community Mostly toxic this is the only major con of this game.Price Worth the money it's almost your budget game and really addictive.8.5/10 Would recommend this game. Age groups 13+

review: HUUR DUUR I CANT TAKE CONSTRUCTIVE CRITICISM (Review date 7th May 2014)My verdict I KINDA regret buying this.BUT not because it's a bad game it's a good game but it's a bit boring in its current state however the concept is great.DayZ and MineCraft had a baby and made this and its great but it's weighed down by the lack of content the fairly bad graphics but max does look pretty in some circumstances the theme is okay but the character models and various textures pop out and lack contrast to the background and somehow causes them to smear together in a rounded edged mess of some sort hard to explain.So overall give it some polish and it'll be good even though it sounds hard to judge an alpha game but even they have to take some critisism for that is what drives them forward to making the right choices for the game. I'm not saying Rust has done some bad choices it has a lot of potential in its current state but give it some time and I will edit this review and talk about the good points.In conclusion if you're willing to support the devs you can buy this. It's better with friends and the best friends are ones with knowledge of the game as it isn't friendly to beginners and offers a clunky interface. If you don't want to buy this I recommend coming back in a few months and see how far it's come maybe then it will be worth the buy.

It will frustrate you to no end. You'll almost feel as if they are sitting there waiting for you to go offline just so they can walk in and get easy loot. That is just not fun. If I had a fair fighting chance that would be fun.

review: The game has great feel to it like you are really in post apocallyptic world but it still needs development.Even if it is still in alpha it is great you can build your own base your own weapons hunt animals. Stuff to keep you entertained for hours. When you have the basics up you want better weapons to protect your goodies so you go out and hunt red bears and red wolves. And thats where you will meet the biggiest problem Almost anyone who sees you will kill you. There are places where you can hide yourself in the world but better stuff (red bears and red wolves) only appear near radiated zones which are pretty small and there are few of them in the world. Then you will keep loosing your hard earned stuff over and over and you will get annoyed greately and probably finnish up rage quitting swearing and never wanting to play again. Sure you can make lockable backpack but you still need to find blueprint for it plus if your killer has lockpick you loose your stuff anyway. If you play solo then you will not last very long I guarantee you that (unless you play on empty server). As of now you should play with at least two other friends. One way that could resolve meaningless killing is creating teams. Think about it. Your own people can no longer kill you (or you would get big punishment for teamkilling) people would actualy do organised raids (yes you can break into someones house. I was really surprised when a guy blasted my wooden door with c4 and me with his m4) fighting over radiated zones making big fortresses that actually matter... Well maybe one day.If you have spare money and want to play some fun game with friends then go ahead buy it It is fun! (even with few game glitches and some other lesser flaws). If you want to play solo then i say that you will have fun too but you will get annoyed by people quickly (I did not believe other articles and they turned out to be true).Final verdict at this point 6/10 people are the worst. It could be 7/10 or higher you ruined it you random killing maniacs! &gt (

review: Love this game. I bought it in a Humble Bundle late 2016 or early 2017. The game has lots to offer the graphics are actually really nice. The crafting and loot system is lots of fun and so is the building system. However there is one reason I cannot recommend this game in its current state. Its an unbalanced mess right now and there is no initiative to even fix it and its ruining the overall gaming experience out of it. The grind isn't the bad part is the Random Generated Luck chances you get of finding certain loot and then the high ammount of SCRAPS it takes to learn that blue print.Put it this way you have very small percentage possibility to find certain equipment guns ladders ladder hatches and even some clothing. Ones you find them you have to learn the Blue Print for this item in order to craft it. Learning the Blue Print for Ladder cost as much as the Double Barrel Shotgun and this just makes no sense. The ladder should cost no more than 75 SCRAP's. The chances of finding a ladder hatch are slim to none I have grinded for 40 hours and Not 1 time have I found a Ladder Hatch. Bottom line is there needs to be a lot more focuse on balancing Crafting and Reaserch. As of now I won't recommend this game.http //rust.wikia.com/wiki/Research_Table

review: Besides having our assess kicked again and again by PvP players once you find a good place to set and a friendly player (you may die many times before you find a friendly one lol) you start to really play the game. In your first days you will collect basic (wood food stone minerals and cloth) resources during the day and hide during the night while you build your settlement. Eventually you make some clothes (fortunately there is no nudity anymore lol) make a furnace some weapon then you realize that it is time to face zombies and kill it for their valuable loot so you can start making better things. Now things start getting complicated lot of research kits and a friend who is in better technological condition than you (so he can share his techies in order for you to learn it) or luckily find the blueprints you need to progress.Do I recommend it?? Certainly and absolutely yes. You have to like the game proposal...surviving almost as in real life.

review: I had Hopes for this game it claims to be a survival game just like Dayz it has the same problems at the base level as Dayz so here are the Big problems1. Claims to be a survival game but is a glorified deathmatch Let me explain Just like dayz this game is supposed to be a survival game This means that this game should make you struggle to keep yourself alive from the enviroment alone it should make one struggle to find food and water or it should make it hard to survive attacks from predators MAKING PLAYERS THE ONLY THREAT IN A SURVIVAL GAME IS WRONG. Making players the only tangible threat is what breeds boredom which will lead to players killing on sight "KOS" just to make the game bareable of course there are jerks that will kill you for no reason but a survival game should punish that heavily ideally by maintenance of weapons Attracting very dangerous predators or by using very Rare and precious supplies in the act of killing another player a survival game should make one think and plan ahead. It should reward players for socialising or at the very least socialize in a meaningful way Sadly this won't happen very often with how the game is set up ammo and guns are common as you can just craft them you don't need to eat all that often and food and water are plentiful the only saving grace would be if rust had some NPCs that would tear a player a new one if he or she wasn't careful which it doesn't the addition of an LMG and Scope are just two instances of making it even easier to kill players and encouraging playstyles that may be detrimental to the enjoyment of others eg. killing freshspawns and rooftop camping.2. The community Don't get me wrong there are some people in this game that try to socialize and have reasons to kill or raid other reasons besides for stuff they don't need they may set up shops but the vast majority are players who just draw on signs or mess with new players griefing them which is somewhat understandable as there is nothing to do unless one decides to mess with players however the thing that makes the community unbearable is that a lot of players on this game have a laser focus on killing alienating other players when someone thinks differently and when one tries to criticize the game many of them will come up with weak excuses the more immature ones will just claim that you're off because you got your handed to you.3. Development I will not deny that the game is having features added to it The foundation of the game either remains unchanged or had a half patch to attempt to please those who were complaining about a feature that is a part of it's foundation eg. Blueprint system and crafting times. The game also had a lot of updates that encouraged a deathmatch or team deathmatch mentality The game is in development which means that the devs should focus on the foundation first and then build upon that foundation while there is a foundation it is an incredibly shoddy one as evidenced by the complaints on the facepunch forums regarding blueprints crafting times and other issues located at the core of the gameplay. Facepunch has also been giving reasons to play as a group but giving very little incentives to have players socialize and form a group. It is obvious what FP is trying to do but FP does not know how to get the desired outcome.Rust isn't a survival game in it's current state and unless facepunch step up it's game rust will never be a survival game it is instead like Dayz in which it is mind numbingly boring unless you try to kill another player there is little reason to socialize there are no other real dangers besides other players there is every reason to kill everyone you see.TLDR Rust is not a survival game in it's current state it is a glorified deathmatch with crafting and building elements chucked in if you want a hardcore survival experience then pass it up if all you want to do is kill and grief other players than this game is for you!

review: Look i've put far too many hours into this game to give anyone a half a** review. If you want to die over and over again. This just might be your game. Doesn't that sounds fun?If you decide this game is for you here is my guide Don't have neightbors kill them before they kill you. Build small then add on and redecorate. Kill or be killed NO ACCEPTION. Defend your base to the best of your ability the more traps and off the wall build scruture the better (if they can not guess where your loot is that is ideal). If you can get REALLY good with a bow you will be racking in the loot.Best of luck you beach nakeds. I'll be waiting up the hill with my guns just to shoot your a** for fun!

review: Rust is a mutiplayer survival crafting game It's qutie an overdone subject in recent gaming but Rust one of the best ones I've played. Between frequent updates great graphics and a rather friendly community (depending on server) it stands far above most other games in the crafting/survival community.Pros + Fast gameplay ( you could have a pretty good base in about an hour or two i you know what you are doing ) Air drops and the relatively new helicopter forces players to fight for the best loot Voice communication is distance based and anonymous NO ZOMBIES ( personally I feel that zombie survival is an much overdone topic in the survival genre) Naked guys guys killing each otherCons Not optimized very well at the moment but it is still playable on low and mid tier system Kids playing usually dont know how to communicate resulting in them killing you on sight There are some glitches currently but with update every month or so they sould be fixed soon Gathering gets a little stale after awhile but building quarries stops the grind fest"but overall Rust is an 9/10 (will be 10/10 as soon as glitches are fixed and optimizations take place)

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: The game is awesome. It is one of those games that I keep coming back to every other month. Something game changing has been added and its all stuff that looks towards the future of the game. If you are new Do NOT go to a high population server!! Find a dead server and play on there. Get an idea how to play practice etc... I find the most entertaining servers are the ones with low population. As many negative reviews have said It is a death match at times. You can counter this with small servers which usually have nice people on them with the occasional jerk. People assume you are going to attack them and so they go after you first. Building is very fun. You can make your own base and learn hard lessons on how to make a base even better over time. Friends are extremely nice to have and you will find groups of people willing to take you in if you are not a jerk.

review: Overall notbad.I have to state that overall this game is really REALLY good there are so many original (at the time of release) ideas and many hours of fun to be had with this game but it is also plagued with alot of downsides that overall balance out as an ok game.This is the game that really defined the survival genre that is currently plaguing steam with early alpha released that never seem to get released or updated after the first year or so. You start naked alone and afraid. Slowly searching for basic resources such as food stones and wood so that you can survive your first night in some crappy shack of a shelter you spend buildling before the sun sets. You then see something a person maybe he can help desperatly you run over to greet this person (maybe he can help?) you get closer and closer and suddenly he see's you now you are both running towards each other (this is great) and just as you are a few yards away this nut job opens fire at you and turn and run towards the woods bleeding runing out of health and stamina you pick up a stone to make your stand you aim and throw your rock at this nutters head... but it misses the last things you see and hear are a gun shot and a barage of teabagging and insults whilst you are robbed of your sticks stones and raw chicken meat and left to bleed out in the sun.Welcome to rust! Where friendly means hostile AF neighbours are more dangerous than bears and plentiful resources like wood are treated like platinum. Sounds horrible doesn't it? Well no. The adrenaline and rush of finally getting on your feet are amazing having a home that is fairly safe is great and ocne you get together with some friends and turn from hopeless noob to full time raider is some of the best gaming experiences I have ever had. I havn't played this in a while but when I last played this created some of my fondest gaming memories ever.Pros'Good graphicsLots of craftingFun combatFun solo amazing with a groupCan spend many hours back to back playing this gameLots of updatesLarge communityCon'sThe dev's do seem uninterested in the communityLots of changes many for the worseStill in Early access after many yearsNot very noob friendlyRather toxic players depending on serverPlagued with bugsIn regards to the dev's comment I would like to state I have never played the game to a level where I have taken a massive interest in changes or lack of updates (I think its ok) but many serious players have complained about this and the response from the Dev was simply if you don't like it stop playing it. Now although I agree with this for any game if the players are feeling that things are that bad and that people are not enjoying it but for a Dev to ignore requests and come back with a comment like this does show that the game isn't really being built around the community. I noticed this in the original rust (which ahd zombies and one map) I really liked that rust and despite a large uproar about the changes to what is now the normal rust the dev's ignored this and made alot of changes that people really didn't want.Overall however from me Great game and strongly recomend.

review: Rust is a social experiment. Anything you craft in game can and probably will be raided and stolen no matter the defenses. People will add you to their friends list for the sole purpose of knowing if you're offline or not in game so as to determine the perfect time to steal all your items. Rust is a soul crushing digital manifestation of what happens when the world breaks down and guns and explosives are the only form of barter or negotiation.It is a beautiful game. The sunrises and sunsets are majestic.What it does to people. however is the exact opposite. Rust is a more brutal unforgiving and relentless online arena than EvE Online as even in EvE. you could park your assets in a neutral station and wait for the storm to pass. Here the storm is everywhere... right outside your door crawling on your ceiling while you're asleep in your bed. Waking up to find your assets intact in Rust can be considered a major accompishment and usually only practical for those in large clans which cross multiple time zones.Copy Pasta

review: Bullets and other craftables no longer stack when being made and are lost if you do not manually stack them. Video settings keep AUTO changing back to 'beautiful' or whatever the ultra fast computer/GPU setting is (12 FPS for me even though I get 60's to 70's in Fallout NV and Skyrim). I keep waking up half health which is annoying. I might understand waking up hungry. PLEASE make the optimization and animals better? The herky jerky movements of animals and players is driving me mad. The new UI leaves much to be desired. I can no longer see the Chat the 'loot' is all of a sudden to the right of my inventory even though there is enough room the top where it was before which is an intuitive placement. Make the game WORK then make it pretty or 'cool looking'... All this 'beauty' and 'detail' without actual mechanics and items that work properly is kind of silly don't you think? Come on guys.Overall fun game and keep up the work. But if a patch is going to set you backwards in progress why do it?

review: BRING BACK THE ZOMBIES AND OTHER ANIMALS!!!Hello Rust Developers I have been playing rust for about two weeks now and it isnt what I really expected to see. One of the main reasons i purchased this game was to survive in a VR zombie apocalypse. I watched many gameplay videos before i finally purchased it and when i first played I have only been killed once from the wilderness. There is hardly starving to death anymore and the system for bodily hydration definitely needs some work. I can sprint through the desert in snow gear and be perfectly hydrated. I heard one of the reasons that zombies were kicked from the game was because during development you guys wanted to make them randomly generated with cloths and equipment and what not. I say this would be cool but would only take up alot of time worth spent else where. If I were killed by a zombie I would prefer to have a choice of what I could do. Forcing my character to commit suicide or becoming a zombie. Now this is what I would like to see either i can partially control my character but his presence is able to infect others while being slowly infected by the virus (maybe a cure) once the virus has fully taken over the player loses all control and the zombie romes around killing in his armor possibly dropping his backpack after a short time. Or the virus is fast acting and I lose all control over my character and am allowed to start over. This game has so much potential especially from the realism of it but is seriously lacking with only deers and wolves only attracting survivalists. A virus speaks to a whole other community of zombie lovers. I would really like to see this game becoming a massive community against a great opponent.

review: Been playing this game since 2013. I've watched it grow and change and I've also watched Rust's soul fade away over time and the game itself go from a unique Pvp/raiding survival game with all the little quirks and stuff that came with it to a boring paltry grindfest. This game is impossible to play if you dont have 2 3 friends willing to play with you at all times. Don't buy it if your friends play other video games. This game runs like Don't buy it if your graphics card was made before 2015. To succeed in this game and have fun you need to play for 16 hour intervals at minimum otherwise you will just get offline raided. Don't buy it if you like engaging in other activities such as eating food taking a dump or leaving the house. Rust currently gives fresh player spawns little to no options when it comes to finding a weapon or otherwise useful item whilst roaming around. Don't buy it if you don't like linear progression in almost every scenario. The developers are constantly changing the game around to what they think the community would like not what they actually ask for or discuss on r/playrust. Don't buy it if you can't put up with essential game mechanics changing or being removed overnight for no reason whatsoever.+Devs give weekly updates detailing their great progress in 'balancing' weapons or retexturing bears or something. amazing.I find no enjoyment in playing rust anymore. Buy it if you find it on sale for $5 I guess.

review: The learning process of Rust I hit a tree with a rock. Someone with a spear stabbed me. I died. I respawned. I hit a tree with a rock. I was hit by another person with a rock. I died. I respawned. I hit a tree with a rock. I built a small hut. I was raided and shot. I died. I respawned. I hit a tree with a rock. built a medium sized hut. upgraded my base. Went out to get stone. Got Shot. I died. I respawned. I hit a tree with a rock. I built a small base. I fortified the base. I built a sleeping bag. I got a spear. I got bored. I went outside my small base. I saw someone like me 20 minutes ago he had a rock and his was swining everywhere. I stabbed him with the spear. He died. It felt good. I was shot. I died. I respawned.......

review: Honest Rust Review I have not played Rust for that long roughly a year a and a half. But this game is truly one special game. I definitely recommend this game but although there are some cons to Rust itself.But the pros outnumber them any day. Here you go.Rust is an open world survival fps set in an post apocalyptic world. You run around surviving with friends or alone in a huge world. When you get Rust you want to be (and have)A. Good at FpsB. Have fast reflexesC. Have a decent computer.When playing Rust you need a decent computer to load up the beautiful world otherwise it will lag u and give u bad framerate. You also want to be good at fps and have fast reflexes so that you can survive in the harsh world and also to constantly keep all of your harvested sh!t.Rust is about surviving which is a huge aspect of the game. You will need to farm and if some players kill you you need to keep pushing. People are complaining about big Clans taking over servers and obliterating everyone. I RECOMMEND you to play with friends otherwise Rust will be NO fun for you. You will play for a few hours and then never touch it again.Some solutions to big clans taking over are Playing on special non clan servers playing with friends to clash with the clans create your own clan or play on servers that are not hosted in your continent. That way they are asleep.Rust is extremely fun to play because you get tons of action a survival feeling and a satisfied feeling when you kill someone. Plus Rust keeps your adrenaline pumping.For newbies There was an xp update where instead of getting bp frags from barrels you get xp and level up everytime you farm. That way you level up and use xp to learn basic crap like tools and sleeping bags.I hope you have fun playing Rust! If you have any questions or thought this was somewhat helpful or helpful please like so others can see the feedback.

review: Rust has one problem or at least one main problem I encoutered and it's that it rarely has the best of both worlds. What I mean by this is that if you go to a server with a lot of people you will barely find any resources and when you do some random guy will kill you and take your stuff and then you have to march 5 000 miles in the opposite direction because the tree you cut down was the only tree for miles. I don't blame the player for killing me and taking my resources because that's part of the game kill or be killed but it gets irratating due to how scarce the resources are and everytime you try to cut down one tree you die. and its marching simulator all over again. Lets not forgot that the landscape feels like a real estate simulator.However if you choose a server with few people you'll have plenty of resources but rarely will you interact with someone or feel threatened. Now some people won't mind this and I don't really interact with people that much but I do like feeling a constant need to improve my equipment to survive against that one jerk who constantly comes back to my house knocking on my door with a shotgun in his hand as he says "Excuse me but do you mind trading with me? I need some food and I'll give you some bullets for anything you have?" This makes collecting resources so much more fun because you're going to need to make guns metal doors and walls to stop this guy from breaking in. But on a devoid server you don't encounter those people and on a large server you're just going to be spawn killed by the guy who spawns next to you and then wander aimlessly while you view the 10 000 houses on a empty plain. Animals are rare especially on large servers thanks to the massive deforestation but then again you don't need to hunt in this game right away because you have to try to starve to death. Make a house in a dark cave and never leave your home and never get killed by anything and maybe you might starve to death eventually. Rust wants to be a good game and it can be but there's just a large imbalance between what's on the land and the amount of players. Perhaps if the land was bigger or if resources took a extremely long time to deplete then maybe it could work and people who want to jump into a two week old server can without playing the marching simulator. Rust is not a bad game but to me its a disappointing one. 6/10 (Average)

review: Great game Ive loved it since legacy and had it since then My only issue is that sometimes patches are released and some people exploit bugs to get into your base and all. Real frustrating when you spend hours making a huge base filled with buffer zones and its just griefed real bad but eh thats not a huge deal Stuff like that should be expected.My real major issue is the damn community has gone to total s &amp t the past several months Hardly anyone nowadays doesnt kill on sight and too many people no life the game waaay too dang much to get insane amounts of resources and C4 to go raiding a fair bit of the people in the server but I digress That is there choice.Then you have the kids who are waaay to young to be playing a game like this who surprizingly if anything are the most crude and foul mouthed of the who lot I dont mean to insult anyone who is of the younger spectrum but I really dont think anyone under 17 should play this game 16 may be just fine but anything before then I dunno maybe parents need to look at what theyre kids are playing instead of glancing at it or something. I just guess I wish there was a more mature community still or servers for more mature players and all Something like that would really pull me back in.I do miss how legacy made you feel though and the Zombies (No no animal ones not those). I think rust should still have zombies in radtowns it was fun and made it more of a challenge for you and the other players to make a radtown runAll in all the game is great and being well done with some awesome updates every now and then that are timed pretty well Community has become the only major issue

review: This is actually gonna be a seroius review....(I have in total 400hours of experience in rust)Rust is a really good game no doubt about it But it has some flaws lets talk about them. Flaws I have experienced many flaws in rust mostly that sometimes the launcher wont even open and forces me to restart my computer Also have problems while loading into servers which can be really annoying. And rust has automatically "Deleted" it self from my computer sometimes i cant even find it in my Library neither in my files. And everytime i drive a boat some weird red text pops up and disconnects me from the server and sometimes the game. Ive also tried uninstalling after experiencing these "Flaws" but it wont help and i can't play Rust for the rest of the day. Community Alot of people say that Rust's community is "Cancer" i havent experienced any toxic people so far (I guess that's good) I have seen many videos and lifestreams where other in game players are really toxic It kinda puts a bad image for people who are looking to buy rust. I understand that Rust can be very competitive for alot of people but that's not an excuse to be really toxic. (Also "Naked" Huntig is kinda cancer) Other then that i think we have a good community Actual active developers and frequent updates and alot of new skins. The only other game I've seen do that is Fortnite. I think its good to have Active developers that actually listen to the players. Good on them. Cons Rust is a really good game. I've made multiple friends from playing solo on many servers.Rust is also good cause there is always soemthing to do in the game for example Farming Raiding Bow Fights and just Roaming around is fun.

review: Once you find a good server and that will require good admins you will have a great time and I have spent more hours on this game than any other in my Steam library.However the lack of updates has meant it is swarming with hackers. That's aside from the lack of new content you would expect to get in an Early Access game.I totally understand the design decisions Garry and the team have made but that does not help people who have paid 20 and have an incomplete game that is not improving.Update 2015 08 12 For all the time this has been redeveloped it is an almighty boring game now. Some beautiful graphics and some painstaking detail but the fun/gameplay has gone.Update 2018 06 28Took in excess of 10 minutes to load the game seems to require superfast fibre broadband to LOAD nevermind run. Within 15 seconds I was killed by someone with "rock.entity". Wow this game is never going to be finished.

review: At the start of the game I was pretty confused about how to survive. But when i understood it ended up being a fun DayZ like game. One of my complaints though is that when you exit the game or disconnect from a server you were playing on it keeps your character in game on the floor as if it's sleeping. And other players can kill you while you offline and take whatever was in your inventory (this also can happen on no pvp servers). That's happened to me a few times and it's very frustrating trying to gain back my progress. If the developers could at least make no pvp servers have that disabled it'd help a lot and keep me playing for a long time. Other than that though this game is greatly made and really fun/time consuming. If I could I'd give Rust a good 7.5/10 rating.

review: This game is pretty awesome for an Alpha and for the most part its fun to play. I'm relatively new to the game as you can see but I learned a lot through trial and error and my advice to new players who are coming to the game alone that is without running mate(s) would be to find a PVE server or a server that has a low or no population to learn the crafting mechanics because its easier to learn when you're not being killed every 2 minutes as you would on most high population servers. Server wipes are lame. I understand there is some limitation that makes the game itself and wiping is a sort of 'workaround' for now but knowing that doesn't make it easier to swallow losing everything after repeatedly investing hours upon hours gathering and crafting starting again over and over gets tedious. I hope they find a way around this limitation because if wiping becomes an actual part of this game permanently I doubt I'll keep playing.

review: Rust is not a game for those who have little time to pour hours of gameplay into it. It isn't a game for you if you would rage quit when everything you own is destroyed. Rust is a brutal game that's a fact...But even through all of the grind and naked rock battles that plague you no matter where you play rust never ceases to prove itself as one of my favorite games of all time. No other game has ever had me literally sweating after a pvp battle and because rust relies on other players to make up for the lack of npc's there is always something new each time you log on. I highly recommend this game for those of you who like to pour hours into a game and see results however if you have little time to play you might want to find a different game.

review: This game was amazing one of the best of it's time and some could argue really started the whole naked survival concept you see in games like Conan and SCUM. I have been playing this game for over 5 years off and on back when it was called Rust legacy in a freakin' browser window. This game is unique no doubt a true hardcore survival pitting you against the enviroment animals NPC's and of course other players. Before I get into my rant and review I do want to say one thing that Facepunch has always been great about is their update and content. They used to do weekly updates for over 4 years misses a week here and there but I've never seen that kind of dedication in a very long time. When full release hit it went to monthly updates with a month here or there with nothing really new to show but still overall can't applaud them enough they do it well.Here's where I have a problem and this has been an issue for a long time this is why I'm off and on this game so much. It's very time consuming no matter what you do it'll most likely be a grind. Farming for scrap resources raiding roaming it's all a big grind and if the payout is great it's usually worth it because it turns into a great experience in the end. Maybe some ups and downs but still probably a fun wipe. However like I said it's time consuming and most of us who don't play Rust on the regular have a wife kids job(s) ect... so what gets tricky is trying to compete with people who have just a lot of free time which is no fault to anyone just the way it works.Now the community very toxic and very aggresive. Most of the time you're getting killed for zero purpose. You will get door camped for your loot people will harrass you with music racsim you name it I bet you'll experience this at least half a dozen times if not more in a wipe cycle. It's online gaming though right? It's to be expected. I feel here it's a bit more over the top because you got a game where you grind for hours and someone comes up and kills you or maybe even raids your base all that time is down the drain. And if a person has nothing left in their name or maybe they're just upset from you taking their loot you're going to get very upset teenager. Yes I said teenager which brings me to the 3rd part the population. Like I stated the last two lines the game is time consuming and you have toxic people. Now the population is filled with mostly younger people you will come across people in their late 20's maybe even 30's but it's not very common. This is an aggresive game and incredibly difficult to play by yourself shoot even the developer known as HELK literally said on his own server and I quote &amp quot lonewolves" but that's another discussion. So of course you're going to try and look for people to play with because this game is hard as hell you got NPC's other players animals (not that hard) and the enviorment it's a difficult game. But you got all these young toxic racist disrespectful people grouping up more and more and more and solo play is nearly out of the question. You have these never ending groups of people who just are rude nearly every play session everyday for as long as you're able to play Rust before you quit because while you were at work a group of kids raided your fragile 2x2.Now I make it sound bad and it is but there are some factors that come into play and can change the outcome like what server you play on is it modded or vanilla is the map small how populated does it get during peak hours stuff like that can make your experience vary.I remember when there were so many community servers and some really cool admins hosting and maybe a group was too big on that server back then it wasn't as common as it is today but it did happen and they were usually known as (whoever group) and most people on the server knew of them or if you didn't you would soon. There were lots of populated really nice servers but now you got this endless list of servers that are super underpopulated I'm talking maybe less than 20 during peak hours the servers that are populated are the sponsored or official servers. The actual official servers on wipe day you're literally waiting hours to get in a game and you better hope you don't disconnect in the queue or you're waiting all over again. Like seriously I'm not waiting freaking 4 hours to play a game that's all my play time right there. So you jump to a less populated server to play and if you're lucky it stays populated for more than 3 4 days then it may die it might not we all have different preferences when it comes to how much PvP/PvE we like to do.All in all it really is a fun game and if you have friends to play it with that'll make the experience better and at least you won't be suffering alone but you have a long way to go before the game gets easier for you it's a long learning curve. Maybe I've just been on this game too long but I'm burnt out. The new content is pretty neat we're getting new guns the boat event is cool there's pictures of hot hair ballons I'm not sure how I feel about that or the direction the game is going but I'll never get sick of building my own base. It's like Minecraft but I get to shotgun people in the face.Thank you for your time and I hope if you do get the game please try to be friendly to others help a noob out. I know it's hard to tell because you hand a naked a hatchet they may just try to kill you which not only makes us hard to trust anyone so we shoot on sight but it makes it hard for new players to get welcomed into the game because we're sick of hearing "Hey I'm new can you help me" And when we do help we just get stabbed in the back literally.
title: Rust

review: I got 90% of my hours from before the blueprint TC and workbench updates. BEFORE THE UPDATES It was extremely fun to playYou could get a base and a waterpipe / revolver in an hour or twoYou could compete in PVP with out too much fear that if you lose your gun you will never get it backIf you got raided it was less damaging because it was easier to pick up steam againAnd it was perfect IMO AFTER UPDATES You can get a base down but after you upgrade it to wood you're stuckYou have to dump ALL your wood / stone into your tool cupboard in order for base to not disappear overnightYou get raided anyways and if you're offline your base is gonna be gone because they destroyed your tool cupboardThe only way to get guns is PVP so if PVP is not your thing ing avoid this gameIn short this game is way too grindy you have to spend hours in order to get a revolver. And even then you get killed by a ing clan roaming with Semis. I regret every hour I put into this game after the blueprint tool cupboard and workbench update.

review: In my opinion Rust is one of the greatest games ever made. There is a big learning curve and you will probably make so many mistakes at first that you'll want to eat your own hands but let's make this clear Rust is not a game it's a job. And to be honest it's a damn depressing one at that. The grind is unbelievable and if you don't have 3+ hours to spare every day you'll progress very slowly. But let's say you have 5 6 hours to play everyday you're solo and you get a base up you start to unlock some decent blueprints for better tools weapons and clothes. You'll soon find yourself getting raided by a clan of 3+ players who probably don't even need your meagre loot. The raiders will often block access to your base leaving you to start all over again.The 'solution' for solo players is playing on a modded server where you can collect resources and achieve end game items much quicker. But it's the same thing essentially. Either you build a colossal base which will still take you hours and hours of gathering building and upgrading leaving your opponents unsure of where to start raiding and usually underestimating the amount of explosives required to complete the raid or you get trampled on early by a clan.I really love this piece of game but it's highly toxic doesn't do anything good for the human spirit and it's extremely demanding of your time. There is obviously much more to say about the game but since I've spent almost 3000 hours 'playing' it I'm going to stop right here. Obviously you should check out YT vids to see how this game really goes down and figure out if it's for you. Happy GRINDING!!! D
title: Rust

review: As the game is not yet complete I will reserve my review until that time.That being said there is something I think people reading reviews of this game should know.In my opinion Rust is the best example of Early Access done right.I've seen so many Early Access games abandoned so many of them a grab for cash to fund another game and even more still that the devs don't listen to the community.Rust is nothing like them. Facepunch has been diligently working at a steady pace for years. They've improved the game so much but more importantly listened to the community when making those improvements.Garry and team have had to deal with the most vitriolic harassing violent fans (Play this game for a few hours on a public server and you'll know what I mean). Yet they've listened to them with respect tried out their suggestions scaled back unpopular ones and communicate with players on social media about their decisions. I believe this alone is worth the purchase price.For people reading this beware of reviews that claim the devs 'broke' the game or made it 'unplayable'. This game does huge updates every month and some players get mad when their 'techniques' (exploits) are nerfed. That is the source of many of these bad reviews. There are some legitimate complaints which Facepunch have always acknowledged and worked to improve.

review: RustI have played a couple long sessions on this game and had fun during them. The problem is after I make a base and try to collect resources and what not I get raided. Every time I log back on I have nothing left. The grinding elements is fun to work toward getting a better base weapons and armour. The graphics are phenominal. The sound effects are very realistic. Dispite this I cannot play this game without knowing I will loose everything I worked for. Playing with friends may make it a little more enjoyable and may allow you to get farther faster but playing solo has been horrible so far. As a side note the developers decided to add a female character and random facial features just to be politically correct. I would be fine with a female character if I could choose it my self rather than being forced to play as one. Personally I don't mind being a female but the developers missed an opportunity to add character customization and made the game worse instead. This game seems to be a few minor changes away from being fair but I have lost my intrerest for it.Rating 5.3/10 Penta

review: Rust makes better use of voice chat than any game I've ever played. You are naked and alone on the world's silliest island. There is no narrator or announcer so instead you submerge in the quietude of the unkempt grass crunching beneath your feet as you uselessly smash your rock against the nearest pine tree. Perhaps you've also harvested some mushrooms and a few bundles of flax enough to stave off the hunger pangs and fashion yourself a burlap shawl to cover your shame. If you're particularly industrious you'll have furnished a nice wooden shack a stone's throw away from some fresh water and reliable resources the entry level homestead necessary for any successful Rust campaign.But then you hear it. Faintly at first. Carried on the tip of the breeze. It's another idiot in Rust. I don't know what it is with this game. Maybe it's the fact that you spawn unclothed and uncensored maybe it's the brutal vastness of the design or maybe it's the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings but Rust has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat merges with the draw distance so when you're spotted by an idiot you'll start hearing the talk quietly tickling your ear. They get closer they get louder and more confident and suddenly you're hopping over shotgun shells while absorbing an entire dictionary of insults.

review: This game is great and the devs are obviously working very hard on it. As you can see i have plenty of hours on the game and each of those hours has been packed with everything from edge of the seat thrill to wanting to snap my keyboard in half. This game has a very unique community that disgusts you at first but you quickly come to love and understand. If you like PvP then this game is for you. As for the devs working on this game let me put in to you this way the devs have this game that everyone loves but it isn't quite working in the capacity that they envisioned that game to be in. So they go and recreate the game code entirely!!!!! You know the devs are looking out for their game and want it to be the best game they can make it when they undertake such a huge project so that they can make the game the way they've always wanted it. And so that the players could still play a playable version they left the old version up while they remade the new one. The devs push out lots of great updates and progress every week I love this game and I love the devs I recommend this game to everyone who likes PvP and isnt afraid to get back up after they've been knocked down.

review: There isn't much to do in the game right now but damn I can't stop playing it. This truly is a sadists game killing other players in a video game has never been so satisfying and rewarding. As a player I've never felt so pressed into being tactical in a video game. This is definitely because I've never wanted to survive so badly in a video game. There aren't many games on the market today that can bring out these raw motivations and incentives.This is the first game I've seen push a grown man to befriend someone through the internet add him on social networks gain his trust only to betray him later just to take all of his virtual possessions and by god I love it.Not many games can drive people to such a level of degeneracy and I hope to see more like this on the market.

review: Incredible If Your Having Lag Issues Then Set It To 720p And Simple Graphics Then When In The Game Press F1 To Open Up Console And Type "Grass.on false" And "Shadow.on False" (Without The "") And Then It Runs With No Lag For Me Anyway.
title: Rust

review: I think this is the future of gaming. I hate it but somehow I'm enthralled. Why should I have fun taking my time beating on trees and animals and rocks with the threat of death looming in the background like some a hole laughing from above? But oh wait just as I'm in the middle of farming trying to survive with a piece of chicken that took me forever to aquire I'm suddenly hit on the back of the head by some desperate soul who needed sustenance just as much as I did. I can't blame him even though I despise him. He wanted what I did to survive. In a nut shell that is what this game is about. You begin to learn to protect yourself never trust anyone and never get too comfortable in your situation. Hasn't this been done before in other games? Certainly it has but never with such a feeling of dread a sense of revenge and a motivation to NEVER let the same thing happen to you again. This is Rust and this is more than a game. Or so it seems.
title: Rust

review: The way the game is I would recomend that you have friends the already play Rust. Playing this on your own and without anyone to help will increase the difficulty highly. In the first hour of play you would experiance being killed by other players at least once. I can recomend to anyone that does want to play on their own that they choose a Non PvP server to start out or at least be prepared to loose everything you gathered multiple times. Even after my 6 hours of play I though that building a hut with a door would protect my belonging but doors can be destroyed and all your belonging looted. I like this challenge and that is why I recomend it.I would also state that you can ignore the video on Steam stating "Your First Day in Rust". As I stated before you will most likly be killed by other players in your first day so crafting a bow a hatchet or a sleeping bag will be come nearly impossible for a while. I will also state the a sleeping bag is highly important as it lets you respawn at that location.Don't give up on this game just yet it is still in Alpha as of writing this.

review: This game is ALPHA. That being said the world is very beautiful Items are a bit bland in terms of progressiveness.At all max settings Rust runs very good. Graphically.Things I would like to see Stone and brick useful to build buildings.Stackable storage in terms of shelfs and cabneints.Freezers / Refrigorators.Knifes skinning Animals dropping correct food types rather than chicken.Use for Liquids such as water Fish fishing poles ability to fish for food.Waterfalls Swimming.Weapons Knifes Crossbows Bolts Sniper rifle? Lighting Tourches that require fuel or attachable light sources to walls allowing for inside building lighting?Electricity ability to build generaitor or simular power source. for above useages.Rust could use a UI overhaul to be totally honest options for resizing text and windows.Perhaps a UI for chat channels or Clans.
title: Rust

review: I know this game is still in Alpha.I played a little here and a little there mostly because I'm trying to find the perfect time to play when the lag issues are the lowest. Other than spending multiple respawns trying to find everything needed to survive I finally did it. I managed to kill a few animals with the rock you start with collect wood and spend an hour trying to find those rare rocks that you need to beat on in order to get stone and metal fragments. The major problem I see is everyone and their brother has to build themselves a shack then they stop playing and these empty abodes are left there on the map causing the servers to build them if and when they restart. If they can manage to fix this issue where you can build yourself a house and never return. Once the lag issues are sorted out the game will be better.Now I play on a PVE server because I'm a whimp like that. Don't hate. It seems the major issue on this server Central 2 is that once you log out you're fair game. People are able to kill you and take your stuff. Which is completely against the whole PVE idea. So I haven't yet been murdered because of this quirk but there are those who log in and fill the chat with their complaints. Another issue to fix? Probably but it shouldn't be the first thing on their list to fix.Now resource spawns or just spawns in general. It seems you spend three hours looking for one item in particular whether it's the stones that give you stone / metal fragments or food. There just doesn't seem to be enough to be beneficial. The most common resource is wood whether in wood piles or the trees themselves. Then there is food if you can risk fighting a bear or wolf without them killing you. When you do find an animal you have to watch out because it is faster than you and will probably bolt at the faintest hint of you or when another player comes running up to try and kill it. On to the stone issue if you spend three hours walking the entire map and don't find a single mineable stone there's a problem. Easy fix? Up the amount that spawn into the map.Overall I'd definitely recommend anyone interested in a multiplayer PVP / PVE zombie survival crafting game to get this. Just be aware that it's in alpha and there is the occasional hacker.
title: Rust

review: Well the game is very fun to play. I like building my house/keep together with a few good friends. We send out parties hunting for food materials and tech. We also go on raids where we break into peoples homes and take their stuff. Also the adrenalin when you are chasing a aidrop is awsome with often fierce firefights breaking out over them. There are a few bugs but nothing really major (it really feels like a complete game in many regards)The reason i do not reccomend the game at this time are as follows 1 Balance There is no balance between raiders and builders. It is easier to raid/murder compared to building/farming and usually you gain enough materials from the raid to continue making c4 (often you get c4 from the residents to so the cost of raiding is not as high as some people would claim. Unless you hit a dummy house with nothing in it and just spent 15c4 on it) Last wipe we got the tech early and raided 3 5 houses (poorly built to be true but still) No problems in get 10 c4 on the first day (we lucked out with airdrop) The lack of defence means you have to hide your stuff and not build a big houses. The successfull people walk 10 15minutes into the wasteland to build and then spend their time transporting materials and raiding others. Personally i hate that much walking and i cant believe that this is what the game is about. This is the major breaking point for me there needs to be ways to defend the base there need to be room for raider builder and the ones in between. I do everything in the game i farm i build i raid and when on raid i will murder people who are farming for their materials. Just so you dont think this is a builder whining about being raided. I also sometimes help fellow rustians that i encounter on farming trips. Unless i have gear of value on me then its safer to shoot them first and find out if they are armed second 2 Hackers yes there are a few of them out there even if you are on a server with good admins3 Admins some servers have bad admins that abuse their powers (my last server was good in this regard but it can be really hard to find the "right" home)4 If you are a peacloving builder you need to keep in mind that most people will shoot you on sight or beat you with their stone axe whatever. Personally i do not mind this as i love player vs player. I try to not kill kill everybody i see but after being killed x amount of times by nude people hiding shotguns up their private parts i now tend to shoot everyone who gets to close to me (nude or not)5 Addition to 4 Your house WILL be raided. Does not matter if you have a 8x8 structure with all metaldoors instead of walls. You will not be able to prevent this because the raiders stay up at night to take your house when you are sleeping. If you join the server after 3 4days after a wipe there are raiders running around with 50 100c4 chain raiding houses. The good news is that your big house is usually safe during the day when you are up because the hardcore raiders do not want to risk losing a ton of c4 to defenders. I have been raided once while online and i was away on my own raid at the time. We got back and killed the raider as he left our house (thanks for the kevlar guy) D So online good chance of defending your loot. Bad news You need sleep school work you will be raided when you get back! (Our big house gets raided every night so do our neigbours and we live a fair walk away from the road/settlements)Some people 15min walk from us made 4 houses by the road we were spying on them to determin where they put most of their loot They had two big towers with lots of doors and one metal house(3 stories high) and a small house close by. Day 3 after wipe they were all raided. Every door every storage box every sleeping bag destroyed I know because i went there looking to raid and someone had beaten me to it (I would have been able to get maybe 30% 40% into one of the houses. That someone else had c4 to blow EVERYTHING is just mind boggeling)

review: There's no rust for the wicked.Rust in peace.Eat my rust.2000 hours in the game at time of writing and a few hours of admining mostly playing rockets and choppy chop.If you have never played rust before then out of your choice of 2 games ie. Rust/New Rust vs Original Rust/Old Rust/Legacy I would say that the new and encumbent version is the new rust. It has better graphics and is the one the devs want to support moving forward. However although it may in essence be a better game in terms of its physics and visuals I do not believe that it gives the player the same level of grittiness in the overall experience. Original Rust made my heart literally jump on at least several occasions in a way that not many games can actually do. We can be talking sheer terror it's great. Then there are the sniper fights. Window to window in metal bases with boltys. First time you do that is a buzz. I think if it came down to it everyone would prefer the old game but only if they'd have made a few more maps.... Buy the game and play the old version before the new one. You get both versions anyway so you can choose which one to play any time you log in so it's all good. Just buy it I say. ) There's no rust for the wicked.Rust in peace.Eat my rust.

review: Won't lie. It's a pretty game. I enjoyed running through the lush landscape and hunting was pretty fun too once you got the hang of using the bow. Building a base up from nothing epecially with a friend or two is fun. Watching that little shack you two developed from hours of farming materials feels nice like in any game with a building and crafting system... and then you log back in the next day to see all that hard work flung out the window because someone decided to pay you a house visit and commandeered all your hard earned mats. I've got nothing against the game itself. I quite enjoy it. My gripe is with the people who get way too thirsty for blood. New to the game? Nothing good on you? Don't want to fight? Too bad. They will kill you without a second thought. And that house that you worked hard to build that is storing all the mats you spent hours to farm? Expect that to be gone everytime you log off and log back on hours later.This game is still in its early stages so I'm hoping in the future they add something to better protect your buildings that you've spent hours on or at least an option to host a private server. Until then if you're looking for a game with an open world enviroment and crafting system I don't recommend this game unless you don't mind the PvP. Or at least play it with a bunch of friends.

review: This is a long oneTLDR at the bottomRust is a game like no other. I first played on legacy years back and I vividly remember my first thought after loading in to the server being "What the are these graphics". For the time they were bad but the game captured me and it was with the large open world quantity of players and its very steep gunplay learning curve. When I had my first gun I thought I was the dogs balls and now one could mess with me. This was until I opened the door to my base and got one bombed by a guy in full kevlar with a shotgun. After rinsing and repeating this annoying cycle I decided to stop playing the game. Not a bad first experience but not the worst.Now I would just like to take this moment to say I believe Facepunch Studios are the best devs around and will continue to be for a long while they listen to the comminity and tell the community what their plans for the game is. Just look at the Facepunch blog and road map the sheer amount of planned content is preposterous yet achievable as they have proved time and time again. Tripple A devs need to take a page out of this book.When I heard that they were REMAKING Rust my first thoughts where "Oh great now I have to pay for a game I already have" but no. They decided after working on legacy for over a year. "You know what I'm not really happy with the game so it LETS SCRAP EVERYTHING WE HAVE DONE SO FAR and make a new game for them to play that they will enjoy more". I dont know about you but I think any other group of developers would have let the game stay as it is after being blinded by the number of sales the game got. Hats off to Facepunch.When the NEW Rust first came around I was sceptical about many things. Questions like "Have they bitten off more than they can chew?" "Why is a deer chilling at the bottom of this lake?" started to arise as I fist dabbled in this uncharted territory of bugs abusable game mechanics. But I gave the game time and so did the devs and over the years they have crafted what I see to be thee best example of an early access game being sucessful and achieving its potential as a game. I don't really wanna call it a survival game as the base necessities of survival are not really as important as they should be (food drink temperature etc.) This is something that I believe the devs will fix over time. But if you can look over that at the core this game is a masterpiece.Additionally I have met so many people that have become friends throught Rust so heres short story about a guy named TH Dog. I have no idea how long ago this was but it was when the Leveling system was first implemented.&gt Building a base on a rock&gt See a guy building near me on a river&gt Approach cautiously with my bow&gt Say "Hello!"&gt He sees me and draws his bow&gt Imaboutdomeafella.jpg&gt He talks "Hey man you friendly?"&gt Exchange base locations and become neighbours&gt Go back to building my base&gt Hear the pitter patter of about 4 guys run past my base&gt Realise they are heading towards my neighbour&gt Hear the sad sound of explosions wasted on this lootless base that this man had constructed&gt Everything settles&gt Carry on building my base&gt Hear a pitter patter of a neked&gt Hear "Hey man I was your neighbour but I got raided"&gt I often think about this moment as it is what really started this friendship. I broke a rule of Rust. I let him in my base and let him duo with me as I felt bad for him he had access to all of my I think anyone else would have ed me over but not this guy. We ended up dominating our area until the end of the wipe.&gt I don't think I'd give anyone that chance again as I'd most likely get ed over. I feel like the decision of letting this man in was made by my young naive brain&gt Still play with Dog to this dayTLDR 9/10 Worth a buy even at full price a sale is just god send Best played with friends still fun as a solo player tho Good combat and building mechanics Best devs around that actually care about games and listen to the community If you hate PvP this game is not for you If you love it hehe Ill see you in 300 hours If they are not your friend they are hostile You will get frustrated when you have been raided As a new player you will find it hard to grasp the complexitys of the game in terms of macro and micro I recommend playing with someone who knows what they are doing. Crossbow is best weaponProbably a ton of typos in this but I really don't care. Ive been waiting to review this game for a while now and now its "fully released" I deem this the right time to make it.

review: The game is currently not ready for prime time. I know it is an alpha but the game is just not fun. The graphics are pretty but the gameplay is very very very basic. The crafting is simple to say the least. The process for how resources are gathered needs to be re thought. It is way too hard to gather stone. I spend most of my time running around just trying to find the correct stone outcropping so I could gather some. Plus if you actually make any progress in the game the servers keep on updating and wiping your progress. The game is also plagued by hackers and griefers. On a PvP server you will be sniped by flying players before you even have enough to craft a bow and arrow. You can also be killed while offline and have your inventory taken even on non PvP servers. Dont waste your time on this yet. It may evolve into a fun game someday but for now save your $20!
