review: Ok Ill admit it took me a while to get the swing of this game. But now that I've had a chance to dig in I really like it. It's going to you off. Your going to meet people you would rather not know. But there are servers full of people that will help you figure it out. A few hints to help out new nakeds. Don't run up to anyone and expect not to get shot. If you see someone lock eyes and jump once. If they jump to then you should be safe to try and talk. This does not mean you won't be shot but it's a kind of etiquette. Don't build to close to monuments you'll get raided quick. Try to talk to people befor you build to close to another base. Dig around for a server and try to find one thats relitivly calm. By this I mean find one without chat fighting or little kids running around being racial and loud. Try player servers rather then official. Your going to get killed no matter how nice the server is build yourself a sleeping bag befor you build a base. When farming for recorces it can help to make a small stash and bury your haul near where your farming. This way if people hone in on the noise you make and shoot you in the back you'll still have a little of what you farmed hidden near by. Turrets can be turned against the owner place accordingly. I just started getting into this game so if you need a safe place to get a start hit me up in game and I'll help if I can. I don't KOS. I'll useually give the other player a chance to make a move first. It gets me killed allot. But you play the way you enjoy or run the risk of becomeing one of the tinpot teenage server dictators that frequent this game.

On top of that the only way to get better crafting recipes is to kill the npc zombies "which are supposed to be tuirned into something more original later on". Kept me captivated for a few hours until my party was wiped out by a group of raiders with end game gear. Besides these set backs this game is well worth the cost and I cannot wait to see it grow.

review: I am editing this review for RUST. My first review was rough because of the problem the game had early on with hackers. Although hackers are still an issue I think the game has come such a long way since I first started playing that I think it deserves a new review. This is a great game. I think as far as the survival genre goes this game is one of the best. It is worth doing some research into what server to play on because in this game community is extremely important even if you plan to play solo. At first I hated that at anytime someone could kill me and take all my stuff or destroy a base I spent hours building. But the adrenaline you get from trying to defend your base and then the rage you feel after you are overwhelmed Mixed with the satisfaction that comes from getting revenge is a recipe for an incredibly engaging game.

review: The game is amazing and you should definetely get it but you should also have some nerves for it. If you can't stick to it at it's worst you don't deserve it at it's best. The game itself is fun after all optimizations i can run it well gives a huge degree of freedom which makes it so fun. Instead of making a decent review I'll just explain why people give it a negative review right now.I KEEP GETTING KILLED BY PEOPLE WITH AK S!The game has came out of EA and a lot of fresh players are running into it and find themselves fckd over and over agian by people with gear. This indeed is Rust so get over it if you want to have fun. They dont get hiding while being weak is a part of the game as nobody wants a naked next door growing into a potential threat.PEOPLE ARE TOXIC!Why do people keep leaving negative reviews saying this? You're reviewing the game not it's community! I mean I often find non toxic people and have pretty funny encounters which is one of most memmorable things in rust. Maybe you're just unlucky and even if people are toxic you're forggeting the fact that Rust isn't about being all nice.THE GAME ISN'T NOOB FRIENDLY!As someone who played quite a bit of it I can agree my first days felt like going naked down a slide of razor blades balls forward but that's the whole beauty of Rust it makes you know it won't be easy. After a couple of tries you can get your base up and running. If you're not sure youre doing something right the internet is your best friend. There are a lot of videos online telling you what should you do in order to survive solo.OPTIMIZATION IS GARBAGE!Sorry cant hear you over my 100 FPS on my dated aids AMD setup. Yes I am running it on lowest but mostly because I don't want any possibility of a lagspike happening mid combat. As the 1.0 released the peformance was garbage for me but they improved it alot. Now it feels like playing a game and not flying trough a power point presentation really fast.TL DR Rust is an amazing game it will be rough sometimes but as you play you learn to do things right and avoid getting fkd all the time and the game gets hella more rewarding as you learn to play it.

review: Honestly loved this game years ago. Never played legacy much but enough to fall in love with this game in 2013. the Unitiy 5 engine and graphic change in 2014 was nice but could never figure out how to change my gender from female every time since was never a big deal to me could have YouTubed it I suppose if it truly made it a difference to me. I did not enjoy when they took away the Blue Print system and made it more of exp like Ark That was a huge let down. when the took the exp away and brought the BP's back I was stoked. Oh how I remeber when They first added The Helicopter omg was that a blast with huge zergs fighting eachothers. ZFG and DMG on rustopia where huge clans that honestly put up great firefights. man oh man Rustopia was an awesome server really KOS "kill on sight" Jan 2018 is when I played last. Always was a KOS server but more crazy now I feel. Loved the airfields for great action. Have yet to come back to rust since about the beginning of this year 2018 and feel ashamed not having played the game since they actually full released in Feb. Man I didn't think facepunch would ever finish this game lol. Over all great game would recommend 10/10 GG no Zzz. One will never sleep once the get the Rust flu XD Have made some great friends from this game Thank you FacePunch! every game has it's down falls hard to stop turds from being turds and keep them from hacking. Face punch did a better job with their anti cheat then Counter Strike Global Offensive I feel P my favorite memory of the game was when they added Optics. A lot of us would stay up late at night crafting gunpowder ammo explosives you name it we where preparing for WAR preparing for that next day of raids battle and glory. We would sit around a camp fire enjoying the pleasures of calories converse about the game exchanging our hypotheses of how rust would change and would always talk about how cool it would be for them to add optics for the guns. we all loved the bolty but man how we all would tower camp/snipe others doing the same camping in their towers sniping others oh the joy. Shoot the M249 was a beast with a scope. Need to give this game some more hours of my life to feel like this was a good review. From my experience of growing with the game I totally enjoyed it. Hate to not be able to give my opinion on how the game is finalized but can tell you that I truly enjoyed the game when I played last. I love all of you Nerds!(Edited for spelling errors. I'm sure there is more.) &lt 3 Medi
title: Rust

review: So Rust.What an interesting game must I say. Pros It's fun. Very fun. Every server you play on is a completely different experience. Lots of things to do. The PvP aspect of the game is by far the best PvP experience than any game out there. (FPS) Most of the popular servers have active and unbiased admins. Of course there's always those asscracks though. Learning how to use guns isnt easy and I kind of appreciate that. (Mostly talking about the AK 47) Running Rad Towns is actually enjoyable.Cons The Community. Its literally terrible. Lots and lots of toxic people no matter what server you choose to play on. Getting Offlined is EXTREMELY frustrating and demotivating. Imagine playing for 12 hours one day just to log on the next day and everything you worked for was taken from you without your choice of defending it. Clans. I typically don't mind them since I play in them but I do understand why a lot of people don't like them. Not really for casual gamers. Theres a lot of grinding but you can play for 2 hours one day and get off. Just don't expect to get much done in those two hours.Overall 6/10. The game is still in the early works and could use a lot of work.

review: I have always enjoyed Rust since its early days. I have operated numerous servers for the game for the online fan base experience. It is something rather enjoyable with others can get a bit lonesome if alone.Dedicated custom servers are handy for this game since I feel the supply rate of materials is deeply hindered in the official servers. I would think it takes ages to get things built at the low rate of supplies. Luckily custom modded servers exist to boost resource in take. The developers have obviously offered to help create a game that allows the fan base to add to it themselves via custom servers. That shows attention to its customers. Don't always see this in other games.I will however have to add that the Legacy version of the game is still my favorite. I do hope one day vehicles show up in the game because it is a long walk sometimes. I would have thought by now they would have added such enhancements since the game has been around so long. There is a mod for servers to allow a "scrap helicopter" but its very glitchy in terms of operation since its not game support exactly. The PVP of the game can be brutal. Most of the time its just a game of who can win the gun fight instead of a "Are you friendly!?" I would recommend modded servers over official servers as well. Not so much because of their enhancements to the game but for the extra admin support you do not find in official servers. The game has a lot of problem players so I would suggest admin operated servers. In summary Get some friends together. Maybe rent a server or find a nice quiet place to play and start gathering and building. The game offers a lot and has made a lot of great changes in the time since release. I would certainly suggest checking this out if you haven't already.

review: Rust is very much like a combination of Minecraft and games such as Infestation Survivor Stories. It has moderatly good graphics for a game in early alpha with gameplay that is just as good if not better. The community can be unforgiving but there are PVE servers for new comers to these types of games. While the game could still use some improvement it is still solid enough to purchase now and begin playing.Pros *Crafting system is easy to use and gathering is just as easy.*Controls are simple and easy to learn as well as customize*Graphics are good for a game in early alpha*PVE and PVP servers to accomidate every type of gamer from casual to the hardcoreCons *No way to really tell where you are on the map so easy to get lost*Community on PVP servers are very unforgiving and will not hesitate to kill players that have literally just spawned*Spawning into the game if you dont have a 'camp' can spawn you in the middle of various PVE creatures as well as PVP players.The game has its ups and downs but all in all is very solid and is still a work in progress. Would recommend to friends as well as players just looking for something new and fun 8.5 out of 10

review: The basic premise of the game is good I like where it's going. The community is wretched they're terrible soulless bastards that's part of the game's charm. The non cheating sociopaths in this game are the best part.Given that it's alpha (and probably never going to be 'released') I can look past the terrible UI the terrible graphics the terrible sound the shallow gameplay and the very many nonsensical game mechanics. The game has two major shortcomings the developer lacks the technical skill to address egregiously incompetent network code and a complete absence of server side validation. At least I hope there's no attempt at server side validation yet because if they're is an attempt at it then development of this title is in even worse shape than it seems.More content and a less pathetic UI mean nothing if the game is unplayable due to server side lag and unchecked cheating. These are core issues that have to be addressed early in a game half assing them in later won't work well and if they're not halfway decent by now don't expect them to get better later.Rust is backed by a good idea but this idea needs to be executed on by competent developers. I don't regret dropping $20 to check it out it's like paying to watch a terrible movie with a good premise. My only concern with this game is that the terrible execution of this game will turn off gamers to survival games and harm a emerging genre I happen to like. Gamers would be better off if this project was trashed and somebody who knows what they're doing gave it a shot instead.It's interesting for a couple of days although it will never be a legitmately playable game

review: Alright so I popped in Rust here a couple days ago. Learned what i was doing and got pretty good at it. Spent 10 hours on a base. had every thing sealed off. Had a bunch of item crates with loot in them (about 10) had 4 furnaces going. Pretty decent for just me (my buddy joined me later). Had an amazing base best walls floors ceilings and doors with key code access. Made a tunnel or a maze like pattern involving numerous numerous armored doors all with different codes to the doors. only 1 way in and 1 way out. Had a huge stockpile of weapons and ammunition. I was having a blast. I finally got the hang of the game really well. Was working on some blue prints for weapons and ammunition. Everything was great. No mistakes. I was just outside the base mining some metal ore and stones when i got shot with a pistol. So i fled back to my home my safe place.Now. Reader discretion is advised. If you are under 18 I strongly suggest you discontinue reading from this point forward. So i made it back into my base. All doors locked. And i heard them running around outside it was two of them. Their footsteps heavy. i heard some pistol shots sound like it came from the 6 shot revolver heard 2 shots checked my Armored walls and saw they had full health and laughed. Then something happened. THESE MOTHER F&amp %$#'S TELEF#%$ING MOTHER F% $ING INTO MY MOTHER F%$#ING HOUSE AND F&amp %#ING KILLED ME. 15 F%$#ING HOURS OF BUILDING AND HARVESTING JUST DOWN THE C#$% SUCKING DRAIN BECAUSE OF SOME F%$#ING HACKS I DIDNT EVEN KNOW ABOUT......Okay sorry about that. I just composed myself. I had a ton of fun looting and building and harvesting and fighting people. Earning my way up to where I was until this happened. Now.. Im done forever. Super fun game if you're learning how to do everything. UNINSTALLED 13/10 Would UNINSTALL again. That is all.

review: This game is amazing. You can pretty much do anything you want but the hardcore world that is rust will try it's hardest to prevent you from doing so. Nearly everything is player based and you're own progress is based on how sneaky or diplomatic you can be... With that being said regardless of how hard you try there's always the possibility of the evil of man. Or the evil in you.I learned very quickly that when all you have is a rock it's better to have two so seeing a naked person smashing the face of another isn't that uncommon. Surely most players are out for number 1 but there are a few "safe zones" that if you can comply to not being a complete scoundrel you may get the pass of living along side some rugged bastards just trying to amass as much wall weapons and resources to take on an army of loot thirsty raiders. If you're just trying this game for the first time all I can say is only the patient survive. And try not to end up being someone's slave!

review: This game was a waste of money. You spend countless hours building and building. You make a nice house you get lots of resouces. You make some friends. Then you need to eventually goto sleep. Someone comes to your place kills you takes all of your stuff and ruins your house. You then spawn in the middle of no place with no map no idea where the heck you are and you attempt to start over. You spend countless hours gathering resouces and you may even raid some peoples places. You get cool stuff and you will eventually leave your game. You then wake up and all your stuff is gone. Someone had once again murdered you taken everything and ruined your house. If your lucky they do it while your sleeping. Alot of the times 10+ guys will roam up you you while gathering and while your at home cooking and they blow your door off and murder you take all your hard work and your once again left with absolutly nothing for your time. Its once of the dumbest games i have played. The more people on the server the faster you die. People will kill you on site. Even naked with only a rock you will be murdered cussed at via the games ingame voip. Please avoid this game at all costs. Its only fun for a small time.

review: The game itself still has along way to go before it is complete but saying that the game has gone a long way since creation. The game is in two parts at the moment legacy rust 2.0LegacyLegacy is a stright out PVP game the survival aspect has been completely wiped out through toxic players and hackers. The game itself is full of glitches and bugs and incredibly unstable. Although this version of the game is complete garbage my friends and I still have fun playing the game. 8/10Rust 2.0Rust 2.0 is an improvement from legacy. It has a lot to offer and is constantly being updated and improved. The PVP aspect to the game still needs a lot of work but the PVE aspect of the game is excellent and immersive. The graphics are superb but the animations are still quite glitchy and movement isn't very smooth. The community isn't that great either but it has improved since legacy. 9/10Definitely worth buying whether you play as a team or just by yourself. All in all it is a great game with a lot to offer.

review: I love Rust! I've been playing Rust since the original version and man its come a LONG way. I love how well Rust immerses you into the world that is Rust. You will wake up naked on a beach and quickly start to feel comfortable as you are captivated by the beautiful enviornment in which you have awoken to. Before you know it you'll encounter one of the other players and soon you'll be fleeing for your life as a player or two are chasing you with guns as you run naked and helpless across the landscape. Thats the normal welcoming event that most players will experience. Once that happens you'll soon find yourself startled by every sound and every little bit of movement. On another note I enjoy the building aspect thats apart of this first person shooter it adds another challenge to a style of game that can get redundant. Don't get me wrong though Rust is all about building raiding stealing ambushing pillaging and plundering. Its a game for people who can think and act like a pirate. This game requires tough skin because you'll log off one night resource rich with all the weapons in the world and log on to find a few holes blown into the side of your base and all your item boxes empty. This game isn't for the soft of heart fair warning. "1 hour will soon turn to 4"
title: Rust

review: Whilst it's still clearly an alpha Rust shows much the same promise and appeal of Minecraft Garry's mod (or countless other sandbox environments/games). The beauty of Rust for me is observing human behaviour and how my own behaviour changes within the game world Someone's running towards me do I greet them? flee? Shoot to kill? Should I live out my days in the woods with the bears or should I group together with others and form a community/township? Maybe the world needs a roving gang of thugs pillaging the other players towns?Freedom is the greatest gift and greatest risk in any game.

review: Game has a good premise and has promise if it weren't held back by one major issue.... The community. The community is largely a bunch of toxic kids who love nothing more than to kill you and get the satifaction that there is nothing you can do about it especially if they are dedicated players. You start with nothing but a torch and a rock and you will get aquanted with this fact frequently cause when the other players kill you you will be reduced to this state. You may wonder how can they kill me when I'm offline? Well this game doesn't log you off your character merely goes to sleep leaving you defenseless when off server. So do not be surprised when you re log with a death cap. It was fun at first tbh but seeing a death screen repeatedly and starting over just wears you down and you just question why you wasted sooo much time for nothing.

review: As of right now the Mac version doesn't work at all. I understand your game is in Alpha &amp that means things won't work 100% but I believe a developer should only release their games on the platforms they're designing for if they can at least function as a game. I understand if maybe animations or like a zombie bugs out I understand that.But when you release a game on a platform that doesn't even work there's something wrong there. I'm sick &amp tired of Mac players being ridiculed &amp treated like second rate players who aren't given attention to their version. I paid $20 for a game that basically just freezes up my Mac &amp causes me to shut down my computer because everything stops working.Look I'm sure RUST is a fine game &amp if it were working I could actually play it I would. But this practice of releasing a game before it's ready KNOWING it won't even work for players is garbage. You cheated me out of my money &amp didn't even deliver a product that functions in any capacity. Again I understand there will be bugs &amp this isn't official release but it should at least be playable enough that Mac players can at least run around &amp interact with the environment. Not "Start A Game" then have everything freeze &amp cause unneeded frustration. This is why I'm a console gamer first so I don't have to deal with this shoddy execution. Give me a refund please.
title: Rust

review: as an avid rust player of over 200 hours I absolutely love this game and what its about. Ive been playing since day one release all the way up until today. this game is brutal and unforgiving not for the feint of heart by any means. If you're able to look past that you will have the most exhilirating love hate relationship with any game you've played to date. you HAVE to roll with a team dont waste your time solo play. unless you no life or play on an extremely low pop server you literally will never be able to secure a base fast enough and enjoy the game without a solid team. Another thing you will have to look past is hackers. since day one hackers have always plauged this game and i think its pathetic that they still exist within every single group on OFFICIAL servers. Day one undeveloped rust sure i understand some hackers slipping through the cracks but this game has been out for years and the fact that there is still such a huge number of hackers on OFFICIAL COMPANY OWNED servers is pathetic. its only slightly frustrating when your team gathers materials for 7 hours straight then some random guy flies through your heavily fortified structure instant headshots every single person in the vicinity takes all your hard earned material then vanishes. oh did i mention this kind of stuff happened to my team three separate times this week on an official company owned server? twice by the exact same player days later? the same people will blatantly exploit and hack the game and not get banned. TL DR+ If you play with friends this is possibly one of the most fun gaming experiences you could have blatant hackers roam free on official servers on you and dont get banned... everim hooked and theres no other game that provides this rush. rust is incredible with timeless gameplay value and fun. it is one of the best games ive ever played and if facepunch could provide a solid fix to this horrible hacking issue id wholeheartedly reccomend this game. for now i recommend staying out until theyre able to at least keep the losers out of their own official servers.

review: Rust was described to me as a 3D survival minecraft (sans the digging). And it could be with some time.My small group of friends and I started a server and could'nt tear ourselves away for some time. Work your way up from the stone age (rock in hand) and eventually build yourself a fortress loaded with building materials weapons mods food and armor. So long as other players zombies and wolves don't get to you first. Greatest feeling in gaming I've had with Rust recently grouping up with your friends into a tight compound and go raiding at night to some poor sods who've only managed to collect a handful of wood and their trusty pet rock. God we're Anyway once the developers work out a few more kinks this has the potiential to be a star game expierence on Steam.

review: Rust is not DayZ Rust is not Minecraft. Rust is survival at an entirely different level. In Rust it takes a great deal of effort to build very little. In Rust Zombies are limited to certain areas and don t pose a great deal of threat. In Rust to progress you will need to build a base unfortunately building a base makes you a target At this point you will spend the rest of your time building other bases in order to mitigate risk. In Rust resource contention creates wars Land disputes create war. In Rust you are never really safe.This early alpha is as early as they come but it is awesome.

review: There are many ways to some this game up but if you combine the anarchy of Fallout with the creativity of minecraft you would find Rust. I recommend playing it and joining a very low pop server at first till you get your feet wet. If you try to instantly join a server of 100+ people you will die rather quickly. Some people are nice some are evil. So you actually get to see the best and worst qualities of human nature. Oh and if you hate having to start over regurlarly then this isnt the game for you because at any moment you get off or are even on a group of misguided evil players can take down what you just spent a whole day on in a matter of minutes. So food for thought dont get emotionally attached to anything and keep it simple.

I died right outside my house from a wolf respawned and killed the wolf but the bit me before I killed it and I bled to death! I had to wait 400 seconds to spawn again just to find out that my dead body with all my stuff was gone because my latest death overwrote it. That's the point where I rage quit but the game is so fun I keep coming back for more! It does take a lot of effort to get materials and when it comes to metal it's the worst but for some reason it's fun and relaxing. This game is way better than Ark though! 8/10

review: This is a blunt review from a solo vanilla player(Who recently moved to lower population server for a change in pace)I hardly ever write reviews actually as a matter of fact I don t believe I have written a review before.That being said I feel the mad urge to because this game is something else.It is rare and unique when a game can make the leap from having an effect on your virtual character to actually having an effect on you.I know that sounds crazy but you will feel anxiety fear and you will be creeped out.Let me paint a picture for you you just spent an hour or two gathering resources to build a base and you are out at night gathering more wood and rock when you hear footsteps and your inventory is full the stuff of freaking nightmares.The virtual environment this game has created is like no other no matter what game you try unless you buy something that imitates rust but you would be a fool to spend your money like that.If you want to survive overnight in a vanilla server crouch instead of walk do not run to gunfire/do not get smart to people with guns do not approach people most servers are Kill on sight they want your meat and fat. Do not trust anyone unless you know them in person they are less likely to betray you and if they do you can get some payback.You can come across the strangest beings on the planet through this game.From awful singing to descriptive abuse of your family members to things you just never even thought another human being would think of doing/saying.Thicker skin and quick wit is a must if you want to actually survive.You will learn to hate and love this game. For all those saying there is no end game it s what you make of it.Content is always being added the debs are killing it in the best way possible think the state of alpha is more about the debs doing their jobs properly and not releasing half shit to the public and calling it a game hence weekly updates and the game has taken a form of its own.My goal is to be able to make it through a server cycle without being raided no shame in admitting I haven t clocked the game yet.The grind is large but the feeling of achievement after finishing your project/mission or whatever you are doing is much larger.There are problems that need to be addressed with cheating being one of the MAJOR problems.No salt here but your 500m headshot that you managed to pull off while I was only able to see your head move up and down as a pixel doesn t actually seem plausible at all.Nope I actually truly simply can tell you You had an aimbot ohh and now you raided my entire base with your 6 boyfriends. Mint.Insert.randymarsh&amp pc.jpegOther main issue is optimising which I know I agreed to because it is Early Access but hardware requirements for the game are quite high if you want to run it at good FPS which you do FPS drops cost resources. Average FPS ATM are around 30 40 on a GTX780ti plenty of ram ssds and cpu. Crashes due to bugs majorly annoying especially if you play in a populated server which means queuing and since you can t always be on rust you become loot. Unsure if debs were trolling but unable to change what your character looks like seems like it shouldn t bother me too much but the fact the fact I am now a female with no hair makes me feel a bit sad . I can t frolic around the rust paddocks with this mean ginger mane.TL DRPlay it smart get to know your guns do some research if you must.Once you dive into this game you will fully comprehend what I meant if you don t like losing be prepared to rage quit and put your hardware away fast enough so you don t smash it.Completely and absolutely a must have.Shoot the squeakers.PS if you too are getting destroyed by clans in the server try low population servers you won t find too many clans and you can do the raiding for a change.

review: Rust is a great game well worth the price even if in alpha. I consider it a lot like minecraft but actually a good game. Basically the objective of the game is to gather resources like wood food fuel and survive by making a shelter and weapons. You may even be able to build an empire and rule the land if surviving long enough and getting some friends. As for the graphics the graphics are beautiful with a cinematic touch to them. The gameplay is great but has some issues that need ironing out. For example some items and structures require way too many materials in order to create them. A wood wall for example takes 30 wood in which can take a great deal of time to get just for a small wall when done alone. Also this issue may require a lot of thought to fix but you will end up dying a lot and i mean a lot. Most of the time by other players. Its almost impossible to survive over 20 mins without getting murdered by another player. If its not the other players its the wolves. Also other players can easily steal your items in which is a bit (VERY) annoying. My main solution for this is to have a single player option in which you can just mess around alone instead of fighting over materials with other players and getting murdered every five minuites. Besides that the game is very entertaining challenging and can be a great time alone or with friends. I recommend you purchase this game ASAP while in early access so you get the game for a good deal.Have a great day and buy Rust! Martin Septim
title: Rust

They should also make the ability to raid a little harder thanks for fixing the bug with the 1 c4 takes out an entire wall if placed properly.... now lets give the new guys a chance with making the doors take more than 2 3 C4 to blow up. I honestly always play on servers that dont have anyone on them which ends up sucking because those servers go away due to "lack of players". I honestly think this game should have the option of being single player (ideal for people that want to no survive) or mulitplayer (ideal for people that want to get attacked or raided OVER AND OVER again).

review: If you are new to rust you see this big open world where you can do anything you can build your own base and progress to new hights get stronger and stronger you feel excited kinda scared but it seems really cool boom you died and somebody is taking your rock and chopping you up. 15 hours later you are scared and know the grueling fact that this world is not nice its filled with violence and hate and you have so far been murdered 50 times at the very least and horrible things have been done to you that you do not wish to speak of ever again.You hear a knock on the door of that little shack you managed to build it took you such a long time but you finally got that little shack with a lock on the door you managed to make a metal hatchet and a bow and you are now staring at the door knowing full well that whats outside will murder you and take everything you love.then you hear a bash on the door and you realise someone is beating the door down you sit in a corner and cry to yourself and hope you can defend yourself with the bow. Suddenly the door breaks and you hear two shots ring out and suddenly you are dead. you wake up naked and alone with a rock in your hand and the base is gonespeed forward a couple of days you now have a base of your own even a few guns and you are now the one punishing those god damn noobs that know they deserve it and take their stuff. you rule your own little kingdom and you are happy there knowing full well that anyone that set their foot in your lands will pay the price.then you hear a click on your front door and a sudden quick beeping a tear runs down your cheek as you realise its c4 and you are getting raided. you arm yourself with all your guns as the first explosion goes off. you wake up naked on a beach

review: I was lucky and bought this game when it was discounted and i am glad i did.This game is really fun to play with friends as you can do pretty much anything you want. The main problem with this game is that the people are very trigger happy so you need to be careful if you are alone but i suppose if you are in a group of less than 4 you need to be just as careful as you are easier to spot. Anyway I've been told that the shooting in this is similar to CS GO but since I am poor i would not know if that is true.Recently they released a new version of Rust and renamed the old one as the Legacy edition or whatever. The new version is nice and has better graphics but the mechanics need work as you can't enter a room that has 2 doors open inside of it already (if you don't understand it's because i don t know how to explain the situation properly). And another problem is that there aren't many animals that are easy to kill e.g. wolves and bears are just as common as chickens which makes it extremely hard to survive as the wolves and bears now run faster than you and don't stop chasing you they even swim now. The new map is pretty much split into 3 sections the top section is made out of snowy hills and stuff the middle section is the greener part where you find animals and trees and the bottom section is the desert which i'm pretty sure has nothing in.But all in all it's not that bad I can't wait until they put new stuff in the new version.

review: Rust is by far one of the best games I have ever played. While it's toxicity can bring anyone's opinion down on the game I have nearly 700hours on the game and have enjoyed all of it. There is plenty of things that you can do such as meet up with your friends and take down people on the server grab some new scuba gear drive out to the ocean and see what you can find or if you like to roleplay you can also do that. These arent even close to the number of other options you have while playing Rust. In my personal opinion based of monthly updates great customer assistance and a all around good game I would highly reccomend Rust as a game worth buying.
title: Rust

review: After 2 000 i reached the limit rust can provide. It doesn't matter how well you play. If its not admin abuse banning you because you said something or did something. You will play offical servers and wish you had admins because of hackers killing you instantly.This is not a 10 min match of Call of Duty. Each wipe cycle is sometimes 100s of hours you devote to your base your clan your server. You can have clan members destroy everything in minutes. You can raid people so perfectly only to have a hacker killed all 4 of you and take in seconds away what you worked hours for.I left PUBG for this game. The worst thing to happen to games is cheaters. I can't just accept losing my loot because of cheaters that get banned weeks after they cheat. The community servers are better because admins will ban anyone even close to cheating. But they also have complete power of deleting the base you spent 100 hours last week working on.I've caught admins breaking their own rules. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v ilTrsimueNQ&amp t 203sHere is a hacker who poked a corner and shot me in 0.2 seconds https //www.youtube.com/watch?v _UsEj5BXQ7U The more you play the more you can't leave. Soon you will go to bed thinking if you will have a base the next time you get on you will create shift cycles with your friends to see who will watch the base. You will start to call buildings on other games "base". Its a game that either is perfect or isn't worth it.Don't play it. Its pretty much controlled by the people and the people on this game say some of the worst things you will every read on the internet. ITS TERRIBLE. You either play with 10 people or you don't play at all. Its not for solo players. You need to be in a group. The game as in early access for 5 YEARS! It came out a year before GTA 5 came out. Its no where near ready for official.Pubg died because people like hackers killed it.Its fun at the start but cancer at the end.

review: Don't get me wrong this game has alot of potential but right now in alpha this is all that happens to me the first in game day I spend running around naked with a rock trying to find wood piles or boulders to extract some basic resources from. By day 2 I have a little shelter built with a fire to keep me warm a caveman like hatchet in hand clothes on my back and sleeping bag made to set my resawn point just incase i die in the wilderness so I won't have to go back to running around naked with a rock again lol.By day 3 it's just the same thing over and over find animals find wood piles find boulders then run back to the shelter to store said resources so eventually I can make a decent weapon to keep me safe from the crazy ers running around shooting every player on sight noob or not.Now it's usually toward the end of day 3 or 4 that I go running back to camp to store some resources when some with a shotgun comes out of nowhere blows my head off in one hit tears down the door to my shelter and then starts destroying everything i spent the last few hours working on. So now I have to completely start over and go through the same t I have already went through a dozen times already. I would suggest you save the $20 for when the game gets more developed and better balanced because right now all that happens is you run around for a couple hours before some kills you and destroys your hard work all for sport! It just gets old and frustrating fast.

review: I bought this game before its current build and I must say that it has changed for the better. The mechanics of the game are very well thought through and work pretty well. There is a lot to do even if most of it needs a lot of grinding for materials. Its a blast to play with friends but on your own this game is insanly challenging. The community of players is absolutly terrible for the most part. Everyone will be hostile and you need any sort of group to survive on a server with over 30 players. I would still recommend this game. You can still find servers with people who are less hostile you just really need to dig. I would still recommend this game because once you have a group of friends to play with this game becomes so much better its unbelievable. A must buy when its on sale but for the full price watch some gameplay to reach a decision and read more than just one review.

review: Product received for free. It's a very fun game. It's basically another one of those survival games everyone loves similar to Unturned except way better in my opinion. The game is still early access so expect lots of bugs. The game requires a pretty beefy computer to run at an acceptable FPS (30) so you may have to play at the worst settings. The survival mechanics are much better crafting and materials are more diverse tools weapons and other stuff like that feel almost real and of course who could forget the interactions with other players. I have yet to mug someone using a waterpipe shotgun. Note There is no singleplayer mode at this time. I'm glad my friend bought it for me and can't thank him enough! You know who you are. 3Also watch out for the bears.Seriously.

review: Product received for free. If you intend on playing this game alone Don't. There was a time when this was a game. Now it is a full time job. Rust is single handidly responsible for the most toxic little elementary school racist kiddie player base in gaming history. More so than CoD back in the 360 days. More than half of my hours came from the days when Rust was an enjoyable game. Today it is completely unplayable. The player base declines on a daily basis. Grinding increases with each update. All in all this is not an enjoyable experience for anyone playing alone. And even if you start out in a clan one by one they will leave Rust for good and there will be no more clan.
title: Rust

review: Firstly rust is probably the best and most frustrating game on the market. What i love about the game is the ability to keep expanding keep grinding there is no endgame and monthly updates and wipes keep the game fresh. The building is great The combat is great The resource management is great. Though people think the community is toxic I personally think that it is great i meet many nice people as i roam the radiated wasteland Mostly i am killed in fun pvp fights but it is the way of the game and i find that combat is better as you could kill a resouce farmer or a guy with many weapons. I find it best to play with friends as in my experience we can get a double 4x4 honeycomb with exterior walls up in 12 hours. Overall the best playstile is to be with friends as it splits up the required work time. Raiding and being raided is the way of life. When you seek your heart and sould into the game you feel happy one minute but when u log on the next day you wake up on a beach wich means u have been raided wich is mostly frustrating. Overall i reccomend this game to people who love hardcore grindy games The grind always pays off when u have a huge crate full of semi autos and Aks!

review: Ahhh... Rust.It's addicting. I'm not talking candy crush addicting. I'm talking full on Heroin addicting. The gameplay is fluent almost bugless. Fast paced. If you're playing with the right people you'll laugh your off. It's also really competitive once you get the hang of it. But the addicting and competitve pros of this game are also it's cons.Alot of people play this game like it's their dayjob. On your own you don't stand a chance against most clans.It's either you play this game 8 hours a day and have fun or you play this game 2 hours a day and you get on every time you play. That's why i have mixed feelings about this game. I'd give this game a 9/10 for the gameplay.3/10 for the community. There's alot of toxic people but once you find the non toxic people to play with you're good.

review: This game is barely finished and has entertained 15 hours from me in just 3 days. Dear God it's so worth it. It's one of those games that gives a really player driven experience and forces you to interact with others or risk losing everything.There are problems with the game right now and to sum those up I would say that right now it's a little too difficult to get established as a newbie on a 50 player server. You can get comfortable with a reasonable amount of resources and be able to defend yourself while online but as soon as you go offline your character is left as a sleeper in the game world. At that point people can simply destroy your poorly defended hut with one or two C4 bundles and take everything with ease. The result is that you have to spend 1 or 2 consecutive successful hours of survival to be able to continue beyond cloth armor pipe shotguns and a 1x1 single floor wooden shack. It's hard it's a little unforgiving and I think the game would be better if new spawns on a server had more ability to defend themselves.

review: Join a public server to get the feel of the chaos in the game.Then find an empty private server to get a feel of the solo experience.Then find server with a nice community and good admins and settle in.You WILL lose all your stuff but you will learn how to protect it.You WILL get griefed by a holes but the community will gather up against them.You will probably lose all your stuff again to hackers but a good admin might help you recover.All in all the enjoyability of this game (in its current alpha state) comes down to finding the right server for you. And don't stop looking it's out there somewhere.Once you find it the game is worth every penny.

Just go and look at their ban counter on twitter they ban a ton of cheaters all of the time but never have really cleared them from the game. You spend a lot of time farming and gathering and having it all torn down by someone flying or being picked off from out of visual range by an aimbot just isn't fun and until they really put in effort to fix this I wouldn't buy this game.

review: So I've gotten to the point in DayZ SA that I can't relax at all. I've reached end game and am paranoid as hell. So I picked up this game to not give a crap about and to just have fun. The textures arn't all that great the animations are ok and direction is little to none. I joined a 10 population server and tried to find someone to help me out. Of course I knew already that it was probably going to end up like in day Z. I found a camp of people and walked into the middle of it. I got on the mic and asked if anyone was there. 2 people walked out of their make shift homes made out of wooden boards while holding shotguns. I knew already that I wasn't going to live very long because that's how survival games are. I asked them if they could help me out and then they shot me in the face... After I respawned I ran around aimlessly just trying to explore the world. It's not that impressive. there is the random zombie here and there and there is also a radiation element. It's very early Alpha and I'm sure this game will eventually get better but for just a few dollars more DayZ is much better than this game. Plus DayZ has been around a while and has been tried and tested. Honestly I would stay away from this game for now. Spend your money on something else.

review: tl dr good game that is very pvp oriented having a somewhat good community good developers that listen and update frequently.Rust is a very pvp oriented game little or no pve factor in the game in my eyes. The helicopter is one pve factor but can be easily avoided by just not equiping a gun or having lots of clothing on. players are your main threat in the game. If youre someone who loves a pvp game who loves the thrill of maybe dying and loosing everything rust is definitely a game for you. The replayablity factor of rust is pretty good but unique experiences can get pretty dull. You might come across that interesting guy who is friendly or gives you good gear but the majority of players kill on sight even killing nakeds sometimes who pose no threat. In my eyes facepunch should really add something that can effect the player greatly that cannot be avoided. Or a bigger reason to "team up" and not senselessly murder everyone.

review: Rust is an incredible game that gets my adrenaline going almost every time I play it. The raw ideas of starting from scratch and building up what you want with the risk of losing everything from other players is amazing as well as making plays on others as well. Recent updates however have made it nearly impossible to succede as a solo player so if you have friends this game has amazing potential but otherwise its an extreme and sometimes very annoying grind by yourself. Overall rating 9/10 good adrenaline packed pvp and the survival feeling was captured almost perfectly not to mention they are still adding plenty of content every month from their updates and tweaking the way the game works from time to time. My only true dislikes of this game is the frame drops (depending on the servers you are on) and the fact that solo players are practically extinct.

review: It's like...in the...you just...it's kind of like...just play it. It's fantastic. It's a very good social simulator on how dickish players can be or how societies are formed. I'm currently trying to gain access to a player built and run peaceful town called Blood Haven. Trying to find this fabled town I built myself a temporary shelter on the coastline near an easily recognizable landmark. Night fell and as I was cooking chicken meat (or pig? all of the animals drop chicken meat for some reason alpha. that's why ) I heard a banging on my door. I hadn't tested out my newly crafted bow with 32 arrows (painstakingly made after two hours) but I nocked an arrow and hesitantly opened the door. It was a raider. My first shot landed in his shoulder as he jumped over my storage crate to gore me with a stone hatchet. My second and third shots missed and by that time I was bleeding heavily. I looked up at him and asked "Why?" "This is my land. You didn't pay taxes" he said. "Why didn't you ask me first?" I pleaded. "DO YOU THINK THIS IS SOME SORT OF GAME?!" he screamed as I was cut down with a coup de grace. My second spawn I decided to find my shelter near the coastline. Nothing remained but the slowly decaying embers of my campfire.

review: This game was amazing at first. I have had this game for a long time and really enjoyed it that's until I kept getting errors when trying to get past the EasyAntiCheat they use. Everytime I would press "play game" I would keep getting the same error 30005 1275 . They had a link on how to fix it but it doesn't work. I even tried looking up videos on youtube on how to try to fix the "glitch" but I got no luck. This game needs to relook at it's anticheat system and decide if it is worth having EasyAntiCheat. Don't take me wrong I honestly love this game and have over 200 hours of play time but this review is for the people who have the same problems as I have with EasyAntiCheat. After everything I tried resetting shutting down deleting and reinstalling the game and everything I can no longer play it because EasyAntiCheat doesn't let me get thru the starting loading bar.

review: Ar first this game can be overwhelming most gamers seek to survive and keep moving foward but don't think twice about what Rust is all about. Rust is about scavaging hard for what you need protecting yourself building a roof over your head and making life as easy as Rust will allow you to. The goal making the gamers end feeling be satisfaction they want you to feel imersered into the game but at the same time they want you to be relaxed and enjoy yourself. You're probably wondering how can a game where naked people beat you with rocks be relaxing??? Well it boils down to this all the effort you put into surving at the end of the day you get what you put in. A hard days work leaves you around a crackling fire listening to the wind blowing against the trees and shuffling leaves and listening to a crickets melody. This is what Rust is about Die Retry and be Satisfied is what will make you have the best experices you could ever imagine that no other game can give you. Highly recommend Rust to anyone who is willing to explore new oppurtunities.

review: What's great about this game is that it allows me to be creative with building and pvp survival strategy. Resource gathering can get to be a bit of a grind. However if resources were more abundant fighting may not be as adrenaline inducing. My house may last a day it may last a week who knows. It depends what server I m on where I built my house how I built my house and how I ve treated other players around my house. It's up to you to determine what type of player you become. There are endless servers and it takes time to find one that works for you. If you re new and you plan on starting off solo try starting off on a small server with 0 5 population and learn the basics of the game. When you get bored with that join a larger server to get used to the face to face combat and other player interactions. Killed too many times and you re frustrated? Try teaming up with someone on a mid sized vanilla server. Your friend betrayed you and stole your s***? Join a battlefield type server for some instant shootouts. Tired of that? Join the Battle Royale server for some hunger games style action. The game is what you make of it.

review: The concept of this game is great and fun until you're killed by a 11 year old or a hacker. You have two choices either play with a ton of people then get killed once every hour and loose everything or play with low number of people and see no one and nothing to do. Soloing the game is pointless you cannot survive alone you will be raided and killed everytime. In closing the concept of the game itself is cool but actual playability in a setting with 100 other people it's not realistic for soloing or having a good time actually advancing when all you do is die and lose everything. Just comes down to who has the best weapons and can kill off everyone putting them at a disadvantage while having no chance until a server wipe. It's more of an fps than survival.

Max geared players going around killing fresh spawns really prevent my friends and I from getting back into the game.If you have a group of friends and don't mind getting crushed by bigger groups go ahead and give it a shot. It's not that bad of a game.

review: I've never got around to reviewing this game but i feel i need to.It really is fantastic. Definitely has some of the most caring developers of anything ive played. They truly listen to the community and experiment wisely without breaking the foundation of what Rust is at heart. Solid Updates WEEKLY. Check out their reddit if you're curious.Its a hard core pvp survival not for the faint of heart. You will get murked. Rust is merciless. But if you persevere through the t it will be totally worth the challenge.They say you can't play solo but I do quite often successfully. You just need to play on a solo or solo/duo/trio community server. Speaking of the community as a whole IS quite toxic but that doesnt mean everyone is. I've met plenty of good people in game. The game's depth comes with the experiences you encounter with other players as well as the building aspect. Building is definitely my favorite part and theyre starting to add more cosmetic items like carpets and chairs ect.Farm&gt Build&gt Loot&gt Upgrade&gt Roam. Not really in that order specifically but this is what you do in Rust. Sounds basic but it always tend to keep people interested week after week. You dont necessarilyTBC but is that all needed to understand this is real. good game. buy buy

review: I wish steam had a 0/10 system. This is a good game but in its currennt form is essentially one mass player vs. player griefing spree with long stetches of rez grinding for the interim. Either you are the griefed or the griefer. There is no exception and if you attempt to be kindly expect constant griefing. Wait for the official release where maybe people don't gun down fresh spawns with an M4 for target practice.If you disagree watch the Rust youtube series by BruceWillakers (note there are expletives so if you are a 7 year old reading this please don't expand your vocabulary in fact stop playing this game before you expand your vocabulary.) He plays as a greifer and a sadistic one at that. I will recommend this game when a kinder sort of community takes over.EDIT 2015 The game is now much more playable and the griefers are somwhat less evil (I actually had a raider leave my sleeper alive AND leave a few items for me to get started up again.) So though it is still a grief spree it is somewhat less violent in New Rust. Note Play on servers with 5 or more times rez for a more enjoyable less lumberjack simulator experience.UPDATE 2018 The community is back to a bunch of KOS grinders with no desire to interact with others but it's not as much of an issue as it is really easy to get set up nowadays. Even if you never get to endgame you can have a mess about pretty easily. Youl probably die half a dozen times but it'll be okay.

review: THIS GAME IS NOT FOR CASUAL PLAYERS Used to love spending countless hours on this game enjoyed it with a passion. But now the game has taken a turn down a different path. Its honestly too hard to compete now. The massive clans flood the servers and honestly people have gotten too good at the game. Too keep up with the server you have to 4+ hours grinding and thats if you don't get killed collecting resources. If your planning on playing on a public server with less than 8 people your screwed. Clans with 25 people can have 4 people online at almost all hours collecting resources. You can't compete with that. They outnumber and overwhelm anyone taking them on in a fight and it become almost impossible to compete with them as an average player. Now let me make this clear THIS GAME IS NOT FOR CASUAL PLAYERS. You have to devote hours to this game. If your very competitive and willing to spend countless hours gathering resources only to be killed by 5 players with AK's with you trying to defend yourself with a bow then this game is for you. Other than that do not get this game until it changes.

review: A lot of reviews here complain about the community. A lot of reviews complain about the "current state" of the game. The fact of the matter is even if its been this way for a while the game is in Early Access. There are almost always weekly patches that add new content revert unwanted content and sometimes drastically alter the core gameplay. This is both the best and worst part about Rust. Being excited to try something new every couple weeks keeps players from getting too bored and even when they do they'll generally revisit. Salty players tend to leave bad reviews because they are dissatisfied with the game "today" and don't give it a fair enough assessment considering all of its high points. This game is absolutely not for everyone and if you don't enjoy a challenge or can't accept loss and defeat then move on. This is a survival game and surviving isn't handed to you on a platter at all.The game is rough around the edges but slowly coming into its own. It has been the most fun game I've ever played the most awful game I've ever played and the most frightening game I've ever played. Nothing is as heart pounding as spending a week gathering loot and fortifying your base to have some guys all geared up knocking on your front door with rocket launchers in hand. Making a run to a monument finding a rifle for the first time and trying to survive the run home. Filling your inventory with wood to build a giant base just to get wrecked by a homicidal helicopter and losing it all. The feeling of persisting through all of the terrible things that can happen to you in Rust shooting down and raiding your enemies and coming out on top is one of the most gratifying feelings a video game can give to you... especially since this is online and hundreds of others are playing alongside or against you. You can revel in your accomplishments and know that if you run outside get into a firefight with a group of dudes and die you can re spawn back at home and brush it off with plenty more gear to keep trucking. Not to mention the insatiable gratification that comes from revenge after destroying what your enemies worked for... just like what they did to you days ago.You will like this game. Not immediately maybe not even after a week... but its worth the learning curve.

review: I got this game because I've seen it around for a while now and wanted something I could play with my friends that has better graphics than something like minecraft. I watched some youtube videos on it that showed the "leveling up" process how basic gear leads to better and better stuff etc.But there was no mention of how inaccessible mid to late game is to newcomers. I spent 13 hours on this game and I have absolutely nothing to show for it. As soon as you get away from the starting area and move inland you're immediately shot by someone with full body armor and assault rifles (while I'm naked and have maybe crafted basic tools at this point)There's simply no fun in this game. You run around crouch and hide in bushes while trying to gather supplies completely paranoid that you might get killed by fully geared players who have nothing better to do.I assume this is a major reason for the biweekly server wipes since without this the players who are already fully advanced will simply shut down anyone who didnt start playing this game early on.Aside from the massive amount of bugs (e.g. animals run in small circles until hunted then escape clipping through stones and buildings this game has been out for almost 3 years?) there's no worse feeling than finally starting to build your fort and being killed and looted before you have your 4 walls up. I think the problem is not just a toxic community but also that the goal of Rust changes from a potentially great Minecrafty survival/crafting game to a mediocre onesided FPS.I've never written a review before but with these 13 hours of utter frustration I can't recommend this game in its current state and will not be playing it anymore.

review: First of all we need to remember that is the alpha version so its natural for it to have bugs/glitches etc. or any missing content. However the concept of the game is very promising and I really want to see it developed as a masterpiece.Even now its a pretty good game but a little boring after a few days when you have everything. I've now played more than 60 hours built many houses and bases I had so much fun with some friends loot and base raiding and here is my opinion Its worth buying but its still 50% completed in my opinion so consider that when you are playing.Hackers are the most annoying problem of the game right now and ruining this beautiful game. Other that that the game itself is very fun to play especially with friends.I also have some recomendations A purpose more than just surviving (game is a little dull right now and there is not much thing to do) An in game map ! (I learned the map by walkin around and from the wiki but not everyone is good at finding destination) *Not putting a map actually a good thing in a survival game because navigation skills can save your life in real life. Noob protection (30 mins after first entered the server or sth. like that but only for the first time) Better defence tools (more than some doors maybe a high quality metal door or traps etc.) More animals (Horse or donkey for transport Cow and bulls for meat) New enemies (mutants npc bandits in the wild or in the loot areas etc.) Caves or A big ruined city (for ultimate loot area or for rare materials) Time ! (its not very important but its good to have an in game watch) High quality metal safe (an absolute container for player to save at least some important tools from raiding like 9 slots) More guns (some people are against snipers but i think it will be very fun to have at least a bolt action rifle with a scope) Random events such as airdrops. Maybe a smuggler npc appears in random areas at random times selling rare blackmarket items for some bottle of waters. (if snipers added they can be obtained only by smugglers by chance nd that may prevent the sniper terror in the servers) Infection and cure (mutants or zombies infect players and they gain some abilities like less damaga from radiation but fast drop in the food level and some antidotes for it found in the loot areas) Better server list (server names are not displaying fully)I hope this helped both the developers and the future players who is thinking about buying the game.EDIT FROM 2018...I can say that most of the stuff I wrote here added to the game and I'm kind of proud what I wrote here 4 years ago! This game has changed too much in a good way and getting even better each day...Keep up the good work guys!

review: There is a too long didn't read version at the bottom. Some of what I say will be wrong due to modded servers. Those servers will help if you don't like the real challenge this game is or if you just want to play casually. I've never posted a review before so here it goes... Essentially this game is really intriguing a huge sandbox with a pretty decent pvp(combat) system and has a good feel when it comes to building structures once you get the hang of it. However without doing research they (hid) the fact that there are mandatory server wipes. Meaning everything you worked for and did is gone and for people like myself and my friends you are left with disappointment and a severe feeling of wasting your time. I will say I enjoyed the 27 hours I've put into the game my friends (between all of them 60 hours recorded) and I put all of the time and patience smacking walls and building up and up and up. I'm not joking when I say you couldn't see the top of our tower from the ground with the highest graphics settings and furthest distance set. Over 60 hours between us of building up making checkpoints smacking walls to upgrade them (at least 30 or 40 floors had all lvl 6 walls the highest lvl you can get at the moment) and lets not forget all of the defending from people that tried to raid us. So once again I will not lie to you I had a lot of fun in the time I played this game. But jumping on just to find out that everything you worked for no longer exists and you don't even have screen shots or any proof it becomes one of this gamers saddest moments in gaming. I am obvioiusly biased to why I am not recommending this game so I will say to everyone that may read this In my honest opinion you should wait to purchase this game until it has been completed and all the kinks worked out. Possibly by that point these mandatory wipes would only be on huge servers and if you just wanted to hang out with your friends and do crazy you could have smaller servers that don't wipe. Or perhaps even a LAN/single player setting to fufill peoples true sandbox needs (i.e. God complex). (As a side note for the buyers only trust a few from my experience there are a lot of people that will kill you without hesitation.) Now to explain Rust's positive points They are updating a lot and making great progress on the game. Crafting items harvesting and upgrading walls all take a good amount of time. But it could all be taken away if you don't watch your back or defend properly. As I said before the pvp is well managed and overall pretty realistic shoot someone with a bow in the right place and they may bleed out after one maybe two shots. There is the application of realism through hypotherma starving dehydrating and animals that will persue you. Since it is still in early access I assume they will work out the kinks of the unrealistic aspects and further implement more realistic survival features. The building in this game at first was a little complicated but given time by trial and error it can be quickly mastered. Basically double checking that your walls and floors are connected because if they are not whatever you are building will not be geometrically flawless. And nobody wants a building with gaps and unpreportioned sides. To wrap it up mandatory wipes of the servers ruined this game for me because I didn't know they existed. The pvp combat and building mechanics are well done for this game to not even be completed yet. But for people like myself if everything you work for in a game just disappears there is very little reason for me to play it. And as for people that this does not bother go ahead and get this game because it is fun to play. Though you may want to wait for them to be closer to completion or entirely done making the game. Sadly at this time I cannot recommend it. But I have a feeling they will fix most if not all the issues later. I sincerely hope this biased review actually helps people with their decision of whether to buy this game or not. Tl DR The combat and building mechanics are cool and I had fun playing this game. Built a enormous tower just to find out that the server wiped all the data. Feeling like I wasted time even though I enjoyed playing it. Purchase the game and find a server that doesn't wipe deal with wipes wait to purchase until they are done with the game or just don't buy it at all. Hope this helps and thanks for reading.

review: I personally love this game. I spend a lot of money each month to pay for a rust server. There are a ton of fair criticisms of the legacy version of this game. I find myself criticizing it all the time. But the weaknesses do not change how simply fun the game is to play and how amazing the concept is. While there are a TON of problems that irritate me to no end the game is incredibly unique and I continue to play it despite rage quitting a few times in the beginning. Once you get decent at the game it's incredibly fun. If you decide to play I strongly recommend looking for servers that have good 3rd party anti hack plugins installed. Cheatpunch does not really work anymore and the VAC banning system is totally unreliable and does not get people banned until months after they destroyed your base took all your stuff or spawn killed you repeatedly. If you're not into vanilla and would prefer to play on a gnarly arena/battle server I have some good recommendations for that as well but you will definitely find more hackers on most of those servers. I personally play on the arena servers for combat practice and my vanilla server for regular fun. The resource gathering risk of being raided and tedium of vanilla Rust are part of what makes the game so intense. The survival gathering building fighting and raiding concepts are all best experienced in combinatoin with one another which is why I prefer vanilla servers. However if you're just starting out I strongly recommend the following 1) get on a vanilla server to figure out how the mechanics work including survival gathering building etc. 2) get on a PVP server (where you spawn with guns) shortly thereafter to practice combat for a week or two so you can learn to use the guns in an environment where death doesn't cost you anything. 3) get back on a vanilla server to put those skills to use. If you only play on a vanilla server you won't get into enough serious fights to get very good at fighting. When you get in a fight on a vanilla server your heart will start pounding and it will be more intense than you'd feel in most other games because you are at risk of losing all of the stuff on your body and possibly the stuff in your base. If you go into this situation without any combat practice your own biological instincts will most likely screw you. But you can't get any real combat experience on a vanilla server because you will be so focused on escaping with your resources intact. Unfortunately running away is often not effective on vanilla servers if you are dealing with a skilled experienced player who will know how to easily dispatch an enemy who is running away. And if you get into fights on vanilla to try to get practice (starting with no experience) you have a very high risk of losing your weapons. If you lose all your weapons you won't be able to practice and progress. So it's much more practical to do all your practicing on a dedicated PVP server where there are no stakes and you get a gun every time you spawn. This way you can run straight into battle and shoot anyone you want with very little risk involved. Arena rust servers are basically like any other online first person shooter. Since Rust uses the unity engine it will feel quite a lot like Counter Strike or Team Fortress 2. Still it's got unique characteristics so you must practice Rust combat individually. When you hop on a PVP server just go wild and you'll end up teaching yourself how to survive and how to kill. I recommend looking up videos on youtube that describe some Rust combat techniques. I won't explain them in here but they can be very useful. There are a ton of non combat techniques used by tons of rust players as well so go practice and educate yourselves before committing a ton of time to gathering resources building and raiding. Make sure to build your base in a well hidden spot... because in your tenure with Rust you WILL get raided at least once if your base is visible and probably even if it's not visible. If you're on my server though you can't build fully inside rocks. You can build under rocks but no glitching inside rocks to throw down sleeping bags. If you do this you'll be automatically detected and banned on many good servers! Thx! )

review: My concise review The Good Game mechanics are polished compared to other survival games. Hitting trees rocks is smooth. Running/walking is as you'd expect it. Shooting/body hitboxes are OK (could be a bit better). A lot of in game numbers are pretty well tweaked (how much wood/stone to make a safe house etc.) Large amount of people play meaning good variation in servers. Developers are good about responding to the community.The Bad No PvE element. Game is purely PvP. This means everything is optimized for PvP did you want to make a nice wooden hut that overlooks the landscape? Too bad you better make a honeycombed base made strictly out of stone unless you want to get raided immediately. Community is The game could be so fun if people cooperated yet there is an endless cycle of KOS (killing on sight) even if you are naked. Don't expect to productively cooperate with any group of people you don't know in real life.My advice is to get it because I think the developers are focusing on the right issues and a lot of what I listed in "The Bad" will hopefully get fixed over time.
title: Rust

review: So Point 1 Devs update this game nearly every week. Updates are consistent bug fixes and/or new content. Good start.Point 2 Crafting system is really in depth. Quite unlike other survival games in which you simply happen to find guns in this you can instead craft them which is rather helpful. And point 3 Most servers have a different map. This means not as much camping occurs at loot spots (at least in my experience with the game). So say goodbye to the annoying bandits you've come to know from DayZ and such like that camp all the loot locations. Sure you'll still find some but not as many.My one criticism of the game?I feel like this game should have craftable vehicles like little buggies or dirt bikes. Other than that? Pretty damn good. 9/10

Aimbots clipping cheats to insta destroy walls and doors in other people's houses etc..In summary If it ever gets out of ALPHA and EARLY access stage and lots more content is added then maybe it will stop being a rip off.

review: I judge early access games based on the attitude of the developers as this is less likely to change than core features. Here is what you can expect from Facepunch this is from the project lead quoted from the latest patch notes "You know how you re all ing about optimization? When are we gonna optimize the game? I wish the game was optimized. You should take a week off and optimize the game. Well that s what we ve been doing so don t and moan that you don t have anything new to play with."You are going to be punished for criticizing this game. Stop hiding behind 'Early Access'. Negative feedback is the most beneficial. So if a huge majority of your customers are saying this game runs poorly don't berate them take it as valuable feedback and fix the problem.The game itself can be a lot of fun but those moments where it shines are due to player interaction and the developers credit themselves far too much. Create a sandbox throw players in with very little limitations and suddenly you are an innovative genius? There is no discernible end goal here half implemented features create the illusion of a full experience but isolated from each other each mechanic is clearly feeble. Survival aspects are non existent (I will pay you if you can manage to starve to death in this game). Building/crafting features are a fraction of what is offered from similar titles. Gunplay needs a lot of work. To top it all off your playtime is completely redundant because you *will* be cheated by script kiddies.Let's not forget the intention of Early Access is stable full release (no homo). There is no indication that Rust will ever meet that milestone and as time progresses there are more and more indications that it will not. Which is a shame because like many Early Access titles "this game has so much potential".

review: Rust is pretty damn great as a game on its own hands down. The only downside? Unless you join a clan you're pretty much gonna get screwed over and over again by other clans farm all day and night only to get raided and lose everything. This cycle repeats until you join or form a clan yourself and work your off TOGETHER to prevent the aforementioned cycle from happening again. Rust demands a LOT of time a lot of dedication and above all a lot of team work. If you give it all of these three then it is definitely the best survival/open world FPS game in existence today. If you're planning to play solo then you're better off not buying it though.
