review: Very rough around the edges More recent patches and community behaviour almost insists for the best experience play with friends. Playing solo would make anyone quit in under 10 hours on some of the heavily populated servers.. But a good group will keep you coming back again and again and again.Being early access and weekly updates/changes going on it's always worthwhile to keep on top of glitches/bugs people may try and abuse to screw you over so you can accomodate to counter it.New game modes seem to be making their way in to being officially supported too (H1Z1 style Battle royale + Deathmatch servers). Developers embracing this kind of community is always a good thing and adds extra hours of fun. Post release review update While it can be fun Can't really recommend playing more than the weekend after a fresh reset with the game in it's current meta (And unless you get lucky Don't expect to play with much above bows/single fire weapons without hours of grinding)... massive groups form together and dominate a server making any lasting time you put into farming/building meaningless.

review: My Review on Rust Solo play I've played solo on rust many times on many different official and modded servers.. Personaly being average at first person shooters i have to say that this is hard for me but rewarding in it's difficulty. Tons of people are constantly looking to recruit and group so finding friends shouldn't be hard however.... IT IS RUST... U WILL BE SHOT NAKED A COUPLE TIMES..Group Play This is where all the fun is... You are less likely to die in a group of 3 or more as you have different angles of coverage when fighting enemies or raiding resources.Personaly sometimes it feels as tho people are not playing fairly when 1 guy runs up and kills your group with an AK. I don't understand how people can just hold down the trigger on an AK and not hit the clouds like i do when i hold down the trigger.... Guess it's practice or aim bots or whatever.Previously i would have given this game an 8/10 for overall combat and content. However since the release of Boats and water travel... This game has been bumped in my mind from an 8/10 to a 9/10...Combat 9/10 (Apart from AK wielding A holes who pray and spray your whole party for headshots it's good)Adventure 10/10 (With the new Boats and water travel system you can legit go wherever u want)Resource grind 10/10 (It's not hard or boring as your constantly on the lookout and resources are everywhere)Building 10/10 (One of the only games out there where you can build where you want and what you want)Player to Player interactions 8/10 (There are going to be a holes in every game. But every now and again you meet cool people)+1 for the introduction to safe Trading system

In the distance i see the frozen peaks of mountains and lake.I turn around and notice i have a rock I grasp my rock firmly and run through the snow my flopping madly in the wind. I come aross another naked man laying in the snow he looks so peaceful I think he is dead at first but then notice he is just asleep. I steal a bow and 15 arrows off of him and a stone hatchet plus a stone spear and some wood......I stand there watching him sleep peacefully for a moment then i bash his head in with my rock. I get animal fat from him some bone fragments a skull and 2 hunks of meat I go and wack a tree with my newly found hachet and build a fire I cook his meat and consume it. I wake back up to see a man with a rifle standing over me he speaks to me and tells me to drop all of my gear and back away as he is going through my stuff he notices my human skull and asks me if i like to eat people i told him i have never eaten anyone.... he continues to go through my gear i decide to make a run for it i get about 30 feet away and a shot rings out bt the round misses me.... he is chasing me now singing toy stories "you got a friend in me" song i run over a hill and start to run across a valley and another shot rings out and all goes black........I wake up in a field naked with another rock.10/10 would get chased by man singing disney songs again.

review: Summary Enjoyable game if playing with friends that REQUIRES lots of time to really enjoyPositives If you have the time to invest in gathering resources building bases starting over after setbacks and deaths then RUST is a very rewarding fun game. To go from a naked who cannot defend himself against anything or anyone to a raider who wields immense power and control makes for a very captivating game.Negatives You need hours and hours of grinding away to get the resources to start becoming successful and self sufficient in this game. However you will die very often due to the fact that all humans are resources in this game to other players and are harvested as such. If you do not have the ability to start over from scratch almost effectively undoing hours of work then you will not enjoy this game.

review: Have you played Minecraft? (your answer better be yes) If so then you'll feel right at home in this game. It's basically the same except the graphics aren't blocky and 8 bit looking. You start out with a rock(weapon) 3 bandages and a torch. From your fresh spawn you go and collect materials some to build structures some to craft clothing other to craft weapons and usuable items. Now this isn't exactly like Minecraft the house or base building is alot more satisfying in my opinion. You start with foundation then pillars then walls ceilings doors crates to hold your items etc. You also need to defend yourself and your home from other players. Think smart when designing your home make false rooms traps and so forth to prevent other players from getting to your goodies. At this point the game is still in Alpha so there are alot of changes being made. Some things might stay other will be taken out. I haven't really come across any bugs or glitches yet but everyones time playing is different. Rust is an amazing game a very addictive game the day I bought it I played for 8 hours straight. I continued over the next few days learning how everything works. Your first spawn will be quite tough if you have no idea what your doing but keep at it and in no time you will be enjoying it!

review: Even though this game is in very early alpha it rocks. It has been a while since I have played a game that I was excited to get home and load up. All I see in this games future is awesomeness! If you are looking for a completed game that you can just load up and play then you need to wait a few months maybe a year because this game is buggy quirky what ever you want to call it but I like the idea of being able to somewhat "test" this game. It is good to have the community of folks who are going to be playing this to have a bit of say about how this game should or at least how they would like to see it progress. Two Thumbs up Facepunch and Garry keep up the awesome work and please don't forget your fans/customers. Unfortunatley some of the big names (Ubisoft *aka* Ubisucks EA Capcom etc...) have lost most to all of their customer support and myself and many of my fellow gamers have lost all love for these and many other Dev/Publishers because they seem to enjoy ignoring their customers. Keep up the great work! Looking forward to the next updates. Cheers!

review: Great idea I watched lots of videos before purchasing and it looked awesome and then I played it. When this game says it's in Alpha beta I must say that's an understatement. The "no pvp" servers don' exist so if that's your thing wait for it to get fixed. It's true that you can't be killed while you're awake that is however it isn't considered pvp to beat your door down while you're out or even standing in your house and steal everything you own. People literally wait outside of houses for others to log off so they can break in and destroy everything you have and "kill" you on a "no pvp no sleepers" server. My experience in this game was frustrating and I quickly got the feeling I was playing with a juvenile community. The profanity was horrible and with no filter I ended up just filtering it all (there's an option to shut off chat). For Beta this was my first experience where you can't report anything while in game and their website didn't seem any better for responding. So if being swore at endlessly chased acrossed the map by a horde of people with guns and starting a game from scratch every day is your thing then this just may be for you ) So to sum it up the idea fantastic this game terrible. Don't be fooled the ones who love it are the ones who want to kill you and steal your gear. There are no friends in Rust only enemies... eventually.

review: This game may be rough around the edges at this point in time but for $19.99 I believe you can definitely get your money's worth. The best part of it is it's not even out of Alpha yet. There's plenty of bugs in this game (laser sights not aiming where they should players being almost blinded by darkness and blackholes ripping the sky asunder etc.) but if you like survival (DayZ) building (Minecraft) and have a willingness to help fellow survivors. Then this will quickly become one of your favorite games. If you're afraid the Developers won't finish the game don't Facepunch Studios are a devoted group of people who love games as we do. Protip I suggest finding a community server with insta craft and PVE to get yourself started and once you have a better understanding of the game go to a PVP server

review: This is a game with the highest highs and the lowest lows. You WILL start out low you WILL get frustrated. Stick it through and you will find one of the most addictive and deep games out there.At the advanced stage you will find yourself locked into territorial wars with your neighbors negotiating alliances and tuce's breaking bonds and sneaking around leveling the bases of your enemikes. In other words at high level this game can be Game of Thrones.Take note that the official serrvers are NOT your only option. If you want to play solo go find a solo/duo/trio server lest you be killed over and over by zergs. Noobs may want to find a "noob friendly" server where you are less likely toi face toxic people and other players will teach you and help you out. Don't start out on a hardcore top end server face to face with all the twitch streamers and then get upset because you couldn't compete!Anyways I've put hundreds of hours in this game that should speak for itself.

review: Not worth the money at this point full of hackers not much content and the game is overrun with hackers cheaters and power abusing administrators. If your not one of these three types of player then you're entire point in the game is to give those players someone to annoy grief and taunt (via a voice chat that you can't disable) you constantly. Even the players that don't cheat grief or taunt you will still kill you partly because the community around Rust is just that bad but mostly because the game REQUIRES it of them. They cannot trust other players ever and have no way of knowning if you are really a new naked player or if you're carrying an invisible shotgun. I did manage to have a great time playing this game with my friends on an otherwise empty server but that server went down and all of our progress was lost so we decided to try a populated server only to find that it was a completely pointless thing to do. There is no place on a server with more than 10 people where you will be left alone long enough to gather the materials needed to make even a basic house... and even if you somehow DO manage to build yourself a little castle with a stout metal door it won't last the night because "bandits" wait for you to log of so that they can go to your base blow it up with C4 murder you in your sleep take all of your stuff then destroy your ability to respawn. Yes that is right the griefers can grief you even when you're not playing!!PVE servers are not the answer either because they do not protect you from "raiders" (e.g. 12 year olds who have figured out how to dupe C4) that will blow up your house and steal all of your stuff. If you enjoy bashing yourself in the face with a hammer you'll love Rust... otherwise stay away.

review: The words alpha beta early access do not make this game any less of a game that should be reviewed AS IT IS. If you are to pay $20 for this product you must understand that you are playing this with a guarantee that this is an unfinished product and that more things will be added in the future. With that in mind I would NOT recommend this game until it is further updated. The skeleton of the game is fun. As an online MMO gameplay fidelity suffers from the mechanic's lack the polish and shine. It is great when it works. It's irritating when it doesn't. This is a game where survival and hording are necessary to stay alive from the most dangerous enemies human players. Many previews/reviews of this game say that it is a mix between Minecraft and DayZ. Having played Minecraft and not DayZ I can make certain assumptions about this game.First of all do not be fooled this game is only similar to Minecraft in the fact that it has survival in the description. You can craft items weapons and shelters. You do have (AT THE CURRENT STATE OF THE GAME) the ability to be creative with what structures you build but you're still limited by what you can make. In other words most human made structures are like the building's that you can see in the above screenshots. This does not mean that you can create things like pistons switches keys for doors ect. You have walls ceilings windows and door (ONE DOOR ONE PLAYER!). Then you can build 2 types of storage boxes workbench furnace survival equipment ect. You also do not have the ability to coordinate locations as there arent any compasses or maps. Placing a sleeping bag within your base is the only way to spawn in a desired location. The best (non base) strategy to coordinate locations with friends is to use already existing structures as permanent points of reference. Aside fromFun factors will be dependent upon gameplay strategies. If you are the type whom likes to play lone wolf good luck. Most parties of players run together and too often will shoot those who look well equiped. Small human structures are easily broken into and large structures are generally sought out for breaking into. The strategy for avoiding player intrusion is to build small metal and remote. Getting anywhere takes forever so nesting close to the road (main area where players roam and where structures are) is ideal. Most raw materials do not spawn too far away from the roaded area this forces players to bottleneck into a third of the map and does not take advantage of the massive range of places in the game. The true fun will be derived from player interactions not from actual gameplay mechanics. Player gameplay will range from mugging robbing assisting and murdering. THIS IS WHY PEOPLE SHOULD BUY THIS GAME. Experiences in this game are going to be relative to how you play when you play and who you play with. I recommend that you play this game with friends and only with friends. This is a crude review and does not cover all specific aspects of the game. I have had much fun with this game but given the lack of permanence and things to do I have lost much of my interest in it.
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: I tried out rust on a few practice servers before joining a community one and really trying. The chances are that every now and then your first spawn will be next to a zombie. My friend spawned for the first time next to three rocks one wood pile and a zombie couldn't fight off the zombie and died instantly. Just today before I could even see I spawned next to the stronger type of zombie and died before I could move.However! Don't let this put you off as on your third spawn or so things are looking up! My first two days have just been completed today (45 minute days and 15 minutes night times in case you were curious) and on my first night I spawned in near pitch black. My recommendation if this happens is to go as close to the nearest small shack as possible you can sometimes even stay warm. Once it was morning I was able to get enough wood to make my own tiny wooden shack pretty close to supply spawn points. The best thing to do in this game is make friends. Without friends you will die. A very helpful player called Hypno was helping myself and another (presumably) noob. We were even given supplies and a place to sleep for the night. Don't be afraid to ask for help sometimes you can get some awesome stuff.For an Alpha game this is really well developed and it's very realistic and generally awesome. I get a lot of lag on my computer but other than that I highly recommend Rust! I've already gotten many friends to download it too!Be warned that as of now you can't connect to a server from Mac but you can get Bootcamp for Mac and run Windows on Mac which is what I have done to play Rust.Keep up the great work guys!

At least it's better than DayZ.
title: Rust

review: Lust for Rust!I played the original game briefly and then stopped when anti cheat first came in which stopped me using my steam controller. Recently this has been fixed and now im back and I gotta say this is WITHOUT DOUBT the best survival game out there. I've played them all but Rust is sooo polished and good looking. And everything is so smooth and works so nice the simple slick interface is a joy!I am looking at the game through fresh eyes and I would encourage those people with any doubt to try doing that also. I appreciate some players have been with this game for a very long time and may feel somehow cheated by the way it's changed and the decisions made. But those guys need to let it go now. Change is sometimes a hard thing to accept but it's a good thing because this game in my oppinion has never been this fantastic until now! Seriously.. the community is both a credit and a problem for this game. Great that it's so big... but blimey is it toxic in places so please judge with your own eyes and bring a fresh perspective.I love the way they have gone about this game and tried to be a little different. I love the fact that you don't create your character and you are forced to learn to live with what they give you. I love my black guy with a smaller than everage endowment and anybody who tries to make fun will get my mace over their head in the night while they are sleeping!I love the newer art style... a really nice (slightly cartoon) style that allows the game to look both mean and gritty at times and yet still a bit soft. Fantastic job!The sound effects and the little animations for everything... I mean jeez the attention to detail is so high. Some triple A titles don't get worked on this hard!Community around any game is going to be fickle and I think sometimes with this game some people got too used to a good thing and got thoroughly spoilt! Anytime they feel like the game isn't so good they should try playing any of the other survival games... The Forest Conan Exiles Osiris New Dawn 7 Days to die or H1Z1 just survive... which will remind them just how spoilt they are.Don't get me wrong all those games I have mentioned are brilliant games and it would be a little unfair to compare them as they are different. But I can compare them based upon polish and attention to detail and I just don't think they are as good. Rust's sheer imagination and detail can only have been created through real effort time and talent on behalf of the dev team. They obviously are passionate about this game otherwise it just simply wouldn't look so good or play as well as it does.RUST is shining like a diamond and not "rusty" at all. My biggest congratulations to Gary and the devs on this game. With the hateful comments they have received from the disgruntled minority in the past it must have made them feel like giving up on the community at times. I for one am glad they didn't and that Gary has the right attitude to deal with the haters. I can't wait for the game to continue forwards and I will be there every step of the way with my rifle in hand and my face mask pulled firmly down!11/10 !!!!

review: I've been playing quite a bit of Rust recently and am super impressed with what Garry and his team have done. The game is fiarly easy to pick up on you'll die a few times before you get a handle on how to survive. But once you do it you start rolling pretty fast and can get a decent base pretty quick. But be sure to make friends without them holding a base on any PvP server is nigh impossible. If you want to enjoy the game without the prospect of getting gunned down and all your hard work torn to the ground the PvE servers are very enjoyable and have a great community. Also the craftiing system in the game is engaging and builds on itself. In conclusion I would suggest this game to anyone who enjoys Minecraft or DayZ as this game is about as close as you can get to a comination of the two.And the game is still in Alpha so more greatness is to come!

review: I have mixed feelings about Rust. First of all I see and hear a lot of complaints that compare the current version to legacy wherein people complain about the lack of content in the new version. My issue with this complaint is that each and every person who paid for this game saw the trailers for legacy which is still available to play and purchased based on that. Are the mechanics of new rust as good as legacy yet? Yes and no. Take for example the new building system. It has bugs of its own like house pieces spawning with 0 health and staying that way not allowing the player to place an house piece without reason and house pieces breaking upon placement usually pillars and always without reason. That being said it is vastly superior to that of legacy. Other things just frustrate veteran players of Rust like the total inability to raid without exploiting glitches. The graphical map generation and recent UI updates really make the game a lot more fun and less annoying but that being said the map generation needs more variety. I remember actually being able to hide your base in old Rust but that is essentially impossible in the new version. Animal AI is currently buggy as hell RAM use is absurd and there are some things that seem simple that haven't yet been implemented. For example the clothing currently has no affect besides aesthetic changes to the player experience. No protection from radiation heat or bullets is provided. It seems to me that it would be very easy to add a textureless tool that could be used to stop building part health regen allowing raiding. In the same vein as old Rust you only get wolf meat even though bear meat exists in the game in airdrops. My big complaints about new Rust are that it's easy and there's nothing to do. First let's talk about the lack of challenge. Once you have a stone base you're invincible unless one or more very dedicated people comes and finds a glitched wall (which I admit I have done many times) and gathering the materials for a house is easy. There is little gun variety and the AK currently dominates. The bolt action is more or less useless due to the lack of a scope. Anyone with an AK can defend their base for forever. You don't starve anymore. Your hunger ticks down at a snail's pace and you needn't ever worry about it. This is where the "like Minecraft but with FPS graphics" statements that are so often applied to Rust seem to hold the most water. You reach endgame fast and there's very little to do once you do so. And even on the way the things you can do are very limited. There's no need to hunt very limited ability to raid firefights are laggy and uncontrollable and the way Rust works building isn't *fun*. I have hope yet for the future of Rust and am glad that in addition to killing your friends you can now cook and eat them! I hope to see added to the game General bugfixesMore wildlife varietyDeep explorable caves with valuable resourcesMore terrain varietyOptimizationImproved combatMore distinct landmarks with actual strategic importanceThe ability to legitimately raidFarming and miningServerwide eventsChallengeAll in all Rust remains fun in short stints. I have faith but wish the dev team would produce content a touch faster.11/10 best gaem evr

review: This is the most brutal game I have ever played not for the blood and gore but for the feeling of cruelty and sense of loss. For some reason it plays with my morality and natural insticts. I'm not sure how to describe this game It's kinda a (HARDCORE survival) / Basebuilding / crafting / first person shooter / open world map kinda game.Hunting people in this game can be very intense especially if you are poorly armed.shooting feels alright it's just hard enough to make it a challenge decent weapons and attachmets and ammo types(assualt rifles sniper smg shotguns lasers scopes silencers)decent crafting sytems for items and weapons fun building system

With an interesting crafting side and a unique gaming experience when playing with friends making forts or going it alone remaining hidden and low key a definite must try for any Survival Simulation fan. However the downside is I sincerely hope the game improves overall 14.99 is just too much to pay from my experience so far I respect it's still in Early Access though.

review: Rust what can i say about rust. I had never played a survival sandbox type game prior to my purchase of rust. I started playing during the first incarnation or legacy rust. I didn't know any of the mechanics when i jumped in which i believe was why i had such a thrilling experience my first couple weeks. I remember playing one of my first days and had built myself a little wooden shelter. The beggining ones in legacy While sitting by a fire waiting for the daylight to come back some guy decided to sit outside and taunt me with sexual comments. How he was going to come in an stick his member in my behind lol. So i opened my door and shot him in the chest with an arrow. Then i watched his naked little butt wiggle as he ran away with an arrow through his body into the darkness until he was no longer visible. Lol golden moments like these are what make rust worth buying. Sure there are a ton of People who want nothing more then to kill you take your stuff and get under your skin while doing so. Somtimes these people become overbearing and a couple week break from rust is needed. Anything can happen in this game for good or bad.

review: UPDATE One year later and nothing substantial has changed. It's laggy takes forever to connect and has the most toxic griefer community of any game I've ever played. I suspect it will be in alpha for another year or two and maybe by then they will have implemented some meaningful changes that will make it playable for anyone who isn't a hacker or part of a 30+ clan of jackhole dickbags. Until then I would avoid it at all costs. Original Review I wish I could recommend Rust. I really do. The premise is awesome the gameplay and mechanics have a solid foundation and the pedigree of the developer is without question. But the game itself is just unplayable. Lag is constant bandits are everywhere and hackers are omnipresent. Your typical session in Rust will play out like this Spawn beat on stuff with a rock build a shelter get shot by some random . Spawn beat on stuff with a rock get shot by 2 random s. Spawn beat on stuff with a rock build an awesome hidden base get raided by a hacker or a group of 10 random s with more c4 than God. All the while expereinceing persistent lag and stutters that make PVP a game of who lags first at the wrong time. It's just a mess in it's current state and the updates over the past year have been a complete joke. Avoid this until further progress has been made.

review: Rust is a game that you either love or hate. I personally love and hate Rust I love Rust because I enjoy the survival concept of the game and the building your own little or big base feature to keep all your loot safe. I also love the new Team Feature that was recently added to the game it makes it easier to keep track of where your friends have run off to! It also makes combat simpler if you are with a team of friends so you know which person to not shoot at in an intense battle. There are a lot more reasons why I like Rust but I have one reason why I hate it. The one thing I hate about Rust is the community. The community is very toxic and salty and very unfriendly. Now I m not the sort of person who normally gets mad over a game but the other players on this game somehow make you feel so aggressive by either teasing you in chat or talking a load of rubbish after they kill you. But overall I think this game is a good game and if the community wasn t so toxic I would honestly rate it 10 out of 10.But if you can deal with the toxic players then go for it and buy it. You can always get a refund if you don t enjoy the game.

review: The game Rust the review of which is presented in this article was developed by the English company Facepunch Studios. The source was the Source engine. The appearance of the game was influenced by such projects as Stalker and DayZ. The first versions were significantly different from what is in the game today. Only thanks to many improvements and additions to the game there were a lot of opportunities.Background on December 11 2013 the date of the appearance of Rust. You should start the game review from this moment. Initially on Rust no one had high hopes. However after two weeks the number of copies sold sold over one hundred and fifty thousand which indicates a great popularity among gamers. After only a year namely in January 2014 the best selling game was exactly Rust. The review on it at that time could be found on almost all game resources. February of the same year was the moment when the number of sales exceeded one million.The creation of the game was the same studio that developed the famous Garry's Mod. Those who know him know that he is distinguished by a huge variety of game. The game owes an abundance of all modes first of all to the head of the company Facepunch Studios Harry Newman. Thanks to his love of diversity in Rust the review of which is presented in the article there is a huge number of objects with excellent detail. In addition the game is not deprived of regular additions and improvements which bring a lot of innovations in the gameplay. Separation As already mentioned above the developer's studio is very scrupulous about its product which led to the emergence of two projects Rust and Rust Experimental. An overview of this branch is also presented in the article. The division was due to the fact that the company considered the game code as not perfect and soon it was decided to create another parallel project.Soon after the release of the Experimental gaming community shared. After all they were presented with two completely different products having the same name Rust. The review of the game in Russian became even more relevant as many gamers wanted to know the differences. Initially the offshoot was not perceived by players as a full fledged game. Rather it was considered a project for developers to test. Many gamers felt that the creation of a completely new project is pointless. Rust was a good game which needed to get rid of cheaters and improve graphics. However after about two years when Experimental received significant improvements gamers began to treat it much better and many even abandoned the original Rust.DevelopmentOver time the first project completely turned into Rust Legacy. The review of the game continues from the moment when the original Rust almost completely ceased to be updated and was abandoned by many gamers. However I should say a few flattering words about the Rust Legacy. The game has an amazing atmosphere and excellent mechanics. In the meantime Experimental has more beautiful graphics and details of every detail. While reviewing the game Rust we can not help saying that its development and improvement are still occurring. Developers regularly release updates that make improvements to every minor part of the game.Game processSo after considering the main points of the emergence and development of Rust let's move directly to the game process. The main task before the gamer is survival. The game starts with a minimum set of items in the backpack. Other resources will have to be obtained on their own. In order not to die of hunger it is necessary to hunt and to build a dwelling to engage in the extraction of wood. Of course the game is more interesting and fun (and even easier) to play in the company of friends. The group is much easier to fight off enemies and get food. The player will have to constantly struggle with various difficulties hunger radiation attacks of people and animals and so on. At the very beginning of the game the gamer can create only the most necessary items. To obtain new skills to create you have to kill animals and also check chests.SurvivalDuring the day the player has nothing to be afraid of and can freely explore the area and extract resources. In principle this process is very similar to the popular game Minecraft. It's better to wait in a safe place. With the onset of the night zombies are beginning to wander and it is very difficult to obtain any resources. Especially you can see at a distance no more than a meter. However if you find yourself in the dark do not despair. In the inventory there is a torch that will light the way. In the game there are various factors that affect the state of the character. Avoiding radiation and cold is easy enough but it's difficult to fight with hunger. We'll have to hunt and get food all the time. When the critical level of hunger is reached the character will die.Crafting In the game it is presented quite diverse. You can create a lot of different things from items for the home ending with weapons. At the first stages of the game will be quite difficult. However when the player has the most necessary tools an ax a pickax and so on it becomes much easier. Resources in Rust are limited. For example a character can not get more than nine boards from a tree. In general the extraction of a tree often turns into a rather difficult task. Sometimes a player is lucky and he finds himself in the forest more often and sometimes in the desert where there are practically no trees. The stone is much easier to find. It comes across almost everywhere but it takes a pick to extract it. Other resources are less common and additional tools are often needed to extract them. In this case often will have to compete for rare items with other players.

review: This really is a good game despite the often toxic community. It takes a lot of knowledge and a lot of luck to progress in Rust. Knowledge of the best weapons and armor to use which barrels will drop what the best monuments to scour for resources player hotspots to avoid being killed constantly how to solve certain puzzles at monuments and base building techniques to avoid being raided. I played Rust during early access and absolutely hated it. I hated it because hardly anything was explained and I was getting killed a lot. There is certainly a steep learning curve to this game. Luckily there are a lot of YouTube videos online to help you get ahead of the curve. After some time you will get into the flow of things and begin to realize that it's not so bad after all. If you're new there are plenty of low pop servers as well as RP solo and no KOS servers. It often will help to team up with a more experienced player to learn from and the game is overall easier as a team. Rust has a variety of things to do always keeping you busy. It can become very addicting when you start to gain some traction on a new server. Rust does have a very toxic community. Players especially clans with no remorse for your lack of experience young children who insult you and your mother and people who will lie through their teeth to get ahead of you and players who will capture you to turn you into a slave or torture toy. On the other hand the more mature and experienced players I find are typically willing to help and answer any questions you have they want the community to grow. Keep in mind there are glitches from time to time which get abused and can be game breaking but the developers tend to fix them swiftly and also release updated weekly regardless. Overall Rust is a very well polished game with dedicated developers. It takes time to get used to but is fun and enjoyable when you do. I recommend this to anyone who has a large reserve of patience and time or has friends to play with.
title: Rust

review: I started playing this game right when it came out on steam early access and I was instantly addicted. And in all honesty it was one of the most exciting and thrilling multiplayer games I had ever played. Its hard to put it into words just how intense this game got. I was with about 15 20 people all working together to build a base and collect rescources to put toward raiding other clans basses/camps/bunkers/forts. Its impossible to describe how intense it is to go on a night raid with about 10 15 people and raid another clans base while they are IN IT! Back in those days really all you could do was break into someones base with C4. So you would start to blow doors to get in while enemy players would try and sneak out of their base to flank you and people from windows firing at you. And if you did get killed the pure tension of trying to get back to youre dead body to grab youre stuff before one of the baddies picked it up was incredibly intense. And I was completely addicted to playing it back then. Until of course the massive influx of hackers and cheaters started infesting every single server and that was it I was done playing for good or so I thought.Cut to when they started to remake the game from scratch an incredibly bold move in my opinion. Gary stated that Rust was never actually meant to be a survival game at all I think it was some kind of a building program for another game they were working on and some how it just turned into Rust because people were having such a good time playing with it so it became its own game. Which is amazing to me that a game that wasnt even suposed to be a game was one of the best games I had ever played. So when they first came out with the experimental version I decided to give it a try. And I have to say I did not like it much at all and to top it off it ran really bad on the computer I had at the time. So again I vowed to never play it again.Then I think I saw some screenshots and saw a blog post showing some of the improvments to the game so I decided to give it one more chance and I'm happy I did. I think in part to the fact that now they are on the Unity engine and the fact that they are actually trying to make a survival game now has made this game like 10 times better then it was before which comepletely shocked me. And I mean honestly its like playing a completely new game and yes of course it is a new game but they did keep many of the same core mechanics just improved on every single aspect of this game. Like for instance they have completely revamed the building and crafting system (which was confusing at first until you get the basic concept then its easy peasy) which has made a HUGE difference to the game and improved it big time. Not to mention the countless things they have added now aka guns clothes an automated mining station &amp just too many things to name oh ya and forgot to mention ROCKET LAUNCHERS! And to me one of the very best parts is that Gary's team now patches and posts a blog weekly of the items they are working on and a list of the new items that they just added and new items that are a possibility to be added to the game. And I have to say that I am just blown away with this kind of game development. Where they keep you fully in the loop and they really do listen to the community and implement what us fans actually want. Like for instance and this is huge people a Rust game changer for certain. They are adding VEHICLES vehicles that you will be able to put together and configure yourself. Some people might say why add vehicles to this game and my answer is if you have run around these massive maps for litterally hundreds of hours I have to say it does get annoying not being able to have transportation of some sort. They added horses to the game (but currently are un rideable) so I assumed they would be rideable in the future. But then they came out with the vehicles and they do look like they will be pretty useful as you will be able to carry a bunch of rescources on them as well. But let me stress this to anyone interested in this game. Rust is still in Alpha and probably will be for some time. So who knows maybe vehicles wont even make it into the final build. But the point is they are willing to try and push the envelope and see what works and what doesnt. And that will ultimately be decided by what all of us the Rust community. Also regarding the hacker problems which will litterally drive me away from almost any game as I detest cheaters and get a real pleasure from seeing them get banned. Valve has now stepped in and has started banning people left and rigt which makes me as happy as a puppy. I'm sure there is still a hacker problem but it is much less then it used to be. And and this makes me really happy they are working on a server side no clipping tool which is why I always used to log on into my base with nothing broken into but all my chests empty from no clippers. I applaud Gary and his incredible developement team for doing something truly special with Rust. I mean lets be real honest here he could of just sitten back and collected the millions for the original version and laughed all the way to the bank and tbh I was conviced for a while that that is exactly what he was going to do. But I was so wrong and am so happy I was. If you think you migt like Rust but are unsure. I would suggest going to youtube and watching some videos on the game and make sure there recent videos and you might mistake the Legacy version of Rust for the current version which is the amzing one. Also if you are planning to buy the game spend a little time on youtube just to learn the basics of the game cuz once you get them down the game will become a whole lot more fun for you. Sorry this was my first review and if I was too long winded I appologise. But this is one of my favorite games of all time and I had to shed a little light as to why I thought that and still think that about this awesome game. Bottom line is Rust will go down as one of the best games I have ever played and let me tell you I have litterally played hundreds if not thousands of games. Rust 10/10

review: A CONUSTRUCTIVE REVIEW OF RUST IntroRust is a game where hard work pays off and pays off in pure joy.Main reviewRust gives you a progressive game style you start with a rock you collect wood from trees you build your first base. "The small wood shack". You find blueprints you gather scrap to research those blureprints. You kill a guy that has a revolver using the revolver you kill someone that has a semi automatic rifle using the rifle you kill someone with an Ak 47 and so on.Rust requires you to learn their physics their gun recoil. It will take a long time to master but when you are good at it it will reward you tenfolds.RaidingRust makes raiding very exciting and with alot of tension. Counter raiders is a big part of the raiding in rust Protecting your raid from nearby players is almost half the raid.TipsNever trust anyone.

review: Product received for free. Rust is a brutally difficult survival game set on a randomly generated island. This game slams you into the action right off the bat. Showing you your various meters and making you learn what is and isn't lethal the hard way. This is a very good thing. Games should not hold your hand.I know this game has a bad reputation with a lot of people and I understand this. But this game attracts a certain kind of person. It attracts one willing to dedicate time and effort into building up and surviving in the harsh climate one will find himself in. Many people are put off by this but I think everyone should try this game. The good Game looks fantastic. Wonderful gunplay Cool monuments. (In game locations) Amazing base building. Cool looking armors and weapons. Survival mechanics are wonderful. Resources are scarce making raids an appealing option.The bad The community. People KOS far too often and the general toxicity of the community can be off putting. Some guns are a tad overpowered. The AK is a bit ridiculous. The LR300 is useless. Decay. I understand the importance of decay but it is really annoying. And that concludes my review of Rust. I suggest you give it a shot!
title: Rust

This game is worth the money (again) and looks like it's got some promise. Good job Garry.

review: Definitely worths the money!Surviving building my base and defending it with the most varied and amazing possibilities gave me tons of fun even at alpha version and it's very addictive. It's also constantly improving and i'm happy that i bought it. Besides the price which is pretty amazing.But there are also clear problems to keep in mind for this game.The biggest con are the servers! (I can't stress it enough!)...Laaaaaaaag....There are too many severs (imo should be only one with big player capacity and a bigger world). Now they are almost always full and lagged with a player capacity of only 200 and with a amazingly huge lag for the servers far from your location forcing you to play only with players near you. If they fix this server system i will come back to play.Also the worst kind of people in the universe gather here to play...Never saw in a game a community (if i can call them like that) so focused into keeping away new players.And of course the wipes. Every month a goddamn wipe that erases all your hard work!But... in general it's a very good game wich already can give you fun has lots of possibilities and for this price...worths the try!8/10

review: You can't determine the worth of this game in a short amount of time. You're going to get wrecked at first but that's normal. The learning curve in this game is huge even players with as much time as myself and beyond are still learning new strategies better base formats and overall how to deal with other players.All these guys with low hours writing bad reviews gave up after they made mistakes. This game is completely unforgiving the community isn't actually as bad as most people think the gameplay forces people to distrust each other. ing people over is goal #1 in this game. This isn't minecraft this isn't farmville this is RUST.Prepare to have your handed to you by a large group (because you were stupid enough to build near them. they don't want you taking the areas resources) prepare to suddenly find Jesus as you're loading in (hoping you haven't been raided) prepare to have your heart beat out of your chest during shootouts (you've got important resources on you) but mostly prepare to be killed by bears...( ing BEARS man...)Try to stay positive and be eager to learn. Read the Rust Wiki and look for guides on youtube. They can be incredibly helpful. Remember this game is still in Alpha too so not every aspect of the game is perfect.I absolutely love this game. Prepare to spend all your time playing (it's so ing addicting).

review: Rust at this point has just become a piece of stale dessert. It was the most delicious thing you tasted so much so that you wanted to save it so you kept it and slowly ate away at it. At some point however the food became stale. You taste it again only to find out that the texture and taste that it once had has vanished and been replaced by a taste of decay and a texture comparable to liver. You leave it but eventually your cravings get ahold of you again and being too lazy to go out to the supermarket you guiltily grip the addictive treat and give it another taste. You are surprised. Not because it is good or bad but has rather just lost all texture and taste it used to have. It is neither good nor bad it is just... decent.Anyone eating the treat in that state would perhaps recall it as delicious like you once did but for you you find it just dull and not at all comparable to the past of what the treat once was. You crave that taste it once had but as days pass by it just gets more and more mediocre more and more bland and textureless more and more boring until eventually the treat is completely textureless completely tastless and has a composition the likes of hardtack.You put the dessert down and after a while of reminiscing over how good it was you throw it in the trash.R.I.P. Rust.

review: Welcome to Rust the Bullying simulator. While rust in concept is a great idea where players can form alliances and defend their houses together while scrounging for supplies any established server where alliances have already been made makes it practically impossible to start in Rust. Expect to be shot in the face even if you don't have weapons the first few times you start the game until you can find a place to hide and when you do find a place to hide and build a base expect your base to be raided within the next few hours. Older established players will not let fresh players start on servers and will either shoot you while you are naked after you spawn or make you do some really weird stuff so that you can become their "friend". Playing rust is like hitting your head against a wall over and over again until you can't feel anything and you somehow delude yourself that not feeling anything is somehow good.

review: Sooo... Rust. Yeah what to say. As you can see I have a fair bit of hours on Rust. About 800 in the old Bear Chicken meat days. Where you could go into Rad Towns and actually find gear (not the best but good gear) instead of having to compete vs. every clan for an Airdrop. I met some of my best mates on this game. I'm generally at FPSs but I'm a strategic player. My mates were PVP gods. It all started when I gave a naked guy some food instead of killing the fresh spawn. We eventually even created our own server together so that we could play and since we were active we could get rid of all the hackers (Old RUST hacking was everywhere). Eventually we got so tired of dealing with all the hackers we shut down our server. And my main mate said "Screw it if you can't beat em join em" and started hacking on someone else's server (he was already really good at PVP didn't need hacks to kill hackers but meh). Anyway hackers killed old Rust even though the gameplay and style and people were overall better.Now to today. You have to survive spawn which is usually okay if you know what you're doing. But... spawning in the same goddamn 4 beach locations is annoying. Random Spawn should be Random like it used to be (well moreso than now). I shouldn't always have to try and run 30 mins and almost die 100000 times to get to a forest area where I can find food and make a small 1x1 just so I'm not in the "spawn" zone. Scraps WTF? Scraps is possibly the dumbest thing to be thought of in this game. Don't get me wrong I'm all for scraps to help me make something but scraps make this game near impossible for solos. The amount you have to grind and not die when trying to go to a recycler for a handful of scraps is just not logical. Get rid of the function of scraps that will help this game a lot. Allow actual Random Blueprint drops for ALL items based on location. If I go to Launch Site Red Card I should have the chance at an explosives or C4 Blueprint not the damn item. That being said make things rare again. Getting a bolty back in the day wasn't an easy task. Now you got fully kitted clans all with AKs within a few hours of a fresh wipe. Who is that fun for? And it's killing the game. When clans are too big that they take up half the server population you got a problem. Steer away from large team gameplay and start rewarded 1 4 squadplay.That being said not all is bad. I like the underwater aspects I like the boats I love the compound (because it's the only place you don't die while recycling and because a solo can skip a workbench level 1 and research table). I'm a decent fan of how you've improved some parts of crafting and how you've changed looting. I don't like the marks on the Trees/Ores though. That's gotta go. It puts you in a precarious situation and your gathering should be based off the gathering item not some buggy x marks the spot. Although I'm all about the smaller squadplay I do like the new team system. However I think it will affect skin sales. As well I think it should be reduced from max 8 to max 4. Jackhammer chainsaw and other similary are pretty cool too. You got some right but oh so much wrong. Focus on the Gameplay and interaction not the fancy features. Those of us that played with irradiated bears (and chickens) as our only chicken source didn't mind the weirdness and bugginess of it all. We just hated the hackers. Now you've got the hacker situation mostly taken care of focus back on the gameplay. I want to recommend you I really do. And I still play you. Oh and WTF? Why did you take DOWN SEA 1 FACEPUNCH and SEA 2 FACEPUNCH servers when they were the only (REALLY POPULATED) servers servicing those of us in SEA that want less than 100 ping?

review: If you don't like joining clans and just like playing solo or with a buddy do not get this game! This is as much of a co op game as i have ever seen. Guaranteed you will spend most of your time gathering stone and wood just to build and secure a small building which most likely will be raided wasting all the resources you've gathered. So like I said It's not a single player or small group friendly game at all. Big groups dominate servers by building near resource heavy areas guarding them and killing anyone that travels near. Supply drops that can give you a better chance for guns and attachments will always be taken by groups in which you'll never get. And at the end of the day you'll end up just begging for weapons and better building plans in chat. And all the while you are basically on a timer. Each server that runs this game wipes either weekly on large servers or near once a month on smaller servers. Completely wiping the server of structures built by players and often resetting player data meaning any crafting plans aka blueprints bp (weapons armor ect.) you may have found and memorized will be lost. Putting the game on a wipe timer means you are definitly going to either overplay this game or play extremely casually.I've played this game for 70 hours and honestly I felt like I acheived nothing at all in the end. Maybe a few laughs as it is fun the first few hours but it immediately turns into a farm fest really quick. At the end I basically was just hoping to log on and see my fort be raided so I could stop playing.

review: Well it's decent. I can't stop playing it yet I hate it at the same time. There are 3 big things that make this game unlikeable.1.) Trying to play SoloYou really just can't. Facepunch seemed to have made the game so that if you have friends who can dedicate 3+ hours a day to a game to help you makes the game actually fun. However if you try to play by yourself it's near impossible. It takes too long to get anything done for everything you do you're on your own and if you up well you're out of luck.2.) Building MechanicsThey just need to scrap the current system and redo the entire thing. It's really bad. A lot of the walls and you need to place down often say that you can't place them even if theres nothing in the way. And if you change your mind about your base 5 minutes after you completed it whoops! You've now wasted your materials and will not get them back. And to add on to that you can't take them down. You'll have to swing 20 rocks at your wall for 15 minutes to get it down.3.) The MMO aspectI enjoy Rust for the survival aspect for the survival part not PvP. There really aren't many good survival game comparable to rust. You can try and find a no pop server but a group is bound to come on and unsettle the server. It would be nice if in a future update you could create your own small private servers for you and maybe some friends to enjoy the game on TL DR Solo is unplayable building is restricted playstyles. But the graphics are good.

review: One of the most frustrating and yet fun experiences in this game is when you have to build a base.Building a base in this game is like being a Buddhist monk working on his/her Zen garden. Moving the sand with extreme care and deep concentration. Each passing hour the Buddhist's level of Zen increases and achieve's true understanding of the universe. One would say he/she reaches Nirvana.As the monk gazes upon his/her creation marveling at its beauty a sense of pure satisfaction fills the spirit. Only to be rudely interrupted by raiders geared with C4 explosives Rocket launchers automatic rifles and a rock destroying the entire garden leaving you with nothing . If you are lucky you live long enough to fight a hopeless battle against them as you slowly die from starvation and or dehydration.This game is not for the faint of heart and I love it

review: This game is easy to learn while maintaining a level of difficulty The community servers are all garbage though sadly the only way to earn the achievements. The majority of the community servers are barely moderated and full of cancerous clowns running around killing everyone once they get an edge it's pretty much pointless. The game has a monthly forced wipe reset which sucks but it makes the game fresh again so it doesn't get too boring and renews the challenge. Modded servers make for a much more fun and enjoyable time if you find one that matches your style they are generally better moderated and have a very friendly playerbase. Assuming you can find one that is full of friendly players raiding can still happen but you should have a base to go home to afterwards.tl dr good game bad community servers some great modded servers some challenge is good preferably on sale cause I'm cheap

review: Game that isn't really anything under the hood.If you truly want to see how much content a video game has especially a survival game play it with respect to PVE mode and not PVP.There is no single player mode on this game (though I suppose you could spin up your own server and play by yourself). The fact that this game has been developed over 4 5 years with NO story whatsoever other than "You wake up as a naked on an island and... that's it".Rust has to rely on PVP to make the game kinda worth playing. Problem is the PVP on this game is an absolute joke that requires as much dedication as an actual full time job (It's no surprise that I would guess most people who do play for the PVP content on here either are underemployed or unemployed). The reality is that I have my own committments in life so I can't be to spend so much time grinding with a HUGE PENALTY of loss as opposed to say Ark Worlds Adrift Minecraft Subnautica or any other popular survival game.Speaking of grinding the grind in this game is ing terrible and EXPLICITLY based around grouping up (or if you play solo/duels getting ass ed on sight because the community is toxic as hell). It's not uncommon for servers to be dead within 2 3 days on wipe (shoutout for weekly/biweekly wipes making the grind pointless for time investment). Of course people will say "well you just need to gitgud" and that's t because the game is so fundamentally BORING it needs offline raids to even have a sembelance of "omg such fun".I remember playing this before the blueprints were invented and the penalty of loss vs time invested was way less than what it was now. If you wanna play Rust go find a PVE server a Battlefield Server or a 1000x modded server. Vanilla is insufferable and broken at least modded communities have stepped up to the plate to correct Rust's wrongs that the Devs themselves can't seem to acknowledge.If you're out of school for the summer and have the socializing skills of a common 14 year old pimply faced this game is for you. If you work even 20 hours a week it's not. Save the cash and the frustration. The game is practically unrecognizable from when I first bought it and that's saying something.

review: Me and rust have a love hate relationship... One day I'm having fun running through the wild with my trousers off gathering wood with my trusty rock and running after a boar to get my daily dose of chicken breast while my man hood sways around in the light breeze of the wind... When the next I'm being killed by jerks with guns as soon as I spawn in or having my house being blown up by TNT.The problem with this game is that it's very incomplete. Nothing is balanced it feels like the dev team don't really know where to go with the game features are constanly being removed from the game bugs are present everywhere and the game feels VERY empty. Now most of these issues can be disregarded as it's an early alpha version but are not immune from comment.Now do I recommend people buying this game? No. Not that I think that the game is bad as I have had fun with it... Just because the game isn't finished and it's broken and probably will be broken for a few more times. You could probably buy something with that money you have there on a finished game and have more fun with less jerks and bugs!

review: Absolutely recommend! Keep in mind it's still in alpha so it's going to be glitchy. It might even be glitchy to the point of being frustrating at time. But it's best to take it with a grain of salt and keep going!I don't have a gaming computer but even with a decent laptop it runs rather smoothly on good/medium graphic settings! There's a bit of a framerate jump here and there but thats mainly because of my laptop not the game's fault. A lot of people are complaining about the community but it's easy to find a PVE server. If you're a beginner and have no idea what to do in the beginning of the game GO TO A PVE SERVER! I have found some of the most kind and wonderful people on these servers and the only threat are the wolves and bears that wander about. In my opinion the crafting and building in this game is fantastic. Grinding for resources sometimes becomes a chore but seeing the fruits of your labor is worth it. I can't wait for future updates to see how the crafting continues to grow and improve. It's a great game and I highly recommend it to anyone. I haven't had a game spark an addiction in a long time but this game has managed to do so.

review: Rating 8 10First off this is an alpha release keep that in mind the game is not complete but they do patch about once every week or so. This game is like an FPS in a few important ways. There are hackers however they are mostly on the official servers. Servers that are not in the official list are run by a person or set of people and they tend to take liberties with what they give or do for themselves. You are also in a first person perspective. That pretty much takes care of why this game is like an FPS and the admins +hackers are why I remove 2 points. When this game says survival there is something important you need to know. The survival in this game is against people! This game through and through is about PvPvP. Yes there are animals zombies radiation and hunger but these serve to carve out the world that the player interactions take place in. Interactions you say but I thought you said this was all about player killing player? No it is not all about killing and this is what makes rust amazing. I have had people help kill rob and backstab me. I have witnessed mob mentality take a group of 10 guys with rocks and turn them into murders knocking down shacks and murdering the inhabitants. The interactions in this game are truly awesome. Do I put my gun away? Risk of him getting the first shot vs him knowing I have a gun and wanting to kill me. Am I wearing armor? Does that say too much about what I have on me? Is he responding to me? Maybe he is not talking because he plans to kill me.All of those fragmented thoughts run through my head every time I meet someone. Understand another warning however. V is for using a mic if you don t have one most people will kill you before you can type a word in edge wise. This game is to high risk for typing to be anything other than a novelty or way to talk to everyone across the map. Another Warning personal space is big. Get too close and you might get shot. Let them come close and you will find yourself getting shot/stabbed. Keep a good 10 15 foot personal space barrier. Demand people put their weapon down. 100 s of hours of playing teaches you these things that you might not think of when you re in the moment for the first time with 60 wood 30 metal ore and a hatchet or something else nice. If you keep a good distance you can also get away with not having a gun or weapon out as a press of 1 6 could bring your shotgun out to deal with an over eager kid treading in your personal bubble.Overall I love this game and foresee many more an hour spent enjoying never knowing if this guy is going to work with me to get resources or murder me for them...Or perhaps I will murder him..?...
title: Rust

Or do the smart thing and join a community server!

review: Now This isnt gunna be no IGN review but I reccomend you check this one out as I have had alot of time with this game Ive played around 600 hours on both Legacy and "New Rust" and I think its safe to say (with a couple of other Open world survival games) That Rust is the best Hands Down.Pros + PvP is Good Fun and Intresting.+ Building is good allowing players to make unique bases.+ Fun is general always have you on something.+ Solo can be just as destructive as a group of 4 players.+ Raids are Good fun Solo or grouped.+ Updated frequently Inbetweens The community is alright ( Ik alot of people will hate on me for saying this but not all people kos in my experience)Cons Can be hard to run if your PC isnt as "high end" you cant run this with a potato. Hackers (Its hard to run into these guys but most big servers have one in the biggest clan you can kill them) Even with a "high end" PC you can still experience lag in gunfights (sometimes proving fatal) On big servers like Rustopia and Offiical servers if you dont have a group it can be impossible to build up ( Thankfully you can go to community servers and type in solo in the search bar for a servers with groups only as big as three people) End game gives you nothing but raids helis and airdrops to do which is still fun but I wish there was more.Overall I recommend this game to you as it is really fun and can be a even better game as they update it so frequently Personal Rate 9.5/10

review: The video on the store page looks like a great game. I couldn't wait to play it once I downloaded it. Unfortunately for me at least this game only serves as a tool of frustration. I love the premise and perhaps could enjoy the game if I could actually survive long enough to build even the simplest of tools before being killed by the veterans of the game. While it's true I only have a little over 6 hours of play time record survival time being just under 6 minutes on official servers it ends up feeling like the time I put in is forever. Usually I'll get killed running naked with a rock and torch a couple times move on to a different game try again with same results and then uninstall for a few weeks.Perhaps I wouldn't regret this purchase so much if noobs (me at least) had some chance to get into the game before feeling nothing but frustration and defeat.I will keep trying to get somewhere in this one with hopes of maybe getting a chance / break perhaps then I will at least get my money's worth of enjoyment.

review: I had originally given this game a negative review when the devs replaced the old blueprint system with an experience system that was both grindy repetitive and made everyone want to kill themselves out of boredom. Now that it is out for good and replaced with a component based system where you actually have to look for the parts to build weapons and armor I can finally give Rust the positive review it deserves. Keep in mind when you first start playing you will have a tough time with a steep learning curve. That's ok though since we've all been there. Eventually through trial and error you will hearn how to build and fight effectively enough to come out on top.Always make sure you come out on top. Other players will not even hesitate to wipe you off the map and KoS so don't cry on the forums when you yelled friendly at someone and they mowed you down anyways. Always make sure you're armed too.Weapons in this game are pretty good but recoil can be pretty tricky to control. Aiming a bow in the game is very similar to how you'd aim one in real life. The devs went through a lot of details on the guns too. There are even ricochet sounds when you shoot a rock small sonic cracks when they zoom by you and they even whizz through the air if one goes by you.Overall I highly recommend Rust.

review: Where to start??? Ok so first off the Rust community is one the best and worst communities out there. One minute you will be walking threw the forest minding your own business as a naked man/women just trying to survive in this post apocalypse world. When all of a sudden a fully gear man come running through the leaves. As you yell "friendly..." this man comes up to and hits you in the head with a rock. As you lay helpless on the ground begging for you life the man begins to bring up to your feet. Once upon your feet the man gives you some reascources to get started and then you are on your way. As you continue your journey through the wastland not five minutes after meeting that friendly face you run into him again. Instead of letting you go like he did not to long ago he put one bullet in your head and yells "F**king P****" and your are off to square one.Besides this Semi toxic community this game is very enjoyable. There are hours and hours of fun to be had in this even with or without friends. if you are on the border of buying this game. Then I recommend buying this game during a sale of some sort. I've been playing Rust sinse it had came out in 2013. While this game has its ups and downs. sinse its full released i have enjoyed the hours that i had put into it.Now I will go over some Pros and Cons that I had came up with.Pros You can have Hours of fun! Base buliding is quite good and very pleasing as you build to see your home come to life. There are plenty of different servers to fit the type of play style that you choose. You don't need to be a pro FPS player to play this game basically anyone with a mouse and keyboard can play this game. The graphics quality are pretty good even on medium to high settings.Cons Game tend to lag quite often (at least in my case). Player tend to K.O.S (kill on site) alot but thats to be expected. BUGS... While just like any other game is has its bugs and glitches. Does tend to crash more often then you would expect even when trying to close the game.I hope this Review has helped somewhat in your effort in deciding wether or not to buy this game.

review: The game is smooth and well optimized. I get a consistent 60 fps.. Is what I would like to say. This game is so fun. The gameplay is entertaining "when you arent lagging out". The experiences youll have with other people are truly special and unforgettable. The issue is the game is VERY POORLY OPTIMIZED. I am killed more by lag than by other players or the enviroment. PC Specs GTX 1070 I7 4770K 16gb DDR4I should not be having this many issues with the games performance. The game has a HUGE memory leak and the devs have known for a long time now yet they dont fix it because they are to busy adding f**king weapon skins.Please Facepunch do the gaming community a favor and fix this game. It is so god damn amazing it just needs the commitment to work out the huge performance issues. When the game isnt chewing up all 16gb of my ram the servers are lagging out. I do not recommend this game purely because of the poor optimization and the devs lack of interest to fix the huge issue. IF you want to get the gamer atleast wait for it to go on sale. Because in my opinion this game does not perform like a $35.00 game. If the devs care about this title they need to stop treating it like a cash cow and more like a passion project and put the time into where it counts. OPTIMIZATION OF SERVERS AND CLIENT.

review: At first it's pretty fun to strike out and attempt to build something while hiding from players and animals alike. However once you begin encountering more players a lot of that excitement is lost because the outcome is completely predictable. You will be shot at on sight with zero justification or verbal communication no matter how how much gear you appear to have. Once the illusion of multiple forms of player interaction is gone the game just plays as a poor first person shooter with MMO type gathering grind. It's understood that Rust is a harsh game but the playerbase has reduced what was a refreshing open world concept into a large deathmatch lobby.

review: I wanted this game really badly when I first heard of it. It was on my wishlist for 2 years until a friend of mine gave me a copy from a 4 pack. It was a dream come true the game at the top of my wishlist was finally in my library! Start up and installation were smooth but the whole thing fell on its the moment I joined a server. The whole ing thing crashed after freezing for a full 15 seconds staring at the dirt and I restarted (and crashed) twice before deciding to lower the graphics to Low. I proceed to rejoin the same server only to get slapped in the face with a pathetic 10 fps. All the excitement was replaced with frustration now and I proceed to lower the graphics to the equivalent of a stale potato. 640x480 windowed mode and everything set to absolute trash.Joined a different server with said potato graphics and get slapped with a horrible 30 fps. Tried to get something done with the measly fps only to lag so hard while walking that I crashed straight into spikes and died. Respawned tried to chase a horse with an axe only to for it to literally run through a mountain and vanish. That more or less killed the mood and I just quit.Honestly this needs to get optimized a lot. Hopefully when it gets out of Alpha the frame rates will improve and less... frustrating incidents will occur. Bugs are also all over the place although its understandable in Alpha. Unless they optimize this crap or you have a powerful computer I'd recommend playing Unturned or something.

review: I REALLY used to enjoy this game. That was the old Rust though. Years ago when it first started it was new fun and not everyone was a Now the game is so over evolved with PVP and other garbage that I just can't play it for more than 15 minutes before I give up and quit. Even the official website says "RUST has been available in Early Access on Steam since late 2013. During this time it has sold over 5 million copies worldwide." That tells you all you need to know about this game. The devs only care about the money. The more people they can trick into buying this neverending always changing box the better. Let me know when they decide to finally finish the game and/or they allow me to just chill and build stuff on my own server or offline. Then maybe I'll come back.**UPDATE**I still wish they had a single player mode and I still haven't played it again. All I have to do is read the recent reviews that all say "if you are playing it alone don't even bother". Oh well. Back to Skyrim! I play games to get away from people...not meet more.

review: In Rust it doesn't matter if you like PvP or not there is plenty to do for everyone. If you like PvP gather your group gear up with Assualt Rifles and explosives and go raid other players bases for their precious loot. On the other hand if you don't like PvP you can Build Huge bases and compounds Hunt a variety of wildlife Farm Pumpkins and Corn (More crops coming soon) Engineer machines to collect ores and oil and explore the map. The Devs at Facepunch are very active and responsive to the community by updating the game every friday and releasing their DevBlogs on playrust.com. By far its a great game in my opinion and with the introduction to Electricty and vehicles coming very soon! It is going to keep getting better and better.

review: Rust Oh Rust.Rust is a great game the resourse gavering the base building the base defense it's all fun with one big fat caveat... providing the absolutely savage and toxic as hell community allows you to get started.To me that is where this game falls apart. The community. The general Rust experience is that you spawn up and get massacared either by heavily geared players that roof camp or by a posse of naked people who are frustrated and so go on their own killing rampage.You can 'mostly' avoid some of it by joining a sever that has just been wiped. If you and your team work hard enough you can get something established and start being able to hold your own at this point the game does become great fun.It'd been a while since I last played Rust and back then it ran like poo but that isn't the case anymore it's significantly more optimised than it used to be so it runs great and looks great.Overall I recommend Rust with my only other gripe being that it's not very challenging (yes yes I know the players pose a challenge in themselves) but the core game doesn't really challenge the player enough survival is too easy.
title: Rust

review: I wish I could recomend this game. I actually love this game and wasted many hours on it. This game is all about surviving making a base getting your base broken into being killed and robbed and doing the same to others. While that sounds awful that is actually the fun of it. The problem is the unreliability of the servers. Having fun playing on a certain server? Well too bad it goes down randomly for a day. What about the server you joined that said it would wipe a month later? Well after way too many hours working on your base the mods decide to change their rules to 'we wipe monthly or if there are not enough players' destroying all your hours of work in an instant because they randomly changed their mind. Getting past the fact that everyone is out to kill you and take all your stuff is easy. Dealing with the uncertainty of the servers makes this game frustratingly unplayable. All in all a waste of my $20 and way too much time.
