review: I bought this game back in EARLY alpha when there was only one kind of meat in the game and the best weapon you could get was a bow and arrow. They have changed ALOT i recently came back to playing it and it honestly feels like an entirely different game altogether.I personally find it to be fun though ive only played with a handful of friends. For those of you who like to host your own dedicated servers this isnt the easiest but also isnt the hardest to host. There is also a wonderful program called RSM Rust Server Manager that has been developed to stream line setup and configuration aswell as find and install plugins to the server (if you want a modded one).Im fairly certain the raiding and PvP aspects are what draw alot of attention to this game however i personally like it because i can run it almost like a sandbox the maps are pretty large and are fun to explore and the building and upgrading mechanics are also pretty fun to mess around with.All in all id have to say this is a pretty good game enough so that i am willing to recommend though it isnt one of my top 10 (atleast not YET) Having seen the changes that have been made i anxiously await what comes next and hope the dev's will continue making and adding new content! &lt 3

review: After a lot of looking around I bought this game. It's really reaaaaally early access. Having said that for an early access game it's actually really good. But (before you have to read everything here) I don't recommended you buy it YET.Don't expect a story any help from the game any objectives. If I sum up what the game is about now You start on a huge island (map is impressive) and have to survive with nothing but a rock. You can interact with stuff to get more stuff. You need to eat keep warm and DON'T DIE! There are zombies but only a couple. You have to have wood and stone to make a hatchet to kill animals (the rock is too slow p) to get food and cloth and more stuff. You can build huts beds fires all those things. It is actually quite fun to do for a couple of hours.There's a lot of negative reviews about people getting killed by others constantly. I didn't have a problem with that (I managed to die on my own quite a bit tyvm p). What I did have problems with is the interface (or lack there off). No help there and it depends on the server if you can /help /who etc.TIP if you do decide to get this 'game' pick a good server!! Look for newb friendly no deterioration (unless you want to built your hut back up everytime you dont play for a couple days) instant craft (or half craft &lt that's about craft times). For now I don't think the price is worth it and well it's just not done enough for me. After a couple hours I was kind of done with it. 4/10. Not recommended at the moment. Might shape up nicely. Just keep an eye on it.

review: The component system gets a lot of hate but compared to the BluePrint and XP systems it is much much better! No longer do you need to spend days/weeks/months to learn recipies that other players already know... meaning you don't have to run around with a bow while people with AK's chase you. You can litterally craft everything good job Facepunch!!I played legacy and yeah it was great... the rebuild in Unity took a long time and I can honestly say the game is now BETTER than it was in legacy. They have made Rust Great Again! People tend to forget how many hackers there was in legacy people flying up to your lootroom and C4ing in headshot hacks and more! Those are problems that could not be solved on the legacy engine.No other survival game I have played has been able to create the suspense passion and excitement as Rust does and this of course creates a ton of salt when you lose but hey it's a game!! People who complain about people who kill on sight will eventually learn that it is the only way to survive in Rust. I personally shoot nakeds in the body to see if they have hidden guns then help them up and heal them up. You can really play this game any way you like.So yeah if you are looking for a really good steep learning curve hard core survival game and you have fire in your heart GET THIS GAME!!

review: So this is my second review for this game. My first review was positive but since then the developers have changed Rust a lot for the worse.Rust used to be a really fun game to play with your friends. You used to be able to get on as often as you wanted to and casually play. However Rust has become extremely grindy. You have to put a lot of hours in to get anywhere. You also have to play in a group or you wont be able to compete on vanilla servers with groups. Of course there should always be a perk to being in a group but the recent changes to this game has been geared towards helping groups and screwing over solo players. This game is just not fun anymore. You grind and grind for nothing. It really sucks leaving a negative review for my favorite game but it's just not there anymore. I shouldn't even call it a game anymore because it's more of a job. I was also a base builder on YouTube for Rust but the developers have ruined base building as well. I have recently uninstalled this game and I would not recommend buying it until they fix this issue they have caused.

review: Wow. I recommend Rust for all people because of how awesome this game is. You can build if your not interested in shooting other players you can trap people in your base and wait them out or kill them. You can be a salty that runs around killing people and screaming into the mic. You can run around get someone wounded taunt them and then get headshoted. Or you can actually play the game where you start from scratch get your own recorces build a base and raid other people. The choice is yours because in Rust literally anything is possible. You might even think I ll make a YouTube series out of this game! Well that. With 300 hrs on the game your still going to suck at everything. So just play until you ve got at least 1 500 hrs on it to be good because Rust is not easy. And besides who wants to watch a video of a 30 year old man dying over and over again by toxic kids who s moms don t let them play Rust but they play it anyway. In Rust you can even just join high loot servers get recorces make a raid base and then raid other people for fun. Have fun playing a complicated but amazing game.

review: Rust is the best survival game out there but does that mean survival games are still worth playing?Lets talk about what Rust does right Pros Visuals The game looks good and runs nicely the sun cutting through trees at dawn looks especially nice Freedom Provided you can survive this game allows you to build fight and overall just play how you want (Most) Weapons Most weapons are fun to use whether during a last ditch holdout or on a manhunt The little things Paintings decorations cosmetics farming modded servers these are small things that add to the overall experience of rust Monuments The locations within the island look cool and are fun to adventure into Updates the devteam at Facepunch may not make all the right choices but it is evident that they care about rust and the game is steadily updated every month with new features/items/areasCons Balance This game is extremely frustrating with how the balance between resources and players takes place. Geared players while powerful used to be able to be killed through thought out and skilled ambushes now they are able to dominate servers. The grind oh my ing gawwwwwwwwwwwwwdddddddddddddddddddddddddddd.... The stupid as hell scrap system they use now is so ing stupid. Playing on vanilla feels like pulling teeth. Unlocking things isnt fun or interesting it's literally smacking a barrel to get 1 scrap at a time towawrds a 250 scrap unlock. (at least you can recycle components but even still its painfully slow. Facepunch why they hell do you keep adding guns? We don't need guns we have every type of gun and then some why not add more primitive weapons and bring back the effective low tier weapons? Not saying ak's should be beaten by a rock but at the same time its not fun for nakeds to be running into day one ak's which control the server. This is why your servers die in a day facepunch buff primitive weapons or else servers will keep dying out Clans There is no downside to a clan it doesnt cost scrap to make anything which makes clans insanely powerful. You will either have to play in one or lose 3 days of progress.SummaryOverall the content of Rust is pretty good just the execution of how it is implementing is frustrating to no end. Don't get attached to your base unless you live in a 15+ man clan.
title: Rust

Butttttt... scientists being added into the game has made stalking and farming a problem. Double headshots insta death from a phyton wielding scientist does my head in literally.Scientists should just stay in rad towns tbh that would be the best option in my opinion.Love the new features with boats and diving kits being able to create new base designs every wipe is awesome and makes the game so much more refreshing and interesting.so cheers for a great game that i can gladly waste a load of time on.Ohh and fix your crafting times i hate having to waste 10 minutes sitting in base creating gunpowder beancans satchels.

review: It's a fun game of survival if you log the hours to learn it properly. At first you will start out roaming around trying to survive the wilderness hunt food collect resources ect. all while trying to avoid as many players as possible for you don't know if they're friendly or not. Most are not but soon you will learn to how build a base a home sweet home. Somewhere to put all of your items that you have collected put up signs make it yours then when you log off someone will bust in your improperly placed front door ransack the place take everything you have kill you and lock you out of your own house. Then you repeat the process untill you either build a great unraidable base or join a clan. This is not a game for solo players so you will have to meet people which is the most pulse pounding experience of your gaming life because it's almost like an old west standoff if they pull a gun you will have to react fast to take them down and run home with their stuff. review: After establishing a house with three of my friends I thought we were somewhat safe......I was wrong. One day one of my friends his name is Fred didn't play so it's just me and two other guys we had one key each for the house. We planned on going out to do a supply run so I told my keymaker of a friend let's call him Lemman to leave my key inside the chest. Glenn wanted to bring his key with him so Glenn and Lemman both have a key to the house while we're going out for the supply run. It's all cool I trust these guys to be careful......I was wrong again.&gt During the supply run a ing bear jumps out of the bushes and ing mauled me to death!&gt Surprise Motha a&gt Same bear killed Lemman and Glenn&gt Goodbye items goodbye keys goodbye goodbye everybody!&gt Spawned back in the house&gt Random people were outside calling us asking to open the door&gt Planned on opening the door and go all ham on these es&gt Checked the chest no keys&gt Lemman probably brought the two keys when we died&gt Locked inside our own ing house&gt Raiders left&gt Started bashing on the door with everything we got&gt Out of resources and the door is still intact&gt All three of us committed suicide multiple times just to have rocks again&gt Exhausted af Glenn and I decided to go afk for a bit&gt Lemman kept playing and gathered resources&gt Lemman attracted a hostile stranger and lead the mofo back to the house&gt Stranger kills all of us with a hatchet&gt Respawned in sleeping bag died again&gt Stranger destroyed all four sleeping bags&gt Had to respawn and start over&gt We all agreed to not let Fred know what happened11/10 would blame Lemman again

review: Where do I begin this game has been in alpha for longer than I had steam. In reality though it is still in alpha because it still needs more work.ProsIt is an incredibly good game to play as a multiplayer survival and sandbox however it does have limits with what can be created at the moment.Playing it as a first person shooter can also be good as the physics are well made for shooting and bullet drop.ConsIt's a time dump you invest a heck of a lot of time into something that is worthless something that you could lose the moment you get raided.The servers are usually massive with a lot of players each is basically a shoot first ask questions later meaning the moment you see something move you shoot it however this problem is with the players not the game so to solve it the servers reset a lot to give new players a chance.Essentially if you have time to waste get this game but if you like doing something meaningful or useful don't get it.

review: This game is great if you're friendly and have a larger group of friends to play with and protect each other or if you're one of those people that like to harass people for no reason. If you're a single person trying to be friendly and/or do your own thing then good ing luck.Anyone solo trying to mind their own business in this game is easy prey for the wanna be bandits who think gunning down someone with a rock is fun stuff.I was unfortunate enough to get my base raided while I and 3 other people were still online and inside it. We were playing friendly offering what we could to people that needed help I don't believe any of us had killed a living player yet. Some of us were having issues occasionally being KOS but it was never too much of an issue until someone actually came into our base. The worst part of it all was the fact that the guy raiding our base had actually apologized for killing me earlier and gave me wood and a pistol not even an hour before my base got raided. We ended up being heavily out gunned so finally I as well as another one of our base mates locked ourselves in our portions of the base and destroyed our supplies so the raiders couldn't get to them. When we finally managed to come outside after they left we noticed thwy hadn't even taken much if any of the stuff we left in the crates not locked up. It was almost as if they came in our base and gunned us down because they could.The scavenging and survival aspects of the game are fun it's the players that find enjoyment out of griefing people that make the game hard to play. I would not recommend this game to anyone who can't play with other friends unless they were cool with having to start over all the time even in friendly servers being gunned down repeatedly and being raided is an issue. After 48 hours of play in less than 3 days I'm still no better off than I was when I started.

review: Awesome game! Very real. Even losing everything you worked days for has a unique excitement. Every action has a permament and final reaction. But at least you can come back from the dead and take your revenge another day. Just don't take it too seriously. This game can seriously give you a heart attack.And don't let the complaints of a toxic cancerous community turn you off. Those players should go play solitaire. Rust is about gaining advantage anyway you can. Everyone is struggling to survive.I liked everyone I met on Rust even the gang that raided my little newbie solo base. After they killed me they gave me some advice on base building and even gave me my key back.Another time a door squatter replaced my sleeping bag in my base after shooting me in the head.It's all about perspective. Have fun and don't take it so d*mn seriously.

review: I purchased Rust as an impluse buy. You begin with nothing... a rock an empty wasteland and the sunlight slipping below the distant horizon into an eerie orange glow.18 hours 998 deaths and 999 lives later i stand in my ramshackle house with my handmade shotgun pointing towards my front door. There are three bandits outside. I can hear them talk to each other discussing how they will split the loot. This game can be rewarding and distressing. You get out what you put in. You can lose everything in a heartbeat.I will say that the performance can get choppy in the center of the map. Hopefully this will be resolved as the game progesses past Alpha and Beta.

review: Rust to me right now is an amazing game with the absolutely worst community ive ever seen in a game. people in the community will have you believe the game is nothing but an absolute show 24/7 when in reality its nowhere near as bad as theyd have you believe. As im writing this review i am coming up on 2k hours and there have been times where i wanted to delete the game and times where i wanted to do nothing but grind and play for days on end. Rust is a rollercoaster of events and emotions you could have an amazing time for 1 week and do nothing but destroy anyone and anything that comes across your path and then the next week be barely able to get anything done and lose everything within the first few days of wipe. The devs are constantly working on the game and realease new content to the main branch every first thursday of the month. Yes there are some things that id like them to fix or reinstate such as the old building system instead of what we have now because now i feel as though the current building system does not reward people who are more building oriented than pvp. i feel that the pvp itself needs reworking a thing id like to see is if you have no head armor if you get headshot with a bow or above you should die immediately instead of being able to get headshot and keep running. because depending on your health and distance ive seen nakeds tank SAR shots and AK shots to the head and keep going. but my main point to the game is that ive never been bored playing it. theres always something new to happen in the game thanks to the community in all its toxcicty. i 100% recommend this game to anyone that likes a challenge and wants to be apart of a community that really and truly cares about this game

review: Considering it is still in alpha stages i would rate RUST 9/10.It's a great 'survivalist' game however i'll give you a little list of things that need to be improved... The lack of zombies. they're spread too far apart throughout the map and maybe consider that the zombies can do damage to buildings. The ridiculous 'Tetris style' Inventory system. When time is of the essence you dont want to be ing around in your backpack for half an hour! Graphics could do with tweaking.But like i said before.... it's still in Alpha stages so most of the issues will get addressed.I thoroughly enjoy playing this game so for me it's a 9/10!!

review: NEW UPDATED VERSION BELOWI played Rust for a while and I came to like the game at first. It was fun but as I kept playing it was so annoying how everyone killed you and it was so hard just to craft a basic house with a sleeping bag. I finally made a house after maybe 3 4 hours of playing. Sure it might not sound like a long amount of time but it wasn't excatly so fun getting all that wood. Once I finally built it I was pretty proud of myself. Then I quit the game. Only 18 hours later I came back on and my house despawned. My house that I worked so hard for despawned! I hate that feature you lose all your stuff and it makes you play constantly if you want to keep your stuff safe. It's ridiculous plus there's the lack of crafting and how hard it is to craft many items. Definitely not worth the $20! I would give it a 5.4/10. Sure it's an early access game but still maybe it was a little too early. But if they changed the despawn feature and added more items to craft and less hackers I would give them an 8/10 but until they fix that I wouldn't really play the game again since it s a waste of money and time.Edit The despawn feature has been lightened up a bit and the hackers have slimed down tiny bit. 6.5/10Since my last review the game has been fixed a lot and I like that. Though it has it's fair share of frustrations the new crafting system and interface makes up for it. It's great fun with friends or jsut meeting random people. Not a game for mac though!That review is trash Rust is lit as who doesn't love running around naked beating people to with rocks?

review: Game has been full of hackers and dupers from the start.Duping has _always_ been in the game. Usually at any given time half the players know it via youtube videos.. the other half or newbies pretend its not happening.. banwave every 3 or so months then they find a new way.Why does it matter? Because its a resource scramble game and once people dupe rockets and c4 your base is blown up every night.. for everyone.. on the server.Developer took all the $ and never finished the game.. this was 3 years ago.. Went on to spend all his time on other.. so so terrible projects.. thinking he was a big game developer now.Other problems from start never fixed Servers wipe very often no persistent world. ESP hacks quite common. Private servers with bad admins spawning themselves goodies. Public servers that are hackfests with no admins. BAD attitude developer who is " you" to his customers all the time. Terrible community where cheating is openly boasted about with pride on in game chats on any server. "If everyones doing it.."Had potential but don't waste your time. This will never BE finished. Just DECLARED finished.

review: I was unsure whether to recommend or to NOT recommend this game. If it wasn't for the fact that it is still in the Alpha stage I wouldn't recommend it. The game itself is interesting and certainly playable.One of the many problems this game has is that you cannot play solo. If you wish to play by yourself you have to join a server that no one else is playing.Also the game itself would be more fun if you could find more things in the world.Here is a list of the things I wish could be changed Spawning. Every server I join starts with saying I have died and then I spawn somewhere that's a dangerous place to be so I have to leave immediately (radioactivity). The ability to play solo. Adjustable graphics settings. Motion blur ALWAYS makes any game I own lag way more than it should. Therefore I usually turn off this setting. But in Rust there are no adjustable settings that I have been able to find.But I must say that the game itself isn't too bad. You can craft and build and hunt all with nice graphics.

review: Let's get things straight. I love rust. I love the feel of it. Not having to deal with 16x16 blocks and instead being able to build what you want where you want when you want. There are more weapons more tools and ways to repair them. Radiation and PVE are both good ideas. But at the same time those things are all made unimportant except when you have a mind for PVP.If Rust had a singleplayer mode or even a way to protect your buildings past "here put this cupboard somewhere people can't break it so they can only destroy with items they've likely spawned in" so you have an option to not deal with the horrid PVP. I'm not asking for a creative mode no I realize Rust's playerbase is it's lifeblood but I'm sick and tired of having a modest wooden house that some douchecanoe sees as just another person to conquer even though they already have all of the blueprints and all of the weapons/wood/metal/stones/tools/buildings they need.So no I don't recommend rust because it along with every other "survival" game out there has some sort of horrid mandatory PVP aspect that nobody can really opt out of.

review: Rust is a game of trial and error.if you are nice you can get away with allot.go ask a man with a ragtag base and stolen stopsigns and city markers for clothes for some stuff and im sure he will most likely tell you to off. but you may be able to find some nice people who wouldbe happy to help considering that they have came from a place like yours.you win some you lose some.its a 3 steps forward 2 steps back kind of game.untill you make that big sprint toward success.then the game is a breeze. once you get the mechanics dialed in and you find you favorite guns and attachments.(AK with silencer. lazer and holosight)you will deal just fine.you will get some knocks on your door with either one of 2 things.one being a lonely naked looking for some wood stone fuel or tools. i say help them out.you may make some friends along the way alsoor its the second optiona angry asian (or russian) weilding some explosive with his friends.then after the smoke has cleared from the valiant attack start from square one )in all honesty this game has grabbed my heart and i have spread this love onto many others through my 800hrs playing this game and im sure if you buy this and give it a go you will have the same results.11/10 more than a game #SpreadTheRustLove...

review: Rust is a unforgiving pvp survival sandboxRust will test your patience. It will test your ability to endure failure. Rust rewards those who play the whole day through wee hours.Not for the weak.I'm eager to see what the future holds for this one. While it's safe to say that I've recently become familiar with the consepts of crafting and surviving in general this game still offered a new and fresh experiense for me and I've already had dozens of hours fun time playing it.However there is still very much to wait for in terms of new content and bug fixing as well as anti hacking. At this point of development I would say that it isn't worth its price unless you have good friends to play it with or if you would get a big discount for it.EDIT Currently as of April 2017 there is a major hacker epidemic going on. And for that reason alone I can't recommend to buy this game currently. It has made the game literally unplayable for me.EDIT 2 July 2018 No more noticeable hacking. Development has been going in the right direction.Rust is still a long way from a finished product but updates are flowing in constantly. At the current pace it seems that maybe after 2 3 years the game will finally be finished.I can recommend the game again.For casual players I would wait until the game is complete. (Or if you have a good group to play it with)

review: Rust the game we are talking about is a very fun and neat game. It has so much content to offer you could spend hundreds and thousands of hours and not get very bored. I highly reccomend you and possibly your friends to get and play the game. The reason why I say "Friends" is because of the fact that rust inspires you to have a person to watch your back. And it's hard to have a solo game and not end up completely naked. It even has a system to almost revive people. But even without friends it still can be fun! My point is if you're in the mood for a good survival game rust is the answer. But even though I have said wonderful things about the game there are a couple of things you should be aware of before entering. BAD TRAITS Now as with all succesful games there are big bad traits of it. It's very natural. So some examples for rust are It can take a while to get into a good server or one with good ping. It could take a couple minutes before you can load the server and after that it can take even longer! My first time I got on a server it took 10 min atleast. So there you are. You just got into a server then you start to wonder "What should I do?". Rust is hard to first learn like many other games. But for rust the first moments are much more cruel. It can make you hate the game at a instant. Also watch out before you buy this and check the requirments for the game. Make sure your PC is up to date with them or you will suffer. Moving on lets say you just spawned everything is beautiful and you know the basics. So your harvesting trees then all of a sudden a person with a bow headshots you twice bringing you down. Thing is this person is 1/8 of the map away or 2/8. There are cheaters in the community like other games. And to be honest it isnt too bad but Im just saying this to let you understand that it is a bit common to see them. But other than these things and a couple of bugs and glitching it's pretty much fine. CONCLUSION Rust is a great game and though it has some problems it is all round a really neat game and I highly reccomend to you if you dont have it. It is a bit costy but it's worth every dollar. If you dont want to pay that much just wait for a sale. Anyways I conclude my giant talk about the game and I hope you get it and enjoy yourself. If you need any tips on it go to rustyard or watch some yt vids. Anyways thanks for reading and have a great day!
title: Rust

review: This game could be so great but unfortunately the toxic community is quite honestly the biggest contributing factor to this games downfall. Another key reason on why Rust has become less than liked by many is the optimization Rust runs rather poorly even on some of the most highly specced machines especially when raiding and rendering enormous objects. This forces those who have spent large amounts of money on high end machines to dial back the settings which they should be able to enjoy (in all their glory) in order to obtain reasonable performance.

review: I remember the first time I logged in like yesterday. I came into the world naked a man a rock and a dangling in the shadows. I was alone and obviously far from others. I gathered resources built a house got chased by zombie looking bears. I managed to escape. I had heard stories of death and destruction. I saw none of that for a few days. Then one night sitting ontop of my house with a fire going in the moonlight. I saw torches coming through the woods. Five of them I put out my fire and hid in my house. I grabbed my pipe gun and feared the worst. Then voices at my front door "Hey dude wanna join us?" I was hesitant at first. After seeing youtube videos I decided to chance it. I opened my door and they walked me to a huge house with a few other houses scattered around it. I was like cool. Then some guy says "Hey that is the guy that robbed my house the other night!" Before I could even retort my innocence. I was met with a gun blast to the head. When I respawned at my house the sun was up and 20 people outside my house and boom the wall exploded. They rushed me and killed me again. After ramsacking my house I logged back in with one apologizing they found nothing in my house to indicate I was the person that robbed him as I had nothing. Made friends and built a nice house with a large group. Next day.... server was reset everything was gone. Recently I logged back in on another server. It was a PVM so I ran around in the night looking for anything. Something was odd. I had a rock and a torch and big boobies. WTF? I could see them in the shadows of the sun coming up against the rocks. Hey where did my dangling go? Man this justs feels umm wrong. I check my paper doll and staring at me is a bald big booby woman. Logged out checked the forums. Seems I am stuck this way. Yeah umm not sure I wanna run around as a naked chick. Pros Was a good game. Lots to do and explore.Lots of new stuff It has women toons now.Uninstall works great.Was good while it lasted.Cons Not liking they removed my Actually preferred the game back when it had zombies.No zombies.I love female body parts I really do. I just don't want to run around feeling like Catlin Jenner. I miss my I want my back. If I wanted to play as female. I will Bruce Jenner my off and get plastic surgery. Just kinda sad I didn't play with them first before I logged out and uninstalled.Yet it is still a good game just wish you could choose gender.

review: Rust is a survival game a lot like DayZ and H1Z1 where you spawn in a world with a rock and a torch and you have to collect materials from places and make bases and find players. Sound great but this game the more I have realized has just turned into a rock and tree collecting simulator as you really don't find people that often and raiding is only really possible if you have C4 which is very rare to find. Yes I said find. You can't make it you have to find a blueprint for it in a barrell somewhere in the map. There are no fun gamemodes like H1Z1 has it's just straight up survival. Now don't get me wrong I really like this game but compared to other survival games it's not better.Pros and Cons + Great graphics and animations+ Big open worlds+ Animals C4 is impossible to find making base raiding also impossible It is mostly just farming materials when you make a house Good game needs more to be better than or close to H1Z1 or ARK Survival Evolved

review: I wish I hadn't paid 20$ for this game. Garry basically took the unity3d engine added some ugly models a build system and a weak combat system. All the hard stuff like procedural terrain and tree generation pathing 3d rendering positional audio etc is all provided by unity (which is free). Every patch has a tendancy to break many mods that make the game playable and usually requires a server reset. There's no way to load custom maps nor can you run your own dedicated server without begging Garry on the forum for a beta key. It's still fun ish but as it is now it's not worth 5$.

review: Holy almost 400 hours into this game. You will not believe what I've been through. Good and bad there's ALOT more to this game than you think. You spawn with a rock torch and two bandages. This game got me to the edge of my seat and my heart pumping it made my back hurt and I passed out for a bit. Everything about this game is wonderful. review: Oh Rust... It's a love/hate relationship.This game is immersive to the point where you lose track of time and realize it's 3AM. You'll dream about it you'll worry about your base while you're offline. This game is a lesson in psychology and defensive maneuvers. I would absolutely recommend this game if you have friends who play too. Soloing in this game is extremely difficult and you'll learn quickly that no one can be trusted everyone is your enemy.Warning if you already have high blood pressure this game may literally end your life.

review: soo i guess to start off this is a pretty sweet game. realistic in some ways utter bs in others. the hackers are a annoying and honestly i have never seen anything done about it soo clearly theyre here to stay because some admins wont just hit the kick button. OTHER than hackers this game is amazing. the ai controlled animals are quite predictable but can still provide a good challenge at certain times through the game whether its taking a wrong turn in a rad town with only a rock or hatchet or losing an enemy in a nice field of bears and wolves. its fun building a base and being able to wage war with whomever looks dangerous. gets alot better with friends especially when you form a group in game and raid the big homes and build walls around the small ones. the experimental version i havnt played enough to form an opinion on soo will update when i feel its gotten to a more playable phase. im not sure what the devs backgrounds are like and im starting to feel (with how far along dayz 7 days to die etc are) that they bit off more than they can chew. i respect that they still put out updates and communicate to a degree with the community but they need to make this worth playing the experimental. whether this was a waste of money and time idk yet but for 20 bucks ive had plenty of fun with more to come. worth a try if u like building im giving it a 6.5/10 for now. put rad towns and loot crates back and ill make that a 7.5.

review: This game turned out to be a real let down. When I originally bought it it was supposed to be a zombie survival style game. Than b/c it was apparently to difficult to get that portion of the game right they dropped it. That right there was a buzz kill. Since than it has been getting improved however the gaming community is just ruthless and the fact that you start off being hunted like a piece of meat with nothing but a rock to defend yourself really doesn't help. Now if you are able to spawn in and get to a secluded area it's actually not bad. Especially once you get going with your resources and building up. The reason I would not recommend it is because any game where it starts as one thing than that thing is to hard to do so the devs drop it is not a game the devs are truly trying to get working the way they initially scripted it. And that to me is a huge blow to the devs. With a friend it's a good game to kill time if you can get seperated from all the people just looking for free kills.

review: Meh. You start the game naked with a rock and a torch. No idea what the objective is no idea what to do or where to go. (Free range map.) The tutorial was limited to a quick list of what the keys are. You die pretty quick whether it's a bear slowly starving (some area have very limited food to find) or one of the numerous other players kills you for no reason. You then respawn (in a random spot) with a rock and a torch. All the items you found are gone. If you google how to play you learn you need to make a building and a sleeping bag to 'save' your progress but other people will quickly steal your items if you don't google how to build a building with a lock and storage containers. All in all it's a decent game with a good idea but the lack of any tutorial and the mass of people who just kill every noob they see make it very difficult to get started.

review: Alright. I thought I'd put in the effort to write an HONEST review of this game that doesn't simply hate because the devs aren't going the exact direction that everyone wants there is never gonna be a looting crafting building raiding etc. system that makes everyone happy it just doesn't happen. With that being said I thought it would be beneficial to have an objective review of this game from day 1 literally so that new players can actually determine what the truth is on this game.Alright lets start from the top.BuildingBuilding in this game has stayed more or less constant over the last year or so since the rework from Legacy and in my opinion it is far better than Legacy in most aspects. For me building in Legacy Rust was truly terrifying and not because of raiders. In Legacy if you misplaced even one pillar there was a pretty good chance that your entire base would be ruined forever because there was no hammer to destroy with and no levels of strength such as twig that make it easy to destroy until its upgraded. Whatever you put there stayed there until an Admin removed it or it was blown up. I cannot even explain the rage of farming up 15k wood (that was a lot in Legacy) and building the exact specs for your dream base storing them having an armored escort to go build said base and have one pillar lag out and be misplaced ruining your base forever. This is one great strength of the new building system. The addition of the building plan multileveling walls and the hammer was truly a relieving addition from Facepunch and that is what makes the new building system a lot better than the Legacy system.Nothing is perfect however. With the new building system came Tool Cupboards. Facepunch had a very good reason to add this item to the game as it was to prevent raiders from being able to build right up the side of your base like they were able to do in Legacy. But with adding this item comes a whole bunch of problems that still plagues Rust today. Mainly if the raiders get to your tool cupboard its pretty much GG and there's no way to really change that. There was a certain honor in building a base that was "Raid proof" and defending it to the end and if the raiders beat you they beat you. Today however they can simply use 2 c4 or 4 rockets in some cases take the cupboard build up your airlocks or honeycombs and get the loot far easier if they hadn't be able to. This to me is a fatal flaw in the building system even though it is FAR superior to the original system in Legacy. Despite Facepunch trying a bunch of updates and patches and fixes to attempt to remedy this problem I don't think that it is simple possible with such an important and powerful item in the base to simply negate its effects. Yes hatch doors make things MUCH better than stair airlocks but it still doesn't fully solve the problem because raiders can still build up to hatches they otherwise would not be able to reach.CraftingWow where do you start here. This topic has been the fighting words of Rust since day one. Whether it was the BP XP or the new component system there is just so many things to consider when analyzing the crafting in this game. For me the current crafting system in this game is SUFFICIENT. The component system does its job for the most part. I think that there was a very good side to the OG BP system that was in Legacy and although there is no system that can perfectly cover all aspects of crafting I think that the BP system felt the best over a long period of time. However the component system in this game does prevent massive groups of people from getting way to powerful in early game but once a certain threshold is reached there is no stopping anyone with this system. The components such as rifle bodies and others are just too easy to find at Mil Tunnels and other monuments in the game. If I ran monuments for 5 hours I'd have enough rifle bodies for an army of AK's and enough tech trash to smash anyone on the server and thats just me. With groups of 5 plus there's no stopping people from having very powerful components after about a day. RaidingOuch. Raiding in Legacy was fun. This game was interesting to me soley because I could steal from others. Why bother doing any hard work when I can take what someone else worked hard for? Raiding in this game is a shell of what it used to be. The days of attacking a base with defenders fighting for their lives are gone. My main problem with the raiding in this game is the ability to repair walls or build new ones in the midst of a raid. Why bother using satchel charges over c4 if the defender can just repair the wall as you go or place a new one as soon as the old one is blown off. And that's just the start. The implementation of an overwhleming number overly powerful defense mechanisms in bases or simply boring raiding due to tool cupboards make the raiding experience woefully incomplete. Imagine farming sulfur for 3 days (I'll get into that later) crafting rockets building the raid base working your way into the base just to have the loot despawned. Its pathetic. There has to be some sort of mechanism to ensure raiders get the loot that is inside the base. And that's if you can get past the autoturrets high external stone walls land mines bear traps repaired walls and airlocks. The trade off between what is needed to raid and what is needed to build a base is well out of proportion. In my experience it took a group of 11 people 3 days of farming to raid and loot one base that was built by a solo player. How is that a balanced system? Also raids are either way too difficult or way to easy making them boring. I have never raided a base successfully that contains a motherload of loot nor have I raided a base unsuccessfully that contains very little loot. There is simply a curve that is too steep for raiders to get into bases that are actually enjoyable to raid. I mean google "Epic Rust Raid Cam" and you'll be left wondering how was that worth for the raiders? And how can a group of 30 40 people barely get into a base built by 5? Needless to say Raiding in the new Rust has been my biggest letdown in this game. FarmingOuch again. This game could easily be renamed farming simulator and its not just some joke its true. The amount of time a group of 10 people have to spend to earn the resources they need to pull off anything worthwhile in this game is mindboggling. My group of 6 each spent 105 hours over a week and half playing the game and were BARELY able to resource enough sulfur to pull off ONE meaningful raid on the last day of the 2 week wipe cycle on a base of 5 people. Along with this complaint is my main issue with farming and ultimately raiding in this game its pointless at times. Why bother farming 120k stone for a base when you could lose it and just farm it back in a day. Why bother farming to raid a base of your enemy when they can just farm back what they lost in under 24 hours? This game at times is literally a farm fest. Whoever plays the most and is the most active wins period. OverviewI loved this game. It is undoubtedly the best game I have ever purchased and it was truly an enjoyable experience for me to play. With that being said I think that the current path the game is on although not soley the fault of the devs is going to bring the demise of this game in the future. There are simply too many shortcomings for me that greatly devalue the experience and the end game wipe cycles mind boggling amount of time farming etc. I cannot say that I would recommend someone to buy this game as it CURRENTLY is because you require so much time friends and knowledge the of the game to even compete on servers. Although I can't recommend it Rust is still a hell of a game or at least it used to be. Zink
title: Rust

review: I would recommend this game to anyone. Just keep in mind that when you start its better to begin your learning on a low population server. This way you can learn the mechanics of the game and understand how the irradiated world works. The reason I mention this is because there are a LOT of trolls in Rust. As long as you take the time to learn watch some videos and enjoy yourself while surviving in an unforgiving landscape filled with looters and wolves and bears and cactus... Just play it you won't be sorry.My rating 9/10This game has a lot yet to be seen but the amazing mod community working on Oxide products more than make up for what the game lacks in its current state. Can't wait to see whats next!

Be very careful who you befriend as they can very easily turn their back on you and kill you. Avoid the helicopter at all costs that thing is the devil and wil devour you and keep on moving. But overall I like the game a lot and for sure would recommend it to a friend.
title: Rust

review: I was hesitant to buy this based on some of the reviews I had read. I am glad that I made the purchase even though I am playing solo. It can be frustrating at first but if you find a decent server and perservere it can be quite enjoyable especially once you build a base/sleeping bag. There are a lot of griefers but there are quite a few helpful people as well from what I can gather. Rust certainly isn't going to be for everyone but it seems to accomplish it's goal quite well.I have never had some of the adrenaline rushes that I have experienced over the past 15 hours since I started playing this game. I can honestly say I have laughed out loud while I am running naked through the woods with nothing but a spear all the while being hunted by a veteran with an AK47.Do yourself a favor and gather wood/cloth as quickly as you can so you can make a base and a sleeping bag. Once you have the bag you respawn in your base and (hopefully) wont have to start from scratch as often.Good luck but stay the hell away from me )

It's still too unoptimized to the point where I would go from having 80 100FPS then suddenly some random open field areas would drop me to mid 40's. Thats with a 4th gen i7 and a GTX 1070. Solo is pretty much unplayable now with the upkeep. Researching new blueprints takes too long for a solo player. 750 scrap for one item? It just isn't the same game it used to be.

review: Amazing game. However I will warn the new players that this game has a very large learning curve. You'll have to learn the map learn to navigate learn to shoot learn to farm and learn to survive all at the very begining. Trust me this is a challenge and at times it can be frustrating and at other times down right disheartening. If the learning curve wasn't bad enough the majority of servers you'll be playing in are kill on sight(KOS). Granted this doesn't sound very fun once you can get passed the "I don't know where I'm" stage this game is very rewarding and extremely fun to play alone (as I did for the most part) or with a group of friends. Building a base raiding a base or getting raided yourself are some of the best times in this game. If you can stur up alittle drama against a clan or multiple clans the better. BUY THIS GAME.

review: I wanted to love this game sadly My computer is just nowhere near beefy enough. I can run the game on 800x600 to some extent however The Inventories are not able to be moved and are super overlapped and all over the place. I'd recommend a fairly beefy graphics card and probably 8+gb of ram I mean I thought I'd be fine on a quad core AMD 2.8ghz a core 6gb ram and a Geforce GT 430 but I guess not. 800x600 Lowest settings was maybe like 45 50fps with super crappy inventory screens. If you have my specs or lower I'd suggest like a mod or something that changes menu size and the like or just wait til the game is further optimized otherwise you'll be wasting at most $19.99. I want to play more but when you can't even menu correctly How will you survive a harsh enviroment if you can barely craft.IF YOUR MACHINE IS BEEFY AND MUCH BETTER THEN MINE AND CAN RUN AT LEAST 1280x800 THEN BY ALL MEANS GET IT If not keep your distance.

review: This game is so much fun it's a shame how poorly it runs even on high performance computers. It has left Early Access which is great but I feel like the devs are adding more unnecessary content instead of fixing the current problems everyone experiences with the game. I do still feel this game has a lot of potential and is a lot of fun. It has provided many hours of entertainment and has created many friendships through playing. I recommend this game for people who have good computers have a lot of time to play games and enjoy dying over and over until they learn how to play. This game is hard but is very rewarding to exceptionally talented players. I will update this review once some or most of the lag bugs and hacker issues are fixed.Pros Weapons variety Component and blueprint system Building and crafting PVE and PVP Updated monthlyCons Guns are inconsistent (aimcones) Runs poorly on most computers Frequent lag spikes/stutters Toxic community Bugs/hackers

review: I reviewed this game a long time ago but I feel like I need to change my review to a not reccomended. In the good ol days people like me (solo lads) could sit out in the middle of the forest and hit trees and rocks untill I had all of the things required to make cool guns and bases. Now the only (realistic) way to progress is join a large clan/ group and farm the rad towns. I dislike this because it makes pvp a near requirement and forces people to build pvp hotzones. I much prefered the game when I never had to see another player my entire game unless I wanted to. so in summary I dislike the new blueprint system/ scrap system.
title: Rust

review: ''This game is great fun mixed with intense fear and ongoing frustration. All in all is something I find very hard not to play. Buggy at times along with fps problems that will be fixed after beta''This is something I firmly believed before..... I had hope for change with this game. This was one of my all time favourite survivals that had infinite potential but has been screwed because of todays game design mentality. Publish a game as fast as possible not caring about polishing mistakes or making it appear better or run better or just be the best it can be not listening to the whining of us impatient millennials. DO THE BEAR MINIMUM. That's Face Punches attitude and has lead to a full relise of a game that cannot sustain 60fps with an i5 6400 and GTX 1050 Ti 4gb vr ram. Very very disappointed. Bad FPS (STILL) Random Bottlenecking and micro stutters. Loading time is a joke. Interface is filled with glitches and clicking on too many things too fast will crash the game. Toxic community (16 year old admins who have major control issues and like watching traps.(NOT GAY BRO)

review: 1st review 8/102nd review 10/103rd review 7/104th review 0/10 and now... 10 / 10never EVER buy it it was advertised as pvp based survival game BUT the pvp wasn't needed 100%. By this i mean that you could have loot without killing anybody and yeah someone will kill you but that was like 25% of the time. This was legacy.Then the weekly updates started adding... weapons.attachmentsSKINS FOR WEAPONSeven more weaponsnew raiding toolsCARS ARE GETTING INTO THE GAME (even the biggest map is too small for a car)With these awful and useless additions to the game the developers didn't have time to produce quality content and only gave us weapons and weapons and weapons...SINCE EARLY ACCESS THERE HAS ONLY BEEN 1 MORE ARMOUR AND CLOTHING SET and that's just sadonly 2 SETS OF TOOLS ARE NEW TO EARLY ACCESS.Now the game is PVP ONLY. The only place where you'd actually find friendly people is nowhere. There are modded servers but it's too easy on them and the fun of grinding for your base is basically gone. The official servers have rules for no s and toxic players and yet everybody spews racial slurs kills on sight and just tries to harm the community whenever he can.If you check the older reviews wayyy below mine you'll see how good the game WAS and how many positive reviews there WERE.i have 578 hours in this game and i do not regret them. I've played Rust when it was actually good and worth the time invested into it. If you wish to play it now just go play Fortnite. It's basically the same at this point.THE GAME WAS FUN AND ENJOYABLE don't get me wrong but Facepunch made it into a battle royale. Fukc you Facepunch for ruining a great game.
title: Rust

review: One of my most favorite survival games by far. I would definitely recommend to anyone whose into the whole sandbox survival type of games. This game has delivered quite an interesting experience for me in my opinion. What first started out during the first introduction of blueprints has had me going through the game to the new BP system.Through this game surprisingly i've made some pretty decent friends people who are actually down to Earth. But the rush this game has always been something I have never had. You get something of value but don't have a house yet? You have to play in a way that you try to keep this item while staying alive. Sometimes things don't always go as planned and you have to try make a play to fix that mistake. The randomness of this game is what sometimes makes it great. Killing someone who has tons of loot getting into massive fights honestly is the best part. Playing solo is a challenge that I love personally and pushes me to greater heights in game sense and PvP. Playing with friends/group? Well things get a bit easier and maybe more fun depending on how you see it. Didn't take a helicopter until I played with a group and it was an amazing experience.Would love to play more and seriously recommend but the amount of scripting and hackers on official servers in which I frequent are just insane now. ($5 accounts are being sold with only Rust on the account and people just hack on em') Officials are the only servers that really stay populated and hold many new players. Think officials where most people get started since most secure servers require an hour limit are not the best anymore for newer players and if you are new you should move to a community server (but those die off quick). In the end it's up for the individual to decide. Every decision in this game that you make counts. )

review: Rust is an awesome game where u can try to survive in a open world (kinda like a modern minecraft). You can gether some loot around the map and start crafting items for building weapons clothing etc.With the building items u can create your own "base" (house) try to make it as strong is possible! Because the term "Raided" is often used people are trying to get your items so they dont have to go around the map for it.I would suggest this game to any one who likes to play in a open world like building stuff and fighting and raiding other people.

review: This game is brutal. There really isn't any other way to put it. The people who continue to play it are a whole other breed. Theres something about how no matter how much you work grind and struggle everything can still be taken out from under you. It's and unforgiving survival game easily one of the more challenging ones and depending on you personal ability you will make it a certain length through material possesion. I hate to say it but it really is quantity over quality sometimes. The clans here are only there because they work. They roll over the smaller guys. Thats the reason duo and trio servers work. Every fight is fair game and every chance for sucess comes from your own determination to better yourself your team and your chances to dominate the server.

review: Review from a Solo Player's Prospective 7/10 In the current statePros Adrenaline rush Base building (Design matters) Progression Beautiful looking game Admirably active devs Expansive game world with many features such as abandoned structures caves and natural landmarksCons Endless grind be prepared to group up with people to get things done before others have guns and will shoot you on sight Unbalanced It is even harder than it used to be for small groups to have weapons/raiding gear and makes those in large groups nearly invincible Some major bugs (Animals walk through rocks)Overall I always have a fun time playing this game but it is less fun when I find myself online for hours on end in order to get even a single gun only to lose it in a 1 vs X fight.
